loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo S.  has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. She first applied to MicroInvest for a business development loan and thanks to the previous loan she was able to increase her business turnover. Now she has opened a stall in the Kairakkum bazaar selling vegetables. She sells the various sorts of vegetables that are grown in her garden. She works hard in the garden so she likes the business she is engaged in. 

Mrs. S. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of 2200 STJ for 6 months for importing seeds  and increasing the area of her garden.

loans.use: importing seeds and increasing the area of her market garden

loans.name: Aoua

texts.fr:
Madame Aoua Traoré  est une femme de 40 ans, mère de 2 enfants (1 fille et 1 garçon) qui vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Koboïla II, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Secrétaire Dactylo de formation, elle est issue d’une famille de teinturière de Quinzanbougou un des quartiers de Bamako( capitale de la république du Mali). Elle mène cette activité (qu’elle avait mise en veilleuse pour des raisons d’études) depuis bientôt 10 ans. Très connue et appréciée et sa clientèle ne cesse d’augmenter de jour en jour.
Afin de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle rejoint le programme crédit de l’institution Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 2 ans . Elle est à son premier prêt (prêt individuel) et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 18 pièces de bazin blanc (tissus très prisé en afrique de l’ouest), 250kg de soude caustique et 19 kg de teinture de couleurs différentes.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teintures) Elle teint les tissus dans son atelier en face de son domicile. Ensuite elle les revend au comptant ou à crédit; généralement à des revendeuses des bazins teintés, à des couturiers de la place  et à certaines femmes de son quartier.
 MadameAoua Traoré envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour les dépenses importantes de la famille, payer les intèrêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aoua Traoré, 40, is the mother of 2 children (one girl and one boy) who lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse, and their children in Koboïla II, a neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Trained as a secretary and typist, she comes from a family of dyers in Quinzanbougou, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). She has been active in this business (which she had put on the back burner while she was studying) for almost 10 years. Well-known and appreciated, her clientele grows from day to day.

In order to satisfy this ever-growing clientele she joined the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. She is requesting her first individual loan and intends to use it to buy 18 pieces of white "bazin" (cloth that is highly prized in West Africa), 250 kg of caustic soda, and 19 kg of dye of various colors.

She buys her raw materials in Bamako (white "bazin", caustic soda, and dyes). She dyes the cloth in her workshop opposite her home. Then she sells it for cash or credit; generally to women who themselves re-sell the dyed bazin, or to seamstresses or certain women from her neighborhood.

Mrs. Aoua Traoré expects to make a profit of 200,000 FCFA which will be used essentially for larger family expenses, and to make payments on the loan and further reinforce her dyeing business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bazin (damask cloth), dye, and caustic soda

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El Sr. Ceferino tiene 51 años y esta casado con la Sra. Eva, tienen 2 hijos, ambos están en edad estudiantil.

El Sr. Ceferino tiene una herrería hace 16 años en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se dedica al arreglo de llantas de los colectivos, hace portones sobre pedido y algunas obras más.

Esta profesión aprendió de su padre quien se dedico a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo, quien le ha enseñado todo lo que sabe. La Sra. Eva trabaja en el Poder Judicial hace bastante tiempo. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos, pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda.

En el futuro tiene pensado abrir un local grande para poder mostrar sus mercaderías y mayor venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ceferino is 51 years old; he is married to Mrs. Eva and they have 2 school aged children. Mr. Ceferino has owned a blacksmith shop for the last 16 years in the city of San Lorenzo. He makes a living fixing the tires; he also makes gates by order and other odd jobs.

He learned this profession from his father, who worked in this trade for a long time and showed him everything he knows. Mrs. Eva has worked at the judiciary for a long time. Thanks to the efforts of both, they have been able to build their home.

In the future, they are thinking about opening a large shop where they can display their products and therefore increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will use this loan to purchase iron.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh S. tient une quicqillerie sur le boulevard 54m au quartier de Tiléne. Avec la vente des piéces détachées il arrive à faire vivre son épouse et ses 3 enfants.
Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce et gagner davantage de profits.
texts.en:
Cheikh S. has a hardware shop on the Boulevard 54m in the suburb of Tiléne. With the sale of spare parts, he manages to support his wife and his three children.

He is requesting this loan to bolster his business and make more profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand his hardware business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S., 54 ans est mariée et a la charge de 04 enfants qu’on lui a confiés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Fatou est propriétaire d’un atelier de couture et elle vend des céréales aussi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des tissus (bazin et percale), des fournitures, une machine à coudre ordinaire, des céréales et des emballages pour renforcer ses activités de couture et de commerce.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children to support, who were entrusted to her. She's been a member of the CESIRI village bank for one and a half year. Fatou owns a sewing workshop and she also sells cereals. She's seeking a loan to buy fabrics (Bazin and percale), supplies, an ordinary sewing machine, cereals, and packagings, in order to bolster her business. The loan she's seeking will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, one sewing machine, supplies and cereals

loans.name: Lich Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Lịch tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Trong hơn 10 năm  vay vốn của Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đều sử dụng vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị .Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị đều có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con đã đi làm nên kinh tế gia đình rất ổn định.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vốn đi thu mua phế liệu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lich Thi N. joined the TYM fund in 1997. For 10 years, she has been using loans to run her business. She buys junks from people and then sells it back to factories. At the moment, the family’s income comes mainly from this business. She also receives supports from her children, who are working; therefore, the family financial situation is stable. She plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more  scrap

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc.
Marina es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Marina tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado en la Av. Arenales, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de un personal, también vende bebidas. Marina tiene proyectado aperturar un restaurante en la ciudad de San Francisco.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas y sillas.
Los sueños de Marina son construir su casa, tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the community bank “Imasumacc”. Marina lives with her partner. She is 22 years old and has a son. She own a restaurant in a rented place located in Av. Arenales. The restaurant is opened every day and she is assisted by her personnel. She also sells beverages. Marina’s project is to open a second restaurant in the city of San Francisco. She needs a 2500 soles ($800) loan that will bed used to purchase tables and chairs. Marina’s dream is to finish building her home and to own a clothes shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs for her new restaurant.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya has been a snack seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more snack materials for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money, and pay the school fees of her children.

Hidaya is 42 years old, is married, and has one child, age 15.

loans.use: To buy more snack materials for her business

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is a 21-year-old young man, living in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. He works in a clothing store in addition to giving private tutoring for three years. Today, Hamza wants to buy a laptop to improve his knowledge in the subjects he is teaching; therefore he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,100.

loans.use: Buy a laptop

loans.name: Yemica

texts.es: Yemica tiene 20 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años en una casa alquilada. Ambos se dedican al transporte con su auto propio desde hace 2 años, cubriendo la ruta interprovincial de su zona, juntos trabajan y se apoyan mutuamente, por parte de Yemica en preparar los alimentos y controlar el mantenimiento de su movilidad y él como chofer. Diariamente, excepto los domingos, ofrecen este servicio, negocio que eligieron por ser una actividad que les genera ganancias necesarias para cubrir los gastos familiares y a la vez ahorrar para en un futuro adquirir una casa propia y un carro adicional para el progreso de su familia se desarrolle. Es la primera vez que Yemica está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser  puntual en sus pagos, así mismo de trabajar para el bienestar de todo su grupo. La cantidad que está solicitando es para invertirla en el mantenimiento de su movilidad para que siga trabajando por mucho más tiempo.
texts.en:
Yemica is 20 years old and lives with her husband and her two-year-old son in a rented house. Both she and her husband have been working in transportation for two years, using their own car to travel the interprovincial road of their area. Both work and support each other: Yemica prepares the food and ensures the maintenance of the car while her husband drives. Every day, except for Sundays, they offer this service. They decided on this business as a business which would make enough money to pay for the household expenses and allow them to save for the future. They want to own a house of their own and buy another car so that their family can continue to make progress. This is the first time that Yemica is asking for a loan from MFP and she is committed to repaying punctually as well as to working for the wellbeing of her entire group. The loan will be invested in the maintenance of the car so that she can continue using it as a source of revenue for a long time to come.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To perform car maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar D. est un professeur de Mathématique et Science de la Vie et de la Terre au Collège Elémentaire Moyen de Ngueniene, un village de Sénégal.  Il a fait ce travail depuis 2004.  Avec ce prêt, il veut compléter son épargne pour acheter un terrain dans la localité ou il enseigne.  En 2008, il a reçu un crédit de 100,000 CFA ($200) qu’il a bien remboursé.  Monsieur D. et marié et il est âgé de 35 ans.  Il habite dans le quartier Cité Lamy de Thiès.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar D. is a teacher of math and of earth and life sciences at the middle school of Ngueniene, a village in Sénégal. He has been doing this work since 2004. With this loan, he wants to round out his savings in order to buy a plot of land in the town where he teaches. In 2008, he received a loan of 100,000 francs CFA that he has repaid. Mr. D. is married and 35 years old, and he lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thiès.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Farhat Jannat Ghulam Fareed Group

texts.en:
Farhat jannat baji is a wife of G. F., owns a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 10 years. Her husband has run a grocery shop in the community for the past 3 years. Farhat baji is a very hardworking lady. She does all the household work and then after she starts preparing to embroider clothes. She prepares clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Mussarat parveen baji wants a loan to buy paint to resell. Sultan begum baji and Muafia baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Samina baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switches and switch boards) to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Lucrecia Nury

texts.es: La Señora Lucrecia G. de 46 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, estado civil soltera, tiene dos hijos ambos trabajan y le ayudan a su madre. Como madre soltera requería una fuente de trabajo lo cual la llevo a iniciar con ventas de joyas, ropa y otros productos, desde hace treinta años ha sido el medio con que adquirir ingresos. Con planes de establecer una tienda por completo, ubicada en su casa de habitación y reactivar la bloquera en San Benito para aumentar sus ingresos y calidad de vida. Gracias al préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lograra comprar una vitrina grande para colocar sus productos y establecer productos como: perfumes, tintes, cosmético y ropas interiores y poder llamar a l atención a sus clientes, como la captación de nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia G. is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood Villa Reconciliación in the capital, Managua. She is single and has two children, both work and support their mother. As a single mother she needed a source of income and therefore she started selling jewellery, garments, and other products and this has been her income source for the past thirty years.She has plans to establish a store located in her dwelling and reactivate the machinery to make blocks in San Benito in order to increase her income and life quality. Thanks to the loan requested from Afodenic she will be able to buy a big display cabinet for her products and buy products such as perfumes, dyes, cosmetics and underwear and thus attract attention of her clients as well as gain new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, dyes, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Florina

texts.es:
Florina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Florina es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Florina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende gorras variadas, también vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho de manera ambulatoria.
Florina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gorras de diversos colores.
Los sueños de Florina son tener una tienda y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Florina is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” community bank. She is 23, lives with her common-law husband and their 2 children. Florina travels to different markets in the region where she sells a variety of hats. She also sells in Ayacucho city as a street vendor. Florina needs a loan for 600 soles that she will invest in hats of varying colors. Florina dreams of having a store and also that her children will be able to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: hats

loans.name: Pheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheary M., 38, is a widow with two daughters, both of whom are in school. She lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Pheary has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old. She learned this skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Pheary doesn’t have enough capital to purchase silk materials for her weaving business, so she is requesting her first loan of $300 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Yenni

texts.es:
Yenni es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Yenni es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Yenni tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Yenni vende salchipapas por las noches en la puerta de su casa.
Yenni necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Yenni es ampliar su local y tener mas ahorros.
texts.en:
Yenni is a member of the Nobleza Community Bank. Yenni is 30, in a common law marriage, and has one son. Yenni has a store in her house. She sells general groceries, vegetables, and meat. She does this every day. Yenni also sells “salchipapas” (fries with sliced sausage covered in various sauces) in the evenings. She sells them from the door to her house. Yenni needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Yenni’s dreams are to expand her location and to have more savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Bertha Francisca

texts.es: Bertha Francisca D. Narváez tiene 62 años de edad. Ella tiene varios créditos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre se ha encargo de cancelar en tiempo y forma. Su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Doña Bertha conduce todos los días un pequeño carretón en donde ofrece sus refrescos de manera ambulante, todos sus clientes esperan su llegada pues su refrescos son lo mejor para el inmenso calor.  A Bertha le gusta su trabajo a pesar de que es muy humilde, pero es por medio este que lleva el alimento diario a su familia. Ella necesita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, frutas, bolsas, hielo, pan y galletas. Su mayor deseo es obtener una lugar en donde ofrezca comida y así generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha Francisca D. Narváez is 62. She has had various loans with the Fundación León 2000, and she has always paid them on time and as agreed upon. She sells soft drinks. She has been doing this for over 15 years. Bertha takes her little cart every day to where she sells her soft drinks as a street vendor. All of her customers await her arrival because her soft drinks are the best for the immense heat. Bertha likes her work even though it is very humble. It is the means to providing her family with their daily food. She needs a loan to buy sugar, fruit, bags, ice, bread and crackers. Her biggest wish is to get a place where she can sell food and generate more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lala

texts.fr:
Madame Lala  T. est une femme de quarante deux ans avec deux  enfants  qui vit dans une famille polygame traditionnelle à Sanankoroba, avec ses coépouses, leurs enfants  et leurs maris.(deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après ses études secondaires (un certificat d’aptitude professionnelle en comptabilité), elle décide d’entreprendre des activités génératrices dans le domaine du commerce général. C’est ainsi  qu’elle intégra le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a de cela six ans. 
Tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés et elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel destiné à la constitution d’un important stock de condiments et denrées alimentaires pour la restauration. 
Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt 60  kilogrammes de condiments, une tonne de céréales diverses et des tubercules.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 125. 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser  pour rembourser les échéances du prêt et investir dans ses affaires.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lala T. is a 42 year old woman with two children; she lives in a traditional polygamous family in Sanankoroba, with her co-spouses, their children and their husbands. They live in the second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali.

After secondary school (where she gained a certificate in professional aptitude in accounting), she decided to start a income-generating business in the area of general commerce. She has also belonged to the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso for the past 6 years. She fully repaid her preceding four loans and she is on her fifth individual loan, which she intends to use to stock condiments and general food stuffs for her restaurant. She supplies herself once a week in Bamako and with this loan she intends to purchase 60 kilograms of condiments, one ton of various grains and root vegetables. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and invest in her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: 8 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El grupo el provenir esta integrado por Suyen del Carmen A. A., Karen Marina R. L. y Ruth del Carmen A. P.. Ellas son provenientes del casco urbano de Ticuantepe.

Suyen del Carmen A. A. desde hace ocho años vende tortillas y cabaza de chancho. Todo empezó al ayudarle a su mamá con el negocioque en un principio solo era venta de tortilla y actualmente venden chancho en la casa y en la calle. Esta joven es la coordinadora del grupo

Las otras integrantes son Karen Marina R. L.  vende ropa y Ruth del Carmen A. P. vende piñas en el mercado Mayoreo

loans.use: para comprar maiz, leña y cerdo

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique U. is 31 years old and is married with three children ages 2, 6 and 9. She also is responsible for an additional dependent who lives with the family and is 12 years old. Angelique and her family live in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Angelique recently (in 2008) opened a restaurant and employs three persons in her business. Her restaurant is open every day from 6:00 in the morning to 10:00 in evening.

Angelique is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to have sufficient working capital to purchase more fish and cooking oil for her restaurant. With this loan she hopes to increase her business, which will help her to serve more customers.

loans.use: To buy more fish and cooking oil for her restaurant

loans.name: Gelisah Fay

texts.en:
Gelisah Fay D. R. is from the village of Happy Valley, Tambulig Zamboang Del Sur. She is 33 years old. Gelisah Fay is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gelisah Fay owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "chicharon" fried skin from pig and cow products and other dried goods in the local community. Gelisah Fay has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gelisah Fay joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelisah Fay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Gelisah Fay is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business and used as an additional capital of the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Gelisah Fay from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and save as a reserve for future needs of the family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding and additional capital for the business

location.town: Happy Valley  Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is from the city of Hinagdong Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Anita is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business planting & harvesting seaweed for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dalmith

texts.es:
La señora Dalmith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Dalmith, es una mujer joven y trabajadora, que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace varios años, que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Y con su primer préstamo que Manuela Ramos, le brindo; implemento mucho más su negocio, ubicada en el Mercado “La Paradita”, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en la actualidad ya cuenta con  mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dalmith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalmith belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Victoria,” district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is single is 26 years old and has a son who still depends on her financially.

Dalmith is a young woman who is hard-working and feels capable of realizing her goals and dreams. Several years ago she began selling groceries with her first loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner)

To this day she has a loyal customer base who visits her store daily to buy her products as she has all the things that a housewife could need and she personally attends to her customers with the appeal that characterizes her.

With the loan of S/. 500.00, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, spaghetti in packs, milk and canned fish boxes in a variety of brands, cleaning utensils for the home and personal hygiene products to keep giving better service to her customers.

Dalmith to this day feels very content with the desire to keep getting ahead and making her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and to many women who wish to grow in their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase her products.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desD. hace 9 años atrás, del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Estudió secundaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta D. coca. Paralelamente D. dedica a la elaboraciòn y venta D. pan.
Maria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar los ingredientes para hacer pan como: harina y azúcar y a la vez para la compra D. coca.
Su sueño para el futuro es vivir tranquila sin preocupaciones.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad D. las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
María, 65, has been a member of the "Gran Poder" communal bank in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department, for 9 years now. She is married and has 6 children. She did not complete secondary school and she is a coca [The dried leaves of a South American shrub (Erythroxylon coca) of the flax family, chewed by the natives as a stimulant] merchant. She also bakes and sells bread. María tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her working capital. She now needs 2300 new soles to buy bread-baking ingredients like flour and sugar and, at the same time, to buy coca. Her dream for the future is to live peacefully and worry-free. What she likes best about her communal bank is the punctuality of her fellow members at meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and coca [The dried leaves of a South American shrub (Erythroxylon coca) of the flax family, chewed by the natives as a stimulant]

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando es un cliente  que esta en su segunda secuencia hasta el momento se ha visto que es un hombre responsable y dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia, durante este corto tiempo que ha 
trabajado con la institucion el Sr. Fernando no ha tenido ningun problemas con sus pagos.  El vive en un departamento en anticretico con su Esposa, sus dos pequeños Hijos y su Mama la cual es una persona de edad avanzada, ella se encuentra bajo el cuidado de su hijo quien se dedica a ayudarla en todo lo que puede.  El cliente destinara el credito en la compra de una radio de comunicaciones para su movilidad la cual le fue extrahida de la misma movilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is a client in his second loan cycle. He has proven to be a responsible man, and is dedicated to his work and his family. During the short time he has worked with this institution, Fernando has had no problems with his payments. He lives in a rented apartment with his wife, their two small children, and his mother, who is elderly. She is under the care of her son, who helps her any way he can.

He will use the loan to buy a communications radio for his taxi, since his was taken from his car.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a radio for communication

loans.name: Somali

texts.en: Mrs. Somali K. is 47 years old, and she lives in Pravong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pharn Tun, is a construction laborer. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income for their family. In order to improve their living, Mrs. Somali K. decided to ask for a loan in order to buy two cows for breeding. She is the mother of eight children. Two of her children are factory laborers, while another one is a construction laborer. The five other children are students in the local school. (Her husband appears on the right in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Ndèye Samb

texts.fr: Ndèye Samb S. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis 2 ans et fait du petit commerce de tissus et de chaussures. Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa famille et d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ndèye Samb S. is a woman of 46 years. She is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for 2 years and has a business selling fabrics and shoes. Her objective is to take care of her family and to increase her savings level.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business selling fabric and shoes

loans.name: Olatunji

texts.en:
B. owns a shop where she sells a variety of foods including frozen food and milling tomatoes (a variety of tomato) to her customers. She loves her business and wishes to expand her business in the future. She is married to Mr. Olatunji and they have four children. They live in Lagos. 

B. is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to expand her business to meet her customers' demands. 
She is 42 years old and a hard-working woman. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Jamal Nasir

texts.en:
Jamal Nasir son of H. S. is married and is the father of seven children: three sons and four daughters. His youngest son is a college student in first year and the others are students at school.

Jamal Nasir has a small retail shop and has the responsibility of paying for all the household expenses. Besides that, he has to pay the school fees and expenses of his children. Now he wants buy a taxi for his youngest son, but he can’t.

When he was informed about the loan process that is supporting the people, Jamal Nasir came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 40,000 Afghani to buy a taxi for his youngest son. He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To buy a taxi for his son

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared O. is 20 years old and married to Millicent, and they have a three-year-old daughter. Jared runs a shoe sales business in Oile Market, an open air populous market in Kisumu City. He has been in this business for the past ten years. He buys the shoes from vendors in Nairobi, the capital city, and sells them at a profit in Kisumu, about 400 kilometres from Nairobi. He sells shoes for men and women, though men's shoes sell faster than ladies.

Jared learned about KADET Ltd from a friend who is an existing client, and this is his third loan. He is optimistic about the loan since he has had ambitions of growing the business in scale, as he can now purchase stock in large quantities. He therefore intends to use the loan to increase his shoe inventory and also to buy plastics chairs for hire.

From the profits made, he intends to buy one sewing machine for his wife who makes clothes. Jared, who describes himself as “ambitious and hardworking”, has a dream of helping his wife open a tailoring school.

loans.use: To increase his shoe inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more poultry feed

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda V. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 41 years old. Linda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Linda runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $165 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Linda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Linda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 10th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Segundo Luis

texts.es:
Segundo Luis R.  tiene 42 años, es casada,  tiene  4 hijos , se llaman Segundo de 24 años, Nelson de 22 años, Luis de 19 años, Jaime de 13 años.  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y pastoreo de ganado bovino.
Segundo  trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como fuente principal  económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son: maíz, papas, trigo, cebada, mellocos.   Vende los productos en los mercados de San Miguel y Guaranda, también vende en la comunidad cuando llegan los comerciantes. 
Segundo  solicita el crédito para comprar abonos líquidos,  para pagar a los peones y para el transporte del producto.  Su meta es obtener productos de calidad y comercializarlos a precios razonables.  Los desafíos que tiene es que cuando el clima es desfavorable afecta a la producción y los precios caen, ya que el producto no es de buena calidad, Segundo si solicito antes un crédito invirtió en compra de insumos, Segundo manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta compartir con su familia y salen a pasear al rió.
texts.en:
Segundo Luis R. is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children who are called Segundo, 24 years old, Nelson who is 22, Luis, 19, and Jamie who is 13. They live in the neighborhood of San Francisco de Rumi Pamba about one and a half hours from Canton San Miguel in the province of Bolivar. The partner is a member of the rural group San Francisco de Rumi Panba which is made up of 25 members in total, of whom the majority work in agriculture and raising cattle. All his life Segundo has worked in agriculture, the principal source of income for his family. Among the crops that do well in the area are corn, wheat, barley, potatoes, and mellocos (a type of tuber). He sells the products in the markets of San Miguel and Guaranda, and in the community when the merchants arrive. Segundo requests the loan to buy liquid fertilizers, to pay the workers, and for the transport of the produce. His goal is to obtain quality products that he can sell at reasonable prices. The challenges that he has are that when the climate is unfavorable it affects the production and the prices fall since the product is not of good quality. Segundo solicited a loan before that he invested in supplies. He says that in his free time he likes to be with his family and they go out to walk by the river.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy liquid fertilizers, pay the workers, transport the produce.

loans.name: Wilma Fátima

texts.es:
Wilma Fátima V. I. tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos, Osvaldo de 13 años, Rafael de 9 años y Fernanda de 16 meses. Ellos viven en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Vilma es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Vilma se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeña. Cultiva maíz, trigo y habas. Los vende cada 15 días en el mercado de San Miguel.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos. Su sueño es que Dios les ayuda y les da un poquito más para salir adelante y comprar una casa. Los desafíos que ella enfrente son las enfermedades de los niños y en el negocio los precios bajos porque hay sobreproducción.
Le gusta bailar y cocinar y disfrutar de las fiestas del fin de año y carnaval en el cantón.
texts.en:
Wilma Fátima V. I. is 29 years old, single, and lives with her three children: Osvaldo (age 13), Rafael (age 9), and Fernanda (age 16 months). They live in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province.

Wilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Wilma has been farming from a young age. She grows corn, wheat, and beans and sells these products every 15 days at the market in San Miguel. Wilma is requesting a loan to buy supplies. She dreams that God will help her family and provide them a little more so that they can get ahead and buy a house. Her greatest challenges are when her children get sick and her business deals with low prices due to overproduction. She likes dancing and cooking, and also takes time to enjoy the festivities during New Years and Carnival that take place in the canton.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more yams

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Mr. Duk Y. is 29 years old and is a villager who lives in Chheal Phlouh village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sokna Keo, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice and sweet potatoes on to earn their living. Aside from farming, Mr. Duk Y. is also a fisherman while his wife is a pig breeder. With both these businesses they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support their pig breeding, Mr. Duk Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for breeding. This couple has three children; two are students in the local school while another one is a year old. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed for breeding

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband sells Cambodian traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 2 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Luz En Desarrollo 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, Luz en desarrollo 2 (Developing light). She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and child. She says that her most difficult challenge is improving her business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to sew and to learn more about it.

Juana is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over two years. She started sewing small pieces at home and then a friend talked to her about Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She makes and sells curtains, sheets, quilts and tablecloths. She will buy fabric, needles, thread and other materials. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She is planing to operate her own local business. 

Juana's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Arcarizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other supplies

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg C. is 36 years old and lives with her son in Central province of Mongolia in a rented apartment. Her son attends a local primary school.

Narantsetseg has been working as a notary - a person who is legally empowered to witness and certify the validity of documents - in her town since March, 2010 after arriving in Central province. She used to work as a solicitor and has gained a lot of knowledge and experience working in the legal sector. She was able to purchase a small car with her permanent earnings.

Narantsetseg hopes to continue and maintain her work successfully. She says, "I want to save enough money to support my children's education." She is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase a personal computer, printer and copier for her operation.

loans.use: To purchase personal computer, printer and copier for notary business.

loans.name: Deyra María

texts.es: La Sra. Deyra María G. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene un año de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el fin de mejorar su vivienda el cual será invertido en la compra de zinc, madera y pago de mano de obra para mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deyra María G. is from the town of El Sauce. She has been employed as a primary school teacher at the Simeón Pereira School in El Sauce for the last year. This is her first loan request to Ceprodel. It will be used for home improvements: to buy building materials and supplies like zinc metal sheeting and lumber as well as to pay labor costs for roof repair on her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting, lumber and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita P. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Bungtod, Manlayag, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: pig fattening, food vending, and basket weaving businesses. Her husband Liberio P., who is 52 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have 7 children who are 10 to 28 years old. Two of their children have their own family, the other 3 are already working, and 2 of them are currently going to school.

Adelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,600, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more feed and vitamins so that she can continue to save up for their future, improve their business and for her children to finish their education.  Adelita P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona L. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Chona is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie S. is 53 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Minlagas, a part of the barangay of San Luis in Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Rosie makes and sells food, primarily snacks and native delicacies like conchita, banana-cues and sweet potato-cues to the local community. Rosie has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Rosie is requesting a new loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make her snacks to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients needed to make her snacks for sale

location.town: Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Este cliente es padre de familia de tres hijos y estos se encuentran en el colegio, el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion como: zinc, madera, clavos para el techo de su  casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
This client is a father of three children who are in high school.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase construction materials like zinc, wood, and nails for the roof of his house.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his home

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; tiene 40 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasteles, ella los envía hacia la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y también la socia trabaja en un programa de productos naturales, la socia quiere tener una pastelería. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pasteles al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Marina belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Luz Marina is 40 years old.  She is single and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling cakes.  She sends her cakes to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  She also works in a natural products program.  Luz Marina would like to own a cake shop.  She is requesting this loan to buy cakes wholesale.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy cakes wholesale

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her canteen which she started 8 years ago in a nearby girls' school. In her canteen she sells French fries, samosas and tea and cold drinks to the school girls. She utilizes her earnings to pay  the utilities expenses of her family. With the loan, she will buy required items such as cooking oil, potatoes, cold drinks, etc. for her canteen to increase her sales and income. 

She has been living in a 2-room brick house with her family in a city called Khanewal. Khanewal is located in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her husband’s name is K. A. and he works in a factory for a low wage.  She has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is enrolled in school while the others are very young in age. Nusrat is a very loving and caring mother who is raising her children very well.  

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She is very confident about the future of her canteen business and hopeful that her business will grow further by utilizing the loan money into it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy required items for canteen business

loans.name: Hector Raul

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor Raúl es una persona muy honrada y respetuosa el tiene un negocio de carnicería el cual lo atiende el mismo, para el la mayor satisfacción es poder tener bien surtido para sus clientes, el quiere el préstamo por que necesita surtir mas su carnicería para así poder proporcionar variedad de productos a la hora de comprar la carne ya que asi aumentaría sus ventas y por lo tanto la mayor satisfacción de la gente, el esta casado, su esposa no esta trabajando, tiene 2 hijas las cuales están estudiando el nada mas trabaja en su carnicería, de ahí proporciona el sustento familiar, por eso el quiere y necesita el préstamo, para que en estas fecha a el pueda ver su carnicería completa para asi ofrecerle mas variedad a la clientela .
texts.en:
Héctor Raúl is a very honorable and respectful person.  He has a butcher's business which he works in himself.  His greatest satisfaction is to be able to have a well-stocked business for his customers.  He would like a loan because he needs to stock his butcher's business so that he can provide a variety of products for those who are buying meat since this would allow him to increase his sales and better satisfy his customers.  

Héctor Raúl is married.  His wife does not work.  He has 2 daughters who are studying.  He only works in his butcher's business and it is the only source of support for his family.  He would like this loan and needs it so that he can have a complete butcher's shop and thereby offer more variety to his customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco A. created Ventura Designs and Media to cater to the needs of senior citizens.  His publication, the Gold Pages - Paginas Doradas, was first published in 2002.  Seniors now seek out his publication to find out about services that are available for them.  The Gold Pages Directory is available in three Texas communities: El Paso, Midland/Odessa, and San Antonio.  

Francisco saw a huge void in the availability and accessibility of resources for seniors.  He approached the Area Agency on Aging of the Rio Grande Council of Governments to speak with them about his idea for a publication specifically for senior citizens.  He wanted to work with this agency to build his publication.  After securing this sponsorship, Ventura sought additional sponsors and advertisers from public, private, governmental, and nonprofit agencies interested in appealing to senior citizens.  

With the demographic shift to an older America, Francisco’s hope is to continue to be the leader in providing the information and resources needed for older citizens to lead an active, productive, and engaged life.  Ventura is using the loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana to expand and enhance its presence on the web.  Francisco’s first loan with ACCION allowed Ventura to build the initial format for the website.  

Frank describes himself as a dreamer.  He believes a person can provide a service to the community and positively impact the economics of the community while making a difference.  Francisco’s advice to other business owners involves three things: pick something you enjoy doing, pick something you are good at doing, and make sure you research and establish yourself.  

To learn more about his business, visit the website at www.txgoldpages.com.  

To learn about Ventura’s print services, visit www.venturaprinstore.com.

loans.use: To expand and enhance the website

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua T. has received a senior high education. She is a widow who prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn dough) at Abura. She has been in this business for five years. Demand for kenkey is high and so Efua is requesting a loan to purchase extra bags of maize to process into kenkey, which she will sell to her customers. The additional profit she will make as a result of this loan will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase extra bags of maize to process into kenkey

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francesco Agustín G. inicio hace 10 años con la producción y comercio de cepillos para lavar ropa actividad que aprendió de un vecino con el cual trabajo hasta que se independizó. En un inicio a él le costó mucho realizar este trabajo pero gracias a las instrucciones de su jefe y su empeño logro progresar.
Él tiene tres hijos de 17, 9 y 4 años por los cuales solicito el crédito escolar el cual es una ayuda para poder comprar los útiles de sus hijos, los uniformes…etc.
texts.en:
Ten years ago, Sr. Francisco Agustín G. started a business making and selling brushes used for washing clothes. He learned this trade from a neighbor before becoming independent. At first he had a lot of difficulty performing this type of work, but thanks to the instructions provided by his boss and his own commitment, he was able to make progress.

Francisco has three children (ages 17, 9, and 4). The loan he is requesting will be used to help buy school supplies for his children, uniforms, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies, uniforms, and other items for his children

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa, tiene 3 hijos,  es casada  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 1 año, Rosa  es tesorera del grupo “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca”, grupo conformado por 10  integrantes. Rosa   trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza  desde hace 10 años y a su vez también vende comida en su casa, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, obteniendo mayor ingresos y  así terminando  de construir su casa, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar productos de belleza y seguir vendiéndolos. Sabemos que Rosa  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Rosa has three children, is married, and has been collaborating with Edaprospo for a year.  She is the Treasurer of the “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca” communal bank which has 10 members.

Rosa has been selling beauty products for ten years and also sells food at home.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she’s managed to improve her family’s quality of life obtaining higher income and thus finishing building her house.

With the goal of continued growth she is asking for a new loan to buy beauty products to continue selling them.  We know that Rosa will reach her goals with much effort and work and Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy large quantities of house building materials to add to his business

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín tiene 46  años de edad, es casdo y reside con su familia en Motupe, distrito de la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales desde hace varios, siendo esta actividad la que aprendió su padre.  Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Agustín desea adquirir alimento balanceado para engordar a su ganado, para posteriormente venderlo y obtener ingresos y poder apoyar a su familia.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Agustin is 46 years old, married, and he lives with his family in Motupe, a district in the province of Lambayeque. He is situated an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has been raising and selling livestock for many years, an occupation he learned from his father. He has an established client base in the region. 

Agustin wishes to acquire balanced feed to fatten his herd, to later resell and to obtain an income to support his family. For this reason he has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from   Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. None of her children is currently in school.   Annet has a business of making charcoal stoves, which she has had for 4 years.

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clay soil and iron sheets for making charcoal stoves for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and pay for her house rent and buy food. In the future, Annet hopes to own a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase more clay soil and iron sheets for making charcoal stoves for sale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un regroupement de 5 femmes ayant en moyenne 47 ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à Sélingué, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de YANFOLILA (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce du poisson avec MAWA K., la présidente du groupe.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 40kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne à la  carrière (un village où existe un marché aux poissons) en gros auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente en gros et en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché de SELINGUE et BAMAKO, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of  five women averaging 47 years of age and six children, who live in traditional families in Sélingué, the main settlement in a rural community in the Yanfolila Prefecture (the third administrative region of Mal0. They are on their seventh collaboration cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. The group members sell fish, which is what Mawa K. does, for example. She is the group’s leader. She plans to use her loan to purchase 40 kg [100 lbs] of fish. She stocks up Carière, a village with a fish market, buying wholesale. She sells wholesale and retail, for cash, and sometimes on credit, at the markets of Selingue and Bamako, to a customer base composed essentially of women.

She expects to achieve an average monthly benefit of 30,000 West African Francs, a part of which will be used to help her husband with everyday household expenses, and the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh S., 25, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. 

S. sells rice, earning an income of US $6 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of US $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $70 on food and US $120 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more rice in bulk to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more rice in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Lucile

texts.en:
Lucile is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucile is 47 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a cellphone shop in the Philippines. Lucile requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase cellphone accessories and equipment for repairing cellphones.

Lucile has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Lucile would like to save money to expand her business and so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase cellphone accessories and equipment for repairing cell phones.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es: Abigail es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta ella es soltera  y en esta  ocasión  requiere  el préstamo por que desea remodelar su casa la cual con esfuerzos  a  pagado  poco  a  poco , ella  requiere instalar  puertas  y  ventanas   ya  que  anteriormente rentaba  el   domicilio  y  se lo entregaron en  muy malas  condiciones,  actualmente  ella   vive  con su  mama, pero  su  sueño  es poder  independizarse  un  poco   de   sus  padres, agradece   el   apoyo  que   le  han  brindado   para   concluir  su  proyecto   y   poder  realizar  su sueño  realidad.
texts.en: Abigail is a very hard-working and honest person.  She is single and, on this occasion, she needs a loan because she would like to do some work on her house which she has gradually paid for with a lot of effort.  She needs to install doors and windows since she used to rent out the house and the tenants gave it back to her in very bad condition.  Abigail currently lives with her mom but her dream is to become a more independent from her parents.  She is grateful for the support that she has been given which will help her to finish her project and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for her house

loans.name: Bironke

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Bironke est une dame mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse  et distributrice de Bijoux à Lomé depuis 06 ans. Pour les besoins de son commerce elle voyage sur Accra(GHANA) pour faire ses achats. Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt et maîtrise bien son activité.
texts.en: Bironke, 48, is a married lady and mother of one child. She has been selling and distributing costume jewelry in  Lomé for six years. For the needs of her business, she travels to Accra (Ghana) to do her buying. She is on her third loan and is very well-versed in her activity.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 59 years old and lives in Compra, Liloy. She is married with three children. Felisa has a dressmaking business and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase one sewing machine. Felisa has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase one sewing machine.

loans.name: Janylkan's Group

texts.en:
Janylkan, the 41-year-old leader of this group, resides in the town of Balykchi, which is translated from the Kyrgyz language as “Fisher.” Balykchi is a small fishing town situated by Issyk Kul lake, a location that affords many business opportunities to local residents. A high percentage of the 42,000 residents rely on summer tourism to bring in a large number of visitors both from abroad and from within the republic.

With good cooking skills, Janylkan has worked as a cook in a high school cafeteria for many years. One time she learned that a small café was available for rent; seeing her opportunity, she decided to start operating it. Summer months turned out to be even more successful than she expected, so Janylkan soon bought the café. Currently, this restaurant owner also rents a second café where she offers a menu of both national and European meals, earning a total monthly income of 40,000 soms, while the initial capital was 25,000 soms. Janylkan would like to spend her portion of the loan on furnishings and foodstuffs for the café, and in the long run hopes to open a restaurant in the capital as well.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase dishes, foodstuffs and drinks.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been a farmer in the Muranga area of central Kenya for over 25 years. He practices mixed farming, producing coffee, milk, horticultural products, and eggs. He is married and is 64 years old.

Joseph has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy poultry. He says increasing the number of birds in his flock will help him achieve economies of scale and significantly improve his family's standard of living. He is hoping to become a major egg distributor in the area.

Joseph says animal diseases and fluctuations in market prices are the primary challenges bedeviling farmers. He adds that Juhudi loans will surely improve farmers' living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Gloria has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Madeleine vive en la zona D. Puente Piedra al norte D. Lima Perú, ella aun siendo muy joven es muy trabajadora,  tiene un minimarket  que lleva por nombre “RAQUELITA” cuando inicio su negocio era una tienda pequeña que solo ocupaba una parte D. su casa, al transcurrir el tiempo su negocio ha crecido y mejorado su minimarket es completo y  abastece a sus clientes con todo tipo D. productos entre frutas, verduras como abarrotes diversos como azúcar, arroz, fideos etc. sus ventas son buenas y eso la ayuda para seguir mejorando, lo que hace es seguir invirtiendo en su mismo negocio, en esta oportunidad su préstamo le servirá para la  compra D. licores algo que sus clientes le piden y D. esa manera su negocio será completo,  también extenderá su negocio  para hacerlo mas granD. para la comodidad D. sus clientela, con el grupo “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO” ya tiene 03 años son  08 socias que conforman el grupo.

 La Sra. Madeleine viste pantalon color guinda esta al final D. todas.
texts.en:
Sra. Madeleine lives in the District of Puente Piedra, which is north of Lima in Peru. Although she is a very young woman, she is a hard worker and owns a mini-market called “Raquelita”. When she started her business, it was a small stO. but it has grown and improved. Her mini-market is completely stocked. Her customers come to buy all types of products such as fruits, vegetables, and different groceries such as sugar, rice, noodles, and other items that sell well. This helps her to continue improving and reinvesting in her business.

On this occasion, her loan will be used to buy liquors that her customers have requested so that her business will be complete. She will also expand her business to make it larger and mO. comfortable for her customers. Madeleine has been a member of the group “Prosperidad y Éxito” (Prosperity and Success) for three years. There are eight members in the group.

In the photograph, Sra. Madeline is wearing maroon-colored trousers and seated at the end of the row.

loans.use: to buy liquor to sell in her store.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan, age 33, is married to Chheam, age 34. This humble couple has two children who are living under their income. Chan and her husband have been spending their lives cultivating crops, since 1990. This is a skill they had learned from their grandparents when they were young. From this business, they earn about $2 per day. According to the rainy season and the lack of money, Chan and her husband would like to request some funds through HKL, partnered with Kiva. They will use the funds to purchase seeds and fertilizer for supporting their business. This is the third cycle that she has borrowed from HKL partner and the first cycle she is borrowing from Kiva. She said that this loan is very useful for her life and family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children. The 43-year-old ambitious woman hails from Kyenjojo, Uganda and is a mother of four children. She lives with her children and their father in a semi-permanent house. For 21 years, she has been growing bananas and this has facilitated her in providing for the family. Her challenges include pest and diseases such as banana wilt, which leads to low output and her dream is to modernize her agricultural practices to increase her yields and to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Rosemar

texts.en:
Rosemar is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 
Rosemar provides a motorcycle, or habal-habal, service. He has run this business for three years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and to pay for gasoline to run the motorcycle.
Rosemar is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.en:
Janneth is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Janneth has a shop that sells soaps, detergents, canned goods & noodles. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy soaps, detergents, canned goods & noodles for sale.
Janneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Janneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soaps, detergents, canned goods & noodles for sale

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина живет с мужем в городе Бердянске. Ее взрослые дети давно живут отдельно. Галина занимается торговлей на центральном рынке своего, реализует хозтовары и посуду вот уже 8 лет. На этом рынке у Галины нет конкурентов, она одна продает такой товар. Товар очень качественный. На данный момент оборотный капитал составляет 50 000 гривен. 

Кредит КИВА в 12 000 гривен Галина планирует использовать для закупки дополнительного товара, а именно кастрюль, сковородок, столовых сервизов и т.п. для удачной реализации в дальнейшем. Обновив ассортимент реализуемой продукции, Галина сможет привлечь новых покупателей, увеличится покупательская способность и увеличится товарооборот. Галина предприимчива и всегда старается трудолюбиво относиться к своему бизнесу, вежливо обслуживает клиентов. Все эти факторы, несомненно, влияют на успешное развитие бизнеса Галины.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Galina lives with her husband in the city of Berdyansk. Her adult children live separately for a long time.
