Galina sells household goods and china on the central market of her city for eight years now. Galina does not have competitors on this market, she is the only one who sells such merchandise. Her merchandise is of very high quality. At this time her working capital is 50,000 hryvna.

Galina plans to use the 12,000 hryvna loan from Kiva to buy additional merchandise, such as pots, pans, dinner sets and etc, for successful resale in the future. By renewing the variety of her merchandise Galina will attract new customers, increase purchasing power and commodity turnover. Galina is entrepreneurial and always has a hardworking attitude towards her business, and is polite towards her customers. All these factors certainly have an impact in the successful growth of Galina's business.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise such as pots, pans, dinner sets and etc, for successful resale in the future.

loans.name: Meriy

texts.es: La socia no ha cambiado de negocio y no a  variado mucho su vida con ecepcion de que su hijo ya nació y se encuentra muy atareada con todas las obligaciones que ahora tiene, la socia esta feliz con la llegada de su hijo de 3 meses, la socia por el momento solo criara gallinas y cuyes, ella tien unos chanchos que los vendera en el mes de diciembre, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de 10 cuyes y de 20 gallinas que las comprara en 8 y 10 soles cada una y los criara y los vendera a sus clientas en 25 soles cada una, en cuanto a los cuyes ellos se reproducen rápido y es rentable. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de 20 gallinas y 10 cuyes. La socia desearía tener un negocio propio y estudiar a corto plazo pero en el momento desea seguir haciendo lo que domina y son los negocios con los animales menores y esto le vieen bien por ahora hasta que su bebe este más grande.
texts.en: Meriy is still in the same business and her life hasn't changed all that much, except that her son was born and she is very busy with all her obligations. She's very happy about the arrival of her three-month-old son. At the moment, she's only raising hens and guinea pigs. She has some pigs that she plans to sell in December. Meriy would like to use this loan to purchase 10 guinea pigs and 20 hens, which will cost 8 and 10 soles each, and raise them and sell them to customers at 25 soles apiece. Guinea pigs reproduce quickly and are profitable. Meriy would like to have a real business and study in the near future, but at the moment she wants to keep doing what she's good at, which is raising small animals. This will be a good business for her until her baby is older.

loans.use: to buy 20 hens and 10 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita, 45 years old, is married and has 3 children, the oldest 16 years old. Conchita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for 8 years. She sells canned goods, shampoo, and other items, earning PHP 3,000 per month. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks. Conchita hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a 61-year-old married woman with 9 children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Amada primarily grows rice crops to sell. Amada earns about 12,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Amada works hard to support her family.

Amada has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Amada hopes to have a stable income so she could pay her obligations and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 50 years old and lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is married with three children.

Her business is selling fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She earns 5,000 PHP each month from this business. Basilia has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables for her business.

She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en:
Reymundo is 55 years old and married to Marilou. They are thankful because they were blessed with two children. The family lives in the village of Disimuray. Reymundo is a very responsible father and husband. He is engaged in a business raising hogs, primarily for breeding.

Reymundo is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vitamins to sustain his hogs. He wishes that someday his business will expand to give his family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to sustain his hogs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married to a teacher. She operates a day care center, although she used to operate a grocery shop. Elizabeth uses her income to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. She needs this loan to operate her day care center. Elizabeth hopes to develop her day care center into a school.

loans.use: to operate her day care center.

loans.name: Philip T.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Kenema city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to seek a loan of SLL 10,900,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living.
 
Forty-nine-year-old Philip is the leader of this group of teachers. Philip was born in Segbwema in Eastern Sierra Leone, he is married and has six children, five of whom are in schools. Philip is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for fifteen years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials – bags of cements, iron corrugated zinc, nails, etc., for the construction of a house.
 
School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – bags of cements, iron corrugated zinc, nails, etc., for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Sabali I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Sabali I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans,8 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAZANGASSO, un des villages du cercle de Bla  , 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 2eme prêt avec l’institution, le prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec SALY,  1ere assise de la droite vers gauche  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,50 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Bla et Dougouwolo, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. 
NB NANA ET MAMOUNE étaient absentes pour raison sociale

loans.use: Frais de labour,  achat d’intrants et de semence

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Wilfred, 55 years old, who is a native of the village of Kanyakine in the Nkubu area of Kenya where he lives with his family. His upbringing was challenging and he never went to college so that he could secure a formal job, but he did not surrender to that.

He has been practicing farming for the past 30 years. Through farming, he has been able to take care of his family. His main source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming, and through these ventures, he has supported his family because he is the only breadwinner. Wilfred passionately loves farming. Reuben stated that the most enjoyable bit about farming is “it gives me personal fulfillment and feeds my family."

Although he has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious man. He has been facing challenges transporting his produce from the farm to the market. That is why he is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike.

The Nkubu area is a rural town and roads are very poor. Wilfred has always thought that transporting goods has been a “nightmare.” He has been suffering losses because goods reach the market when they are not fresh, hence fetching a low price. Vegetables and milk are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market. Through the loan, he will be able to achieve his dream. He plans to employ someone who will be helping him in farm work and transporting the produce to the market, hence impacting the society positively through creation of employment.

Increased profits from the loan will allow him to repay the loan fully, be able to permanently change his living conditions, and assure his aging parents of a secure future. Wilfred dreams really big. He wants to work hard to give his parents a better life so as to thank them for all the sacrifices they have made for him. Through this loan you can help Wilfred realize his dreams.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Yawa Rebecca

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Yawa Rebecca, 42 was born in Alinka. She is married and mother of four (04) children. She is in charge of two (02) additional children. She has very little support from her husband who is a volunteering school teacher with a very low but regular income. All charges of the family are therefore on Mrs A.’s shoulders. She is illiterate but her dynamism and her determination allow her to be successful in all that she does. Her local improved poultry raising business helps provide her somehow substantial revenue. The rigor with which she managed her earlier credits made her a trustworthy woman that is deserving of financial support to increase her activities, boost her income and improve her living conditions. Madam AZIAJA Yawa Rebecca applied for a new credit of $1,000 to put up a hen house, purchase chickens, fodder, and veterinary products.

Madame A. Yawa Rebecca est née à Alinka il y a 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle à sa charge deux (02) autres enfants. Elle bénéficie de très peu d’aide venant de son mari enseignant volontaire avec un salaire dérisoire mais encore irrégulier, et toute les charges de la famille se reposent sur elle. Elle est analphabète mais son dynamisme et sa détermination font que tout qu’elle entreprend lui réussit merveilleusement. Son élevage de volailles, race locale améliorée, lui procure, tant que mal, un revenu substantiel. La rigueur dont elle a fait preuve dans la gestion de ses premiers crédits, font d’elle, une femme de confiance qui mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour accroître ses activités et de facto, augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie. Madame A. Yawa Rebecca sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1000 pour construire un autre poulailler, acheter des poussins, des provendes et des produits vétérinaires.

loans.use: to put up a hen house, purchase chickens, fodder, and veterinary products

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina Antonio M., 42 years of age and a divorced mother of 3, lives with and assumes all responsibility for the health and education of her two grandchildren. Justina grew up with her parents and attended school; however, she found her studies interrupted by her early marriage. She worked for an automotive parts dealer, but her income was unable to sustain her obligations. Hence, she abandoned her job to take care of her own business in 2003. Today, she assumes full administration of a commercial business. Through her friends she came to know Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner) toward the end of 2006. With the loan, Justina intends to reinforce the volume of her business, responding to an ever-increasing demand. Her future goals are to grow and construct new strategies of survival. Justina hopes to increase her revenue, allowing her to reimburse the loan, make small savings and improve the conditions of her job. Justina hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the near future.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Justina António M., de 42 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos vive também com os seus 2 netos assumindo toda responsabilidade de saúde e educação. Cresceu com os pais, ingressou na escola mas viu os seus estudos interrompidos para casar cedo. Trabalhou num agente de peças de automóveis e diz que com os rendimentos não conseguia satisfazer as suas necessidades tendo depois abandonado o emprego para cuidar do seu negócio em 2003. Hoje em dia, assume na integra a gestão da actividade comercial e através das amigas tomou o conhecimento da existência da hluvuku nos finais de 2006. Com o empréstimo de 40.500,00mt pretende reforçar o volume do negócio assim como responder uma demanda cada vez mais crescente, o que lhe cria mais expectativa de crescimento e desenho de novas estratégias de sobrevivência. Espera incrementar os seus rendimentos, o que vai lhe permitir reembolsar o crédito e fazer pequenas poupanças, assim como melhorar as condições do seu empregado. Assume-se como uma mulher quer ser empresária bem sucedida no futuro mais próximo.

loans.use: To increase stock of materials in her shop

loans.name: Mardan

texts.en:
This young man has run a carpentry shop for 4 years. He enjoys his work very much, even though it is sometimes difficult.
Mardan is 26 years old and lives in the village of Yenikand in the Salyan region. He is single.
He is asking for a loan of $400 to buy joiner's bench.

loans.use: To buy a joiner's bench

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadelupe is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. She prepares food in her house which she delivers to people’s home as ordered, or as a street vendor to the people of her community. She belongs to the group “Flor de Tila 2”. The other group members are Mrs. Maria del Carmen Lopez Velasco (who sells clothing and shoes), Mrs. Cruz Mireya Daniel Arguello (who sells tamales door-to-door), and Mrs. Matilde Velasco Arguello (grocery store). They want to invest the loan in their businesses in order to increase their profits.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

GUADALUPE TIENE 42 AÑOS , CASADA 2 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AGRICULTOR.ELLA PREPARA COMIDA EN SU CASA Y LA SALE A VENDER A DOMICILIO A PEDIDOS Y COMO VENDEDOR AMBULANTE .ENTRE LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD.PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE TILA 2. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON DOÑA MARIA DEL CARMEN LOPEZ VELASCO ( VENDE ROPA Y CALZADO ) DOÑA CRUZ MIREYA DANIEL ARGUELLO ( VENDE TAMALES DE CASA EN CASA ) Y DOÑA MATILDE VELASCO ARGUELLO ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS PARA OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS .

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
N. Jennifer - the “fruits woman,” as she is commonly known along Kiira Road next to Kiira Road Police Station - is a very hard-working young lady who is 28 years old and a mother of three. Her first child is in primary one at Kitante Primary School, one of the good schools in Kampala.

She sells all types of fruits such as yellow bananas, mangoes, paw paws, pineapples, apples, oranges, pears, passion fruits, and Matoke. Her main customers are the passers-by on the busy road that goes to Ntinda, Bukoto, and Kiwatule, which are big residential areas in Kampala. In a day she sells about USD85. She says her sales would be high if she had enough money to buy matoke (green bananas) because of high demand.

She started her business in the year 2000, and her first loan was USD110. She later graduated to USD171, USD285, USD457, and USD 742. She said she has built a house for her parents in Mbale, a major town in eastern Uganda, and bought a banana plantation in her home area. She is looking forward to getting enough capital to increase sales which will eventually increase profits. She has opened another strategic outlet in Ntinda, and this will be run by her sister, whom she has trained in the same business.

loans.use: Jennifer wants to buy five boxes of the commonly bought fruits: passion fruits, mangoes, pineapples, paw paws, vegetables, and fifty bunches of matoke per purchase.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a hard-working entrepreneur from Nikolaev in the central part of Ukraine. She has a business selling women’s dress clothing and shoes at a market in Nikolaev. Lubov, who is divorced with one daughter, depends on her business to provide a very valuable source of income for her livlihood. Now in her 11th year as an entrepreneur, Lubov sells around $6000 worth of clothing and shoes per month and makes about $1100 in profit. Her future business goals include purchasing a new sales kiosk. She also would like to use part of her earnings to purchase new appliances for her home. 

Lubov is a great example of the benefits of private business ownership and the opportunities available to someone who is willing to take a risk and work hard. She has requested a loan from Nadiya Ukraine that will increase her available working capital and allow her to continue to develop her business, purchase new inventory and increase her income.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia doesn’t feel satisfied with just being a loving mother. It has been 4 years since she observed the difficulties that her family went through, she decided to dedicate her self to sell meat and she started as an ambulatory sales person. Then quickly she established herself in a space inside of the most popular marketplace, which is close to her house. With consistency, good service, and honesty in which she sells her delicious orders and now she not only sells at her market place but also in an ambulatory way when she goes to the city of Lima. Her success in her business has filled her with satisfaction because together with her husband who works repairing the bodywork of cars, she is able to support and to make it so her three children are able to study at the university. Her kids do not remain indifferent to her hard work and they support their parents by helping in the activities that they do. All this strength and harmony comes from Lilia's wisdom and prudence in incorporating everyone in the team effort. She desires to continue and improve her business and this is why she requests a loan that she will invest in purchasing an electronic balance. With it she will provide greater exactness in the weight of her merchandise. Let's support Lilia so that she can keep moving forward and further strengthen her hardworking family.

Translated from Spanish by Edith and Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Lilia, no se conforma con ser sólo una amorosa madre de familia, hace cuatro años al observar las dificultades por las que atravesaba su hogar decidió dedicarse a la venta de carne y empezó de manera ambulante, luego rápidamente se estableció en un puesto de ventas en el mercado más popular colindante a su casa, con la constancia, buen trato y honestidad que expende sus deliciosas carnes, el negocio y demandas se han acrecentado y ahora no sólo vende en el puesto del mercado sino también de manera ambulante cuando va periódicamente a la ciudad de Lima; este hecho la llena de mucha satisfacción porque junto a su esposo que se desempeña como reparador de carrocerías pueden sostener la economía de su hogar en beneficio de sus tres hijos que estudian en la universidad.Ellos no son indiferentes ante tanto trabajo y también apoyan ayudando a sus padres en las actividades que realizan. Toda esta fortaleza y armonía es mantenida por Lilia que como mujer sabia y prudente promueve un trabajo en equipo en cada uno de sus integrantes. Desea seguir adelante y mejorar su negocio y es por ello que solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de una balanza electrónica, con ello ofrecerá mayor exactitud en el peso de su mercadería.Apoyemos a Lilia a seguir adelante para forjar una familia trabajadora.

loans.use: Buy an electronic scale and increase capital for her meat business.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sarum (age 49) has been married since 1979 and has two sons and two daughters. She has been in the business of growing bananas since 2004. In addition, she purchases mango from villagers she contracts with and resells it in the market. She is also running a grocery store from home. Her husband is a farmer and is currently growing rice and vegetables on his farm land in the village.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting another loan for the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase mango from villagers, and then resell the mango in the market, and to buy more grocery items for her stock.

loans.use: Purchasing mango from villagers she contracts with and buying more grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Marha Catalina

texts.es:
Four years ago Martha started the selling of cosmetics through a catalog. This was because her husband lost his job and the severance that he received was not enough to cover the costs of their two children who are attending school. The supplies that the children need are many and occasionally they could not pay for them. After her husband found new work, she has continued with her business because she noticed that her income could improve their living conditions and ascertain that her children would not be in need of anything.

Martha currently has a portfolio of customers that place orders with her. However, she has at this time a couple of orders that she cannot fill because she lacks the funds. For this reason, Martha is requesting a loan of USD $475 that she will repay in six months. With this money she will be able to buy the products that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Martha comenzó hace 4 años a vender cosméticos por catálogo. Puesto que su esposo se quedó desempleado y con lo que le dieron de finiquito no era suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos a quienes tiene estudiando y los materiales que les piden son mucho que en ocasiones no los pueden pagar. Después de que su esposo encontró trabajo. Martha continuó con el negocio puesto que se dio cuenta que con lo que ganara ella podría incrementar su nivel de vida y así procurar que no les falte nada a sus hijos.

Martha actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes que poco a poco le están pidiendo productos. Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos que no a podido surtir por falta de recursos. Es por eso que Martha está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Martha podrá comprar los productos que le hacen falta.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi L., 54 years old, currently live with her husband and two kids at Y Yen Disctric of Nam Dinh Province. Outside of farming, her other primary job is breeding pigs. Before joining the TYM group, her family's income was unstable and they encountered many difficulties, mainly due to the lack of capital to invest and expand their business. After joining the group, Mrs. L. has take out loan to just focus on breeding pigs. She now have about 10 healthy pigs and her own income has reached 100 USD per month. In addition to that, her two childrens are working as building workers to help out their mother in weekly payment. Mrs. L. just recently renew her pond and get into raising fishes. She currently need to take out a loan of 450 USD to buy more piglets and breeding fishes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Lụa, 54 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Ngoài làm ruộng công việc chủ yếu của chị Lụa là chăn nuôi lợn. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình có nhiều khó khăn, chủ yếu do ít vốn đầu tư nên thu nhập cũng thấp. Sau khi vào Quỹ chị Lụa vay vốn tập trung chăn nuôi lợn. Đàn lợn của chị lúc nào cũng trên dưới 10 con béo tốt, khoẻ mạnh. Thu nhập riêng từ chăn nuôi bình quân hàng tháng đạt 100USD. Ngoài ra 2 con chị cũng đi làm thợ xây hỗ trợ mẹ trong việc trả tiền tuần. Chị Lụa vừa sửa sang lại ao để thả cá tăng thêm thu nhập. Chị đang muốn vay 450USD để mua lợn con và cá giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs and fishes

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 39-year-old father of 6 who works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Mahmoud owns a bakery. This is the fifth time he has applied for a loan through A. Majmoua. Mahmoud wants to buy utensils for his business and is planning to change his oven.

loans.use: buy utensils and an oven for his bakery

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Maria N.. She is not married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 13. In 2003, Maria established her Café business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more kitchen utensils. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot, sticky dough, made from maize flour), a plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima S. is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient for Fatima and her three children. Fatima sells soup. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina makes living selling small audio visual equipments such as MP3 and MP4 players and others. She lives in the Alto la Florida zone of the city of La Paz. She rents her residence since she does not own a home.

This is her first loan request at IMPRO.

She will use the loan to purchase inventory (MP3, MP4, flash memory and others). She is a fighter, being a single mother with a small daughter starting kindergarten. In IMPRO, we feel that she deserves this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Marina se dedica a la venta de equipos pequeños audio visuales como ser MP3, MP4 y otros.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Alto la florida de la de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en alquiler ya que no cuenta con una vivienda propia.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (MP3, MP4,FLASH MEMORI Y OTROS) Es una persona luchadora ya que es madre soltera y su pequeña hija esta en el nivel inicial de Kinder. En IMPRO creemos que se merece esta oportunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as MP3, MP4, flash memory and other small electronics for resale.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Costancia has been selling chickens in Arusha for eight years. She is 35 years old, married, and has nine-year-old twins. She works daily from 6:00am to 6:00pm selling chickens and is able to earn approximately $400 in profit each month.

Costancia would like to take out this loan to buy more chickens to sell. Increasing her inventory of poultry will increase her profits. She will be sharing this loan with her two group members, one of whom owns a stationary shop while the other sells vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell in her business.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Yacouba K. est un célibataire de 26 ans  qui vit avec ses cadets chez son feu grand père à Kaboila II, au centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali en Afrique de l’Ouest). Après plusieurs activités économiques sans succès, il s’est spécialisé dans la vente de materiels audio- visuels et  electroniques ( téléviseur, DVD, radios, cassettes, panneaux solaires, antennes paraboliques etc...) depuis  maintenant 4ans.
Il  s’approvisionne généralement au Ghana (en Afrique de l’Ouest)  et  vend ses articles au comptant en détail ou en demi gros à Sikasso dans sa boutique sise au grand marché. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée de voyageurs, de routiers, de jeunes mélomanes de la ville de Sikasso. En plus des matériels audio visuels, Monsieur K. vend des fournitures scolaires et de bureau. Il jouit d’une grande réputaion et d’une très forte  confiance de sa clientèle, ce qui lui a permis d’avoir la commande du Lycée privée Amion GUINDO de Sikasso pour ses fournitures scolaires.
Pour faire face à une clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, il décida  obtenir des ressources complémentaires auprès de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier prêt indivuduel.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter un téléviseur, une radio minichaine, des cassettes vidéos, et 25 cartons de cahier scolaire. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yacouba K.,age 26, is single and lives with his younger brothers in the house of his deceased grandfather in Kaboila II, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali, Western Africa). After starting several unsuccessful businesses, he's been specializing in the sale of audiovisual equipments and electronic devices (TV sets, DVDs, radios, tapes, solar panels, parabolic antennas, etc...) for four years. He usually does his shopping in Ghana (Western Africa) and sells his goods for cash, wholesale or retail, in his shop in the grand market of Sikasso. His clientele is mostly composed of travelers, truck drivers, and young music lovers from the city of Sikasso. In addition to audiovisual equipments, Mr. K. also sells school and office supplies. He is very well regarded and entrusted by his clientele, which enabled him to get an order for school supplies from the private high school Amion GUINDO in Sikasso. To meet increasing customer demand, he decided to seek a first individual loan from Soro Yiriwaso to obtain additional resources. With this loan, he intends to buy one TV set, one compact stereo system, video tapes, and 25 boxes of school notebooks. He reckon that he will make a profit of 100.000 XOF, to be used to repay the loan and invest in his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy audiovisual equipments and school supplies

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa donde vende productos que le demandan los clientes de la comunidad. Con el crédito obtenido en ADIM  compró cosméticos y perfumes que los empezó a ofrecer a los clientes y así fue teniendo más encargos. Trabaja todos los días y hace además las labores de su casa. Piensa seguir obteniendo financiamiento para ofrecer más productos a su clientela como ropa y adornos. Actualmente vende pescado y tarjetas telefónicas, productos que le han dejado buenas ganancias. Siente que con su negocio ella es más respetada dentro de su comunidad, que ha crecido como persona, como empresaria y como mujer.
texts.en:
She has a small general store in her house where she sells products that are in demand by residents of the local community. With the loan obtain in ADIM, she bought cosmetics and perfumes which she started offering to customers and she started to have more orders. She works every day and, in addition, takes care of the household chores. She is thinking about continuing to get financing so she can offer more products to her customers, such as clothing and jewelry. She currently sells fish and phone cards, products which have provided a good profit for her. She feels that her enterprise has made her more respected within her community, and that because of it she has grown as a person, as a businessperson and as a woman.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Juana Eva

texts.es:
Eva inicio hace 3 años con la venta de blancos ya que necesitaba apoyar en las necesidades del hogar y mantener a sus hijos, así que decidió emprender alguna actividad que le generara ingresos, ya que se separo de su esposo y necesita más dinero para mantener a sus 2 hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir mercancía para las ventas de diciembre que es cuando aumenta las ventas. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante!!.
texts.en:
Eva began selling pillows three years ago, when she separated from her spouse. She decided to learn a trade in order to earn money to support her two children. Eva needs a loan of $475 to supply merchandise for the month of December, when sales increase. She will repay the loan in three months. With your help Eva will get ahead!

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Pacisa

texts.es:
La señora Pacisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Cacorco”, ella vive en el Sector Cacorco  del Distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno.
Tiene 34 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos que estudian todavía, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado ovino. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro mas ganado ovino para engorde. En la actualidad cuenta con 12  ovejas que venderá para pagar su préstamo con exactitud.

Con el ultimo préstamo de S/. 800 .00 nuevos soles que solicitara  comprara mas ganado ovino (5 ovejas) de Bolivia.

Pacisa expresa que los bancos de Manuela Ramos son de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pacisa is a member of the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Cacorco." She lives in the Cacorco sector of the Copani district in Yunguyo-Puno province (Peru). She is 34 years old and married with 4 children who are still studying. She and her husband work together in their business of buying and selling of sheep.

With a previous loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Pacisa increased her capital and bought more sheep to fatten.

Pacisa currently has 12 sheep, which she will sell to pay back her loan. With the latest loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) that she is requesting, Pacisa will buy 5 more sheep from Bolivia.

Pacisa says that Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) is a great help.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 5 sheep to fatten.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice K. is currently in the business of baking bread and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Alice is 28 years old and married. Her husband is an accountant. She has five children, who all attend school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her bakery in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Maria P.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Maria M. from Mbeya. She is married with one child, aged 4. Maria has run a business selling phone accessories since 2004. Despite being a ‘developing’ country, it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general--not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids and vendors. It can be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here.

Maria works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, 7 days a week and gets help from her husband. Maria currently earns about $300 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to buy more phone accessories such as phone cases, batteries and chargers to resell. In the future, she plans to open another business. Maria thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories such as ases, batteries and chargers

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amamatu I., 52, has six children – three girls and three boys – one of whom is married while the rest are in senior high and basic school. She lives with her husband, a farmer cultivating palm nuts, plantain and maize, and some of her children in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small business and farming community near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

For over 20 years, Amamatu has traded in maize, purchasing it from farmers in her community and surrounding towns and trekking to markets to sell it. She is requesting a loan to procure maize in bulk, hoping to save enough to help her husband put up a building of their own and sponsor the rest of their children’s education through to the university level.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Thuc

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Thực  tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 1995. Gia đình chị có 3 con, chồng chị không may mất sớm, chị đang sống cùng 1 người con tại Thị Xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc.  Hiện tại chị Thực đang kinh doanh các loại rau ,củ , quả  tại chợ  Xuân Hoà thị xã PhúcYên  tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Kinh doanh cũng là công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia dình chị  với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Thuc has been a member of TYM fund since 1995. Her family consists of 3 children; her husband unfortunately died early. She currently resides with 1 child in Phuc Uyen District in the town of Vinh Phuc. She has a business selling a variety of vegetables & fruits at Xuan Hoa Market in Phuc Uyen District in the town of Vinh Phuc. Her business is the main source of income for her family with monthly income of 287 USD. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD to invest in her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina F. is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of nine children. Currently, three of them attend the community basic school. Georgina believes in hard work and dedication, which is the secret of her success. She lives with her family at Dome, a suburb of Mampong, in the Ashanti region. She has owned and operated a local restaurant and sold local foods like banku and abetie for the past ten years. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She needs the loan to enable her to inject more capital into her business so she can purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava dough, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She says the cost of raw materials is very high now. She also wants to save part of her proceeds to provide a better education for her children. Georgina belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Pray for Life’. She hopes to receive GH¢900 to make her business progress, by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 64 años y 8 hijos, Alejandrina junto a su esposo tienen un Foto estudio llamado Foto Estudio Q., brindan servicios D. fotografía, filmaciones, revelados D. fotos y además venta D. maquinas fotográficas, DVD.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo D. 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. rollos, papeles.
Los sueños D. alejandrina son mejorar sus negocios, adquirir una mini procesadora digital para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 64 years old and is married with 8 children. Alejandrina and her husband own a photo studio called Foto Estudio Q.. Their business offers services in photography, filming and photo development. They also sell cameras and DVDs.

Alejandrina is requesting a loan of 3500 soles ($1125) to purchase film and photographic paper. Alejandrina's dreams are to improve her businesses and obtain a small digital processer to use in the photo studio.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase film and photographic paper

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora  Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo” D. la comunidad Kajje, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, en el departamento D. Puno. Tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 06 hijos y tiene estudios D. primaria completa.

Ella es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 18 años y fundadora D. dicho Banco Comunal. Su primer préstamo feu D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invirtió para comprar verduras, ahora también ella se dedica a la crianza D. truchas y realiza trabajos D. agricultura para ayudar a su familia.

Ahora ella desea realizar un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invertirá para comprar alimento para las truchas y verduras, asimismo afirma que pagara en 4 cómodas cuotas.  La señora alejandrina compra sus verduras en Tacna y los venD. en las ferias D. Juli .

Ella desea construir su casa en Juli, razón por la cual realiza diferentes actividades.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the “Maria Asunción Galindo” community bank in the Kajje community, in the Juli district, in the Chucuito province, in the Puno department. She is 54, married, and has 6 children. She completed her elementary education. She has been a member of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 18 years. She founded her community bank. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy vegetables. Now, she also raises trout and helps her family by doing agricultural work. Now she would like a new loan of 500 PEN to buy trout food and vegetables. She asserts that she will repay the loan in 4 comfortable payments. Alejandrina buys vegetables in Tacna, and she sells them at the fairs in Juli. She would like to build a house in Juli; that is why she is involved in these different enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy trout food

loans.name: Lutfy

texts.ru: Лутфи - женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест с 2005 года.Она торгует на рынке паншанбе города Худжанда.У неё в основном товары для подросткового возраста.она хочет получив кредит съездить за товаром в Истаравшан.Сейчас идёт спрос на мальчиковые бермуды и футболки, поэтому Лутфи хочет пополнить свой товарооборот.За все годы своего сотрудничества с Фондом Лутфи на разу не подводила во время погашения.Она в числе хороших клиентов.
texts.en:
Lutfy is a woman, she has been taking out loans at MicroInvest since 2005. She sells on the Panshabe market in the town of Khujand. She mainly sells clothing for teenagers. She wants to use the loan to travel to Istaravshan for the merchandise. Right now the demand for t-shirts and bermudas for boys is very high. Lutfy wants to increase her merchandise circulation. During all these years in her partnership with the fund Lutfy has never been late with a payment. She is one of the good clients.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cow fodder

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina B. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Augustina’s husband is a commercial driver while she is a trader. She trades in ceramic wares.

Augustina makes ceramic wares such as cups, bowls, earthen wares, etc. herself. She has hired hands that work for her. She fires the wares in a kiln after production. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy clay and firewood. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy clay for making ceramics

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith U. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Edith is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Edith owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks in the local community. Edith has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Edith is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
Ninfa es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Ninfa viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende verduras, frutas, pollo y de las ferias compra animales menores, quesos, productos que son comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. También vende ropa en las ferias.
Ninfa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Los sueños de Ninfa son tener un puesto estable y tener una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a member of the communal bank group “Confianza” (Trust). She is 38 years old, married, and has 6 children. She travels to different markets in the region selling vegetables, fruits, and poultry. While at the markets, Ninfa buys young animals, cheese, and other products which she then sells in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells clothing.

Ninfa needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy various types of clothing. She dreams of having a stable vending location and operating a grocery store out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various types of clothing

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Don Silvio M., reside en el Georgino Andrade en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos,  el tiene 47 años de edad, su esposa se dedica al cuido de los niño y del hogar, el se desempeña como panificador, en este trabajo lleva tres años, pues en la venta le va bien ya que muchos Nicaragüense es el alimento el rico pan, y hace variados, y ricos picos los cuales distribuye en las diferentes pulpería de Nicaragua anteriormente ha trabajado en servicios de seguridad, y de albañil. Sus planes es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su vivienda y poder dar mejor seguridad a su familia. Da las gracias por el apoyo con este préstamo ya que lograra el objetivo de poder tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Silvio M., 47, lives in the Georgino Andrade neighborhood of Managua. His wife has given him two children. She takes care of them and their house now. He works as a bread-maker, work that he's been doing for three years. Sales are brisk because bread is the favorite food of many Nicaraguans. The delicious bread, of various kinds, is sold to different corner stores around Nicaragua. Before becoming a bread-maker, Silvio worked as a security guard and a construction worker. He wants to make a better life. With this loan, he will buy construction materials to improve his house and make it more secure for his family. He is grateful for the help this loan will provide because it will allow him to meet his goal of providing a decent place for his family to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима Файзова проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 55 лет. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Муж вместе с сыном работают на стройке. Сама Фотима более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Еще помимо этого они имеют теленка, молоко которого продают односелчанам. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
55-year-old Fotima F. lives in the Yavana region with her husband and eight children. Her husband and sons work in construction. Fotima has been engaged in raising animals for more than 15 years. She tends the livestock then sells them. Besides that, she has dairy cows whose milk she sells to her fellow villagers. The loan request is to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Las Bondadosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Bondadosas” están representadas por la señora Doris  y conformadas por 13 miembros de los cuales solo uno es varón, las socias van cursando juntas ya su tercer ciclo en los cuales han demostrado unión, responsabilidad y ganas de salir adelante en sus negocios. La socias se dedican a la venta de productos como pan, comida, empanadas canastas, cosméticos, perfumes y la atención en Kioscos el varón se dedica a al albañilería y la presidenta es niñera por lo que siempre demuestra un espíritu joven. La competencia en especial en el rubro de ventas de productos es alta por lo que las socias se ven en la obligación de diversificar su mercadería o mover sus negocios a lugares con menor competencia es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para poder adquirir mercadería más competitiva y para poder adquirir sus propios puestos de trabajo en lugares mas competitivos y así poder generar mayores ingreso para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Group “Las Bondadosas” (The Kind-Hearted Ones) is led by Sra. Doris and consists of 13 members (12 women and 1 man). They are starting their third loan cycle together and have demonstrated unity, responsibility, and the desire to succeed in their businesses. The members engage in retail businesses selling products from their kiosks such as bread, food, empanadas, baskets, cosmetics, and perfumes. The male member works as a bricklayer. The president of the group is a nanny and has demonstrated her youthful spirit. Competition is especially high in the retail market, so the members are obligated to diversify their merchandise or move their vending posts to areas where this less competition.

They have requested a loan so that they can purchase merchandise to make them more competitive. They will also be able to acquire their own vending posts in places that are more competitive so that they can generate better earnings. Therefore, they will be able to provide their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Ángel Martínez is 49 years old and has been married for 16 years. They have two children, one 21 years old and another 12 years. 
For 15 years he has been selling ítems in his area, specifically hammocks that his father takes to the area of Luque. 
His wife is a professional weaver and elaborates lovely covers that she sells in the area, and Mr. Miguel distributes the capital. They work very hard and want to buy a motorcycle to work more efficiently.
With the loan he wants to buy merchandies (hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets).

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets

loans.name: Ronald's Group

texts.en: K. Ronald is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is 23 years old and single with no children. He takes care of himself. Ronald has operated a cinema hall in Ngogwe trading centre for two and a half years and his major business challenges are the high power costs which are on and off, the high transport costs to get the CD’s, as well as the low population in the market. He is able to make 35,000/= a week profit and he hopes for this to increase. Ronald has a dream of owning his own premises so that he could save on rent since it is too much for the kind of business he does. He also hopes to have children and ensure that they all go to school and have better jobs than he has. He is seeking his first loan to help purchase a second television set that will help improve the view in the cinema.

loans.use: To purchase a television set for his cinema hall.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Irene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop., selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Irene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Irene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat T. is a very hardworking and independent woman. A married mother of two children, she started her sheep-breeding business 10 years ago. Because this business brings good income to her family, Jannat wants to buy more sheep to increase her profits and is therefore requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni. She and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of small sheep to expand the business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from the village of Bungad in San Pablo, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Josephine is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine started her retailing business of clothes, slippers, and shoes in the local community. 

In 2007, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be Josephine's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales de la región y paralelamente a la artesanìa.
Eugenia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar cereales como: chuño, tunta, avena, quinua y a la vez animales menores.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave, poner una tienda de abarrotes y vivir feliz con su familia. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Ms. Eugenia has been a member of the Communal Bank "Gregoria Apaza" for 5 years, in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 30 years old, married and has two children. She completed secondary school studies. She buys and sells local staple foods and she also crafts.

Eugenia tells us that with the first loan she requested from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement), which was of S./300.00, she was able to increase her working capital. She is now requesting a loan of S./500.00 with which she can buy staple foods such as chuño (black dehydrated potato), tunta (white dehidrated potato), oats, quinoa and also small animals. Her dream for the future is to have her own home in Ilave, open up a general store and live happily with her family.

What she likes the most about her Communal Bank is the saving process and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chuño, tunta, quinoa, oats

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Rosa tiene 64 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos. La socia Rosa es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades en la casa como por ejemplo alimentar a sus animales, limpiar las jaulas y preparar su chicha de jora. La socia después de hacer sus actividades de la casa tiene que atender su pequeño negocio de venta de cerveza. La socia nos cuenta que alimenta a los animales y después los vende a los restaurantes o sus caseros. Ya son 10 a 11 años que de dedica s sus negocios y le ha ido buen bien gracias al empeño que pone en sus negocios. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más alimento para los animales menores y desea comprar más cerveza pues en esta época de fin de año es donde se vende más cerveza.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra a 78 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a una hora y media de viaje. La ciudad de Urubamba se halla en el corazón del Valle Sagrado. En la época prehispánica fue un centro agrícola muy importante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 64, married, and has six children. Rosa is from the city of Urubamba in the Cusco department. She belongs to the José Carlos Mariategui Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She gets up very early to do her household chores like feeding the animals, cleaning the cages, and preparing her “chica de jora” (a drink typical of the region made from a corn base). After doing these household activities, she has to tend to her small business of selling beer. She says that she feeds the animals and later sells them to restaurants or her customers. She has been in this business for 10 or 11 years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business. She needs a loan to buy more food for her small animals. She wants to buy more beer because the end of the year is when she sells more beer. She is thankful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. The city of Urubamba is 78 kilometers from the city of Cusco, which is approximately an hour and a half trip. The city of Urubamba is in the heart of the Sacred Valley. In the Prehispanic age it was a very important agricultural center.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her small animals, and beer for the end of the year sales

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn C. lives in a small wooden house from which she operates a small enterprise, selling breakfast foods to the neighbors. She is able to earn approximately $3 each day. For another source of income, her husband drives a trailer-motor taxi. 

Presently she faces difficulties with her living situation because her house is too old and too small for them. She wants a new house, but she doesn’t have enough money yet to start the construction. So, she is applying for her second loan to buy housing materials for building a new house.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a new house.

loans.name: Two Friends Group

texts.en:
These ladies give their group its inspiring name – Two Friends.  They are small scale businesswomen in the city of Makeni who want a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that they can attract more customers, make better sales, earn more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Janet S. T.. She was born in Mayamba, in southern Sierra Leone. The 42-year-old is married to a professional worker and they have 4 children. Three of her children are in secondary school and one is in primary school.  For many years now, Janet has been selling rice, oil, sugar and other foodstuffs. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, sugar, etc. to add to her current stock

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo L. A. es un señor de  54 años de edad, que vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.

Don Gerardo L. A. forma parte de un grupo musical llamado “La Cascada” y comenta que han grabado 3 discos con temas originales. Además dice que se siente muy orgulloso de su proyecto ya que desde que inició en su comunidad y en lugares vecinos lo han apoyado mucho. 

 En estos momentos lo que desea don Gerardo es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢200,000 (doscientos mil colones) para comprar un nuevo teclado ya que el que tiene ahorita le esta fallando. Con esto espera brindar un mejor servicio y desea que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida

Don Gerardo es socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Gerardo L. A. is a 54-year-old man who lives with his wife and son in a community in Costa Rica called General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón, which is noted for being located in the Valle el General. His main businesses include stockbreeding, agriculture, and commerce. The latter has grown greatly, giving him new work opportunities.

Mr. A. is a member of a band called "La Cascada." He states that they have recorded 3 albums with original songs. He adds that he feels very proud of his project because ever since the band was formed, they have received much support from both their community and neighboring cities.

At this time, Mr. A. would like to request a 200,000 CRC loan in order to purchase a new keyboard because the one he currently owns is not working properly. With this new keyboard, he hopes to provide better services so that his small business can grow and generate enough income to improve his quality of life.

Mr. A. is a member of the Asociación de Productores El General (El General Association of Producers), one of 100 organizations that have partnered with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his third loan, and he hopes to continue growing both personally and financially. He also states that thanks to these types of organizations and microfinance institutes, he is able to dedicate more time to his businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase musical instrument

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria A. is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI to purchase another fishing boat to be managed by her eldest 23-year-old son. Candelaria is frustrated by her son’s decision not to continue his education because he thinks his parents cannot support him financially with the small profit from their business. On the other hand, she still feels happy that her son has taken the responsibility of helping them run their fishing business instead of rebelling against their poor life status. With that, her business eventually grew a bit, and she was able to support her second child’s education in college. Soon her youngest child will enter college; thus, Candelaria has to grow her business further to increase her profit to support her children and achieve her dream of improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing motor boat

loans.name: Alifath

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Alifath est mariée à SAGBO Tidjani, un pêcheur. Le couple a sept enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit à Louho, un quartier de Porto-Novo. Alifath vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Alifath prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce) à son domicile. Alifath s'approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a près de 17 ans que Alifath mène cette activité. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà obtenu trois prêts qui ont été bien remboursés. Alifath sollicite un quatrième prêt en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de pouvoir mieux faire face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, A. Alifath is married to SAGBO Tidjani, a fisherman. The couple have seven children to support. Three of the children are their own; all of them are in school. The family lives in Louho, a district of Porto-Novo. Alifath helps out her husband where it concerns the various family expenses. To cope with her various expenses, Alifath makes and sells food (corn polenta served with sauce) out of her home. She gets her supplies from the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, and also in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been in this business for nearly seventeen years. She is a previous ALIDé client having already obtained three loans, which have been repaid. She's requesting a fourth loan for increasing her stock of products and to be able to cope better with the numerous demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn and condiments for making sauces

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: Madame Fatimata S. née en 1960 est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont le plus âgé compte 30 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis 14 ans. Elle vend, en effet, des tissus, parfums, encens et  des pagnes tissés (comme ceux sur la photo) par son mari.  Elle tient le goût du commerce de sa famille composée de grands commerçants. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus de son commerce c’est le coté relationnel qu’elle crée. Ainsi, pour la confection de pagnes, elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour l’achat de tissus, de fils et d’accessoires nécessaires.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata S., born in 1960, is married and the mother of 10 children, the oldest of whom is 30 years old. She has been running a business for 14 years. She sells fabrics, perfumes, incense and “pagnes” (traditional fabrics for wrap clothing), like the ones on the photo, produced by her husband. She has a knack for this trade as she comes from a family known in the commerce. What particularly attracts her to this business is the relationships she is able to build. Thus, in order to produce “pagnes”, she is seeking a loan of 200,000 West African Francs, to purchase cloth, threads and necessary accessories.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing raw materials for the production of traditional 'pagnes" fabric

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S., age 49, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is a teacher and farmer and is able to earn an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase chickens and pigs to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Zonia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Sonia tiene su negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que el trabajo que realiza a diario es muy difícil por lo que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar las compras y así aumentar su inventario y ofrecerle a sus clientes una amplia variedad de productos. Por lo que está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Sueña con mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia's business is a general store located in her house. She has had this business for the past 20 years and it is difficult. She has to get up early every day to go shopping and stock her store to be able to offer her customers a wide variety of products. That is why she is asking for this loan-to purchase the basic items. Her dream is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidaridad está integrado por  tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Gioconda del Carmen C. quien tiene una pequeña comideria la cual inicio con la venta de unos pocos platos de comida a los trabajadores del taller mecanico junto a su casa.Es entoces que decide invertir mas e instala su comideria además de que empieza a vender por las noches noches fritanga.
Ella tiene cinco hijos de 23,20,18,17 y 13 años los cuales le ayudan en el negocio despues de sus estudios.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Concepción de María N. quien vende calzado y ropa usada, María Lucia O. V. desde hace 20 años realiza tortillas y Kenia Vanessa C. comercializa bisuteria,helados y chocobananos. Ellas tienen la meta de incrementar más sus negocios para poder progresar.
texts.en:
The “Soledaridad” group is made up of three hard working women. Gioconda has small eatery, which she started from the money she made selling food to the mechanic shop employees, located next to her home. It was then that she decided to invest in installing her eatery and begin selling fried foods in the evening. She has five children, ages 23, 20, 18, 17, and 13. They help her in the business after finishing their studies for the day. The other members of the group are Concepción, who sells shoes and second hand clothing, María who has been selling tortillas for the past 20 years, and Kenia who sells sundries, ice cream, and frozen bananas. Their goal is to grow their businesses so that they can move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica del Carmen Martínez P., tiene 19 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, viven en casa de sus padres, tiene una granja de pollos.
 Hace tres años se dedica a la crianza de gallinas rojas y comercializa huevos, ella comenzó su negocio gracias a la ayuda de una amiga quien le apoyo, de este trabajo ella ha logrado reunir dinero para mantener 300 gallinas; los gastos de mantenimiento son elevados por lo que decidió solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de material para reparar la galera de las gallinas.
Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora y que lucha por mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y su familia, sueña con tener su propia casa donde pueda vivir con su familia, además desea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica del Carmen Martínez P. is 19 years old and lives in Concepción Batres, in the department of Usulután. She and her partner have a 2-year old son. Verónica lives in her parents' house and owns a chicken farm. She has been raising red hens and selling their eggs for 3 years. She began this business with the help of a friend, and has made enough money to keep a flock of 300 hens. Her maintenance costs have been high, so she decided to request a loan to repair her chicken coop. Verónica is a hardworking person who struggles to improve the quality of life of her child and family. She dreams of having her own home and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to repair her chicken coop.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
She is a single mother with two children aged nine and seven years. At 27 years, Doreen looks after her family in terms of their welfare and school fees for the children with whom she lives with in a rented house in Masindi, Uganda.

It’s in Masindi that Doreen operates a bar in which she sells beer, sodas and water to earn a living. She has been in the business for the last three years and she says she started very small but now she can see there is some progress in stock and activity though she maintains that competition is very high.

Doreen says her business dream is to have a bigger bar with an entertainment centre. This is Doreen’s third loan from HOFOKAM and she is to buy beers, sodas, and plastic chairs for her bar.

loans.use: To buy beers, sodas, and plastic chairs for her pub

loans.name: Wolale Marakaso Ii Group

texts.fr:
