Le groupe WOLALE MARAKASO II est constitué de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de SAN (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles,  ont en moyenne 42 ans,  au moins 4 enfants et  qui cultivent  exclusivement du sésame.  
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année d’où leur premier prêt de campagne.
 AWA K. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 21000 à 23 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wolale Marakaso II group is composed of married women from the Cinzara village in the San Prefecture (the fourth administrative region of Mal) who live in traditional families, are on the average 42 years old, have four children and cultivate exclusively sesame. In order to make their agricultural work profitable, the group members have decided to join the loan program of Soro Yirwaso and are thus on their first agricultural loan. Awa K. plans to use her loan to purchase an ample quantity of seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs at he big market of San. After the winter season, the harvested produce is stocked for a while as its value goes up, and then sol at the big market in San and at the nearby markets, retail (often wholesale too), for cash, to customers mainly coming from big towns. After selling their produce, the group members plan to obtain a revenue of 21,000 to 23,000 West African Francs each, which will be used to pay off the loan interest as well as ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa R., tiene la edad de 35 años, es casada y con su esposo y su hijo de 10 años habitan en el Barrio Los Ríos, ellos son agricultores, que con el apoyo de su mama lograron la adquisición de su finca, siendo ahora una fuente fuerte de sustento para la familia.

Uno de los principales problemas que afecta la producción son los gases que emanan el volcán, y por tal razón esperan a futuro realizar un estudio que conserve el suelo para futuros proyectos, por ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizante, y pesticidas, que permitan un mantenimiento más optimo para los nuevos sembradillos, y que favorezcan  a la economía del hogar en la inversión de nuevos fuentes de ingresos o proyectos familiares y/o personales.
texts.en:
María Teresa R. is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her 10-year-old son in the Los Ríos neighborhood. They are farmers; they were able to acquire their farm with her mother's help, and now it is a solid source of support for the family. One of the main problems affecting their production is caused by the gases emanating from the volcano. For this reason, they hope in the future to be able to undertake a study that will lead to soil conservation for future projects. For the present, however, they are requesting a loan to buy planting supplies along with fertilizer and pesticides which will provide optimal maintenance for their new plantings. This will boost their household economy and favor their investment in new sources of income or family and/or personal projects.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Providing optimal maintenance for her crops

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean M., age 23, owns and operates a general store. She is just getting started in her business and sells food and daily-use products in her village, Villa Concepcion in Cauayan City, Isabela. 

Jean joined ASKI this year in order to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jean from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ligia María

texts.es: La Sra. Ligia G. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como abogada la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene  cinco años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado tres créditos para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y pago de mano de obra para seguir mejorando su vivienda y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ligia G. is from the town of El Sauce. She is an attorney employed by the City of El Sauce for the last five years. Ceprodel has granted her three loans for home improvements. She requested funds to buy bricks, cement and to pay labor costs to continue improving her home and provide her daughter with a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita  Q. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  sari-sari (general) store and farming businesses. She lives in Cros. Bulanon, Brgy Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP10,000. Nenita  is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

Nenita  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: purchase of stock for general store

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria A. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Candelaria is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Candelaria owns and operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. She and her husband also have a vegetable farm. Candelaria has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 8 000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Candelaria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Candelaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Candelaria is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be Candelaria's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 41 years old and married with four children aged between 3 and 12. Eugene is a businessman and he is the only one who works in his family. That is the reason why he has to work hard in order to provide everything necessary for his family. Eugene owns a small business of selling products made in wood for decoration. He has 15 years of experience in that kind of business. The hours of his daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Eugene is now requesting a Kiva loan Via Vision Finance Company in order to buy raw materials to be used in his transformation of decoration materials.	With the extra money expected, Eugene will be able to sort out his family problems and his business problems as well.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
CARLOS ANTONIO A. G.,Trabaja como Bodeguero en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán.  es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, ha trabajado dos prestamo con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion para su cas de habitacion.
texts.en: Carlos Antonio A. G. works in the warehouse of the Nicaragüense Alemán Center for Professional Training.  He is the father of 2 school-aged children.  He has taken 2 loans previously with CEPRODEL, and these have been used to make improvements to his house.  The loan requested will be used to purchase construction materials for his house.

loans.use: he is going to use the loan to purchase construction materials to repair a bedroom in his house

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Lahore, Pakistan’s second largest city known for its history and culture. She lives with her family in the area of Shibli in a 2-room brick house. She is a seamstress and supports her family financially by doing sewing for her neighboring clients. She is good at her art and receives good orders every month.

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband who runs a PCO (Public Call Office where people make calls and are charged based on minutes of use). He has rented a small shop in his area from which he offers his clients both landline and mobile phone calls. He also sells calling cards from his shop. With the help of this loan, Sakina's husband will buy another phone set and calling cards to further expand his business. By having another phone set in the shop, he will be able to provide services to many customers at a time.

loans.use: to buy a phone set and calling cards

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Susana is the coordinator of her group, Con Dios Adelante 4, 5 & 6 (Forward with God). She lives in a modest home with her four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard to get what she wants and to give her children what they need. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy resting after a working day.

Susana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for six years, starting with some capital she and her husband saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying stocks of clothes, shoes, and cosmetics etc. She will re-invest the profits in her business because this is high season for sales. She dreams of having her own house.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she invested in her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Shoes, clothes, accessories, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es: La Sra. C. es una persona humilde, honrada y muy trabajadora ella esta separada de su esposo y aun así el esposo la sigue apoyando económicamente, sus hijos ya están grandes y con sus respectivas familias. En este momento vive con uno de sus hijos el sigue soltero y saco una casa de interés social para el y su mama, entre los dos salen adelante el trabaja en un restaurante de mesero y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tiene un puesto de venta de comida la cual la colocan los fines de semana en las noches. Ella requiere el crédito para la compra de artículos para su puesto e inyectar aun más capital a la venta de comida.
texts.en: Mrs C. is a humble, honest and very hard-working woman.  She is separated from her husband but her husband continues to support her financially.  Her children are already grown up and have their own families.  At the moment, Mrs C. lives with one of her sons who is still single and who got a publicly-subsidized house for himself and his mom.  Between the two of them they get ahead in life.  Her son works as a waiter in a restaurant and she sells used clothes.  Mrs C. also has a food stall where she works on weekends and in the evenings.  She would like a loan to buy articles for her stall and so that so that she can inject more capital into her food sales business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to stock her business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Joselin de 15 y Víctor de 12 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Marlene ha logrado hacer de sus cultivos de lechuga, choclo, espinaca y papa, los más solicitados de su poblado, todas las mañanas sin importar las condiciones del clima, salen a trabajar sus chacras, ya que saben que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es primer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en: Marlene, 38, is a very kind and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 2 beloved children, Joselin, 15, and Victor, 12, and she wants to give them a better quality of life. Through hard work, Marlene has managed to make her crops of lettuce, corn, spinach and potatoes the most sought after in her village. Every morning, no matter the weather, they go out to work in the fields, since they know that the income they will get from the sale of their goods depends on it. What Marlene enjoys the most about her work is cultivating her lands. She has spent 5 years doing this and thinks the most difficult part is transporting her goods to the market in Tarma. Eventually, she wants to buy more lands, in order to increase production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be very punctual with her payments. She is a well-respected member of her communal bank, due to the responsibility she has shown. With the one thousand soles (PEN) requested, she will purchase more composted manure to fertilize her lands.

loans.use: Purchase composted manure to fertilize her lands.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
E. Manzura is 48 years old. She is a widow with 4 children. Manzura sells dried fruits in the central local market. She has been in this business for 4 years. Dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan - all hostesses have dried fruits in storage to serve in case her family has guests. Moreover, dried fruits are served as a rule during all family occasions, such as weddings and birthday parties. Considering the constant demand for these goods Manzur's business is quite successful and provides a stable income for her family. Today Manzura requests 7,500 Somoni to purchase dried fruits to increase the range of goods she is selling. Manzura has already demonstrated herself as a good client with positive credit history, but she would also like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits in order to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: Don José Antonio M.
texts.en: Mr. José Antonio M.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements for maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza vive en la zona de Miraflores Tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar su esposo quien  trabaja en horario continuo colabora con ,os gastos del hogar, ella trabaja como promotora de ventas desde hace tiempo (venta por catálogo) y también vende comida los fines de semana en los puentes trillizos y otras festividades ocasionales, la Sra. esperanza  también es consultora social trabaja en proyectos pequeños, ella solicita el crédito para incrementar de mercadería y compras algunos insumos razón por la cual solicito el crédito, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Esperanza lives in Miraflores.  She has two children of school age.  Her husband, who works full-time, helps with the household costs.  She has worked  as a sales promoter for some time, selling through catalogs.  She also sells food on the weekends and other holidays on the Puentes Trillizos, three bridges in La Paz.  Esperanza is also a social consultant working on small projects.  She is asking for a loan to increase her merchandise.  She is a very hard-working woman and is grateful to the institution for the support it's given her.

loans.use: Buying cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Ruperto Enrique

texts.es:
Ruperto tiene 70 años, es casado y tiene hijos independientes y un hijo a su cargo. Vive con su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, a zona urbana unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Las actividades principales en dicho caserío son la agricultura, crianza de animales de engorde y comercio.

Se dedica a la venta de CDs en puestos de mercado por las mañanas. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como patos y pavos. Cría los animales y cuando han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende en los mercados locales. Cuenta con más de 18 años de experiencia en estos rubros y por eso, tiene una clientela ya establecida en la región.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar un DVD visor de imágenes para las presentaciones de sus películas, con la finalidad de llamar un poco más la atención de nuevos clientes. Tiene como meta la aumentación de sus ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares y seguir cuidando su familia.
texts.en:
Ruperto is 70 years old. He is married and has three children who are now independent as well as one more in his charge. He lives with his family in the district of La Victoria, an urban area 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. The main activities in the village are agriculture, livestock and commerce.

In the morning he sells CDs on market stalls. Additinally, he raises and sells small livestock such as ducks and turkeys. He breeds the animals and when they reach a good size and weight he sells them in local markets. He has over 18 years of experience in these areas and as a result has an established clientele in the region.

He is applying for a loan to buy a DVDs reader to present his films, so as to draw some more attention from new customers. His goal is to increase his income so as to meet his household expenses and continue to care for his family.

loans.use: Buy a DVD reader to show his merchandise.

loans.name: Eshnazar

texts.en:
Eshnazar lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. He has five children. He and his oldest son breed cattle. He has been in this business for ten years. Eshnazar and his son work very hard because they want to make a good profit. During the month they visit the market four times to buy cattle. They feed the animals for a certain period and then sell them at a good profit. Eshnazar would like to get a loan 6500 Somoni to purchase more cattle. He wants to use the profit to support his family and expand his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Angel Orlando

texts.es: El señor Ángel tiene 31 años se dedica  a manejar su automóvil , con el cual presta servicios de taxi dentro de la cuidad , empezó a trabajar como taxista desde adquirió su unidad de transporte la cual compro con sus ahorros ya que anteriormente trabajaba en auto alquilado y como obrero en construcciones diversas , estos trabajos le permitieron ahorrar lo suficiente para adquirir su taxi esta ganando aproximadamente s/280 nuevos soles semanales, los desafíos que enfrenta es que no tiene el tiempo suficiente para dedicarse a manejar su taxi , ya que apoya a sus padres en una bodega que ellos tienen , su meta en el futuro es adquirir otra unidad de transporte para darla en alquiler y así poder obtener mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia , el dinero será invertido en darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte como cambiarle de llantas cambio de aceites entre otros el señor ángel esta muy contento con la ayuda que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Sr. Ángel is 31 years old and drives his own automobile in order to provide taxi services throughout the city. He started working as a taxi driver since acquiring his own vehicle with his savings. Ángel previously rented a car and worked as a construction worker on different projects. This work allowed him to save enough money to buy a taxi. He earns approximately 280 PEN each week. The challenges he faces include not having enough time to maintain his taxi. He has the support of his parents who manage a grocery store. His goal for the future is to acquire another vehicle that he can rent out so that he can generate more income to provide for his family’s welfare.

The funds will be invested in the maintenance of his vehicle, such as replacing the tires and changing the oil. Sr. Ángel is very pleased with the assistance that has been given to him.

loans.use: To replace the tires on his taxi and perform vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Chut

texts.en: Chut S. is a 32-year-old fish vendor and the mother of one school-aged child. Every day in early morning, Moeun Sory and her husband always go to buy fish from the fishermen and they hurry up and bring their fish by motorbike to the market for resale. Recently, their motorbike broke while driving and it will affect their vending business. Chut S. is taking out her loan to buy a used motorcycle, and she will use the rest of the loan to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle, and use the rest to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Vath

texts.en: Vath S., 26, has been a garment factory worker in the province of Kompong Cham since 2006, earning a monthly salary. She also often helps her husband's farming business by planting various crops for additional profit. Because the family wishes to move to a larger residence, Vath is requesting a loan of US$1100 to add to her savings to purchase a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a new wooden house.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. All of her three children, ages 13, 15, and 16, attend local secondary school. Her husband is a driver who manages a taxi service business in the town. Altanstetseg operates a grocery trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2002 and is planning to continue her business in the future. Her business earning is the only source of income for her family because her husband's business is not profitable enough to contribute to her family's consumption. Therefore she is planning to expand her business in order to feed her family. She is a hardworking lady who says, "Besides my grocery trading, I am planning to manage a flour trading business to supplement to my earning." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase flour in order to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase flour for a flour trading business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 30 years old and married with 1 school-aged child. He earns about Php 10,000 per cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Carlos grows corn and has been doing it for 3 years. Carlos is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

In the future, Carlos hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Gyedie Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Jacob is currently the group leader of the “Gyedie” Trust bank Group, made up of 5 members. Jacob is clearly a hard worker. He sells agro chemical materials like weed killers, pesticide and seedlings. He sells to local farmers.  He plans to use the loan to purchase additional agro chemicals to serve the local farmers. Jacob has sold agro chemicals for the past six years. He is also a hardworking farmer.

Jacob is married to a woman who is a service provider and together they have two children. He lives with his family in Berekum, in the northern part of Ghana. Above all, he hopes to create more savings to support his children in school. As the leader of the group, he ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase agro chemical materials in bulk.

loans.name: Sedjro 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDJRO 3 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Blandine, est celle qui se trouve au milieu de la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Blandine est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un certain Hubert. Le couple n'a pas encore d'enfant. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Blandine prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagné de diverses sauces) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Blandine achète ses produits dans les marchés du Bénin. Blandine exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Blandine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Blandine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEDJRO 3, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group SEDJRO 3 is comprised of three persons who are friends all living together in the same area. The official of this group is named Blandine. She is the one in the middle of the photo. This is the third time that this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. 

Blandine is 24 years old and married to a man named Hubert. They have no children yet. To support herself, she makes food (rice or corn mash served with various sauces) that she sells out of her house. Blandine purchases her goods from the markets of Benin. She has been in this business for three years. 

Concerned about responding better to the requirements of her customers, she would like to increase her stock of goods. To do so, Blandine, along with the other members of the group SEDJRO 3, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and corn and some sauce condiments and vegetable oil

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a young woman. She is a holder of an education degree. Laila couldn't find a job so she opened an educational center with the help of her father. Laila wants to purchase furniture for the center as well as educational tools such as white boards, scientific learning tools, etc. Laila took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the needed tools as her center is still new and doesn't return a profit to help her purchase the needed items. Laila is photographed at her center.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To pay for educational center furniture and teaching tools

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en:
Janerose is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating her children. 

She owns motorcycles for transport as a source of income. She started this business three years ago and her major problem is failure of hired riders to remit money on time.

In spite of this, she still feels the business is worth doing and she desires to own at least ten motorcycles.

Janerose needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Carolina Gabriela

texts.es:
Carolina, de30 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, esta casada, ella es comerciante se dedica ala venta de mercadería en general, este ha sido su primer negocio, lo  empezó cuando tenia 28 años de edad con capital propio, comenzó  vendiendo ropa, perfumes, zapatos de manera ambulante, además de este negocio ella es estilista que es su otra fuente de ingresos. Ella trabaja todos los días con el objetivo de dar a conocer su negocio, expandirse por toda la ciudad de León.  
Requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como ropa y joyas de plata. De esta manera podrá adquirir mas mercadería para vender y en lo futuro poner una tienda de mercadería en general. Su próxima meta es ir a comprar nueva mercadería a Panamá.
texts.en:
Carolina is 30 years old and resides in the city of León. She is married and has a seven-year-old son. Carolina is a merchant who sells general merchandise. This is her first business and she started it when she was 28 years old and with her own capital. Carolina started out selling clothing, perfumes, and shoes as a street vendor. In addition to this business, she works as a stylist to earn more income. She works every day with the goal of promoting her business. Carolina hopes to expand throughout the entire city of León.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as clothing and silver jewelry. The funds will allow her to acquire more merchandise to sell and she hopes to open a general merchandise store in the future. Her next goal is to buy new merchandise from Panama.

loans.use: to buy clothing and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Urumuli / Rbv Group

texts.fr: Thérèse  est agricultrice, elle membre du groupe Urumuri. Elle est veuve, elle est  âgé de 54 ans. Elle a  5 enfants entre 7 ans et  19 ans. Elle a trois enfants qui vont à l’école, elle est né au  Rwanda.son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de primaire. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser le prêt pour acheter 400kgs de pommes de terre, 50kgs d’engrais chimique, et paye la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est d’acheter des champs  pour augmenter la production des pommes des terres. Dans l’avenir il voudrait devenir un grand commerçante connue dans sa région et distributeur des pommes de terre partout dans sa région et agrandir son business, elle voudrait éduquer ses enfants et prépare un meilleur avenir  pour sa famille
texts.en: Thérèse is a farmer and a member of the Urumuri groupe. Born in Rwanda, Thérèse is a 54-year old widow and the mother of 5 children between the ages of 7 and 19, three of whom go to school. She herself had 4 years of primary school. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She will use the loan to buy 400 kilograms of potatoes and 50 kilograms of chemical fertilizer, and to pay the manual labourers. In order to be able to pay for the education of her children and give her family a better future, Thérèse's goals include growing her business and she plans to buy more fields so that she can increase potato production. She would eventually like to become a large, reputable seller and distributor of potatoes in her region.

loans.use: to buy 400 kgs of potatoes and 50 kgs of chemical fertilizer, and to pay the manual labourers

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
SEWA est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans,  3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames dans la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles et font le commerce d’articles divers : condiments, fruits et légumes, habillements, céréales etc. 
SETOU debout au milieu, mène les activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes wax et de vêtements pour enfants.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Bamako et de Bobo Dioulasso auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant, en détail et à crédit.  
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Sewa is a group of 10 married women who, on average, are 35 years old, have 3 children and live mostly in monogamous families in the city of Sikasso.

This is their first loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which they are seeking in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and sell a variety of goods: spices, fruits and vegetables, clothing, grains, etc.

Setou, standing in the center of the photo, runs a business purchasing and selling traditional, high-quality cloth (pagnes wax) and children's clothing. With her loan, she plans to purchase 30 pieces of high-quality, traditional cloth (pagnes wax) at the large market in Bamako, as well as from wholesalers in Bobo Dioulasso. She makes her sales at retail for cash and credit, from a family stall at the large market in Sikasso, to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Setou expects to make a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and its interest, while the remainder will go into savings.

She aims to increase her sales in order to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase traditional, high-quality cloth (pagnes wax).

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is a 47-year-old garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns $1 per day. They have three children, all of whom are working, earning $2 per day each. Every month, Nam has to spend $55 on food, $10 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. Nam would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for use in the family. 
Nam wants to embark on a new career that her husband also can share. In this way, they will be able to improve their family income. Nam doesn’t know what that new career will be until she completes this loan and has some start-up money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for use in the family.

loans.name: Samart

texts.en: Samart, 63 years old, is a flower tree seller who earns $6 per day. She is a single mother with two children and both of them are working as construction workers earning $9 per day for all. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $20 on electricity, and $50 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy construction material for her son doing construction work. She hopes that her son’s career will make better income so that he can support himself and the family also.

loans.use: To buy construction material for her son

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 38-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City with her children and husband. She and her husband have been running a motorcycle washing and repair business for nine years. She would like to take out a loan to expand her business by purchasing spare parts and equipment to serve a larger number of customers. 

She hopes that through the loan her business will be able to generate more income, which will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and put aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and equipment to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children, and all of them go to school. She operates a pub from a shop on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years.  Florence works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local brew. Besides this pub business she also generates additional income from selling charcoal. Her aspiration and goal is to expand into a wholesale pub so as to serve more customers. Her major business challenge is thieves and transportation. 

She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local brew.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is from the village of Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Trinidad is married and has four adult-aged children.

To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Trinidad sell it by door to door basis to her "suki" buyer. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

Trinidad is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials in making "puto". Puto is the classic steamed Filipino rice cake shaped like an American muffin. Its texture is spongy and slightly fluffy. Puto is traditionally white, but can be colored pink, yellow, purple, even green.  There are many regional variations of puto. 
Recently Trinidad joined GDMPC to seek for financial Assistance as additional investment to her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and portion of it will be save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in making "puto"

loans.name: C 7851 Abakangukiramajyambere Group

texts.en:
Epaphrodite is 44 years old and has three children aged between 4 and 12 years old. He owns an agriculture business which is open from 6am until 3pm every day. He currently employs four people to help him. 

He is the leader of the group (pictured with his hand raised) called "C 7851 Abakangukiramajyambere" in the local language. Epaphrodite has ten years of experience in this work. 

Epaphrodite has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by cultivating more rice for sale. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice for sale.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon is 36 years old and her husband Pheap is 41 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and three daughters. Two are weavers, one is in school and another one is too young for school. 

Suon and her husband are farmers and she is also a weaver. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $800 to purchase an irrigation machine to spray her farm and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

Photo: Suon and her loom.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation machine to spray her farm and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Suvdaa

texts.en:
Suvdaa is 28 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She started her hairdressing business in 2003 by renting a small space. She took a large number of trainings and expanded her business bit by bit. Now she runs a hair saloon. Her employees and her own hairdressing skills are excellent. 

Now that its holiday season, she needs a lot of supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "My province is a rural area of Mongolia therefore, I need to purchase a large amount of supplies from the city". She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her hair salon.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a petty trader.  She is married and has four children in Brasi. Some of the items she sells are displayed on the table beside her  and include toffees, biscuits, cooking oil, tins of milk and other items. Her business is three years old. Nana uses her income to support her partner to take care of the home. Nana will use the loan to purchase additional types of groceries in order to bring variety to her customers. She plans to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional types of groceries in order to bring variety to her customers.

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has been selling charcoal in South Sudan. 

Akeer is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 34 year old woman from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 900 JOD to buy materials for building her home. She has recently built a new home and wishes to continue the building process. In the future she is planning on buying new furniture. She hopes that this will make sure her family has a comfortable home to rest in.

loans.use: to pay for building materials for her home

loans.name: Levy's Group

texts.en:
Levy is 29 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Levy has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Levy also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Levy's Group will be able to receive a total of 16 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Celsy Jasmary

texts.es: CELSY JASMARY: Es una señora emprendedora y sonriente de  29 años de edad, casada. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, comercializa y acopia marisco, para obtener los productos a precios accesibles trabaja directamente con los buzos, intercambiando productos (verduras, ropa) a cambio de pescados, langostas, camarones, caracoles, pulpos, cangrejos y conchas de mar. Solicita su primer  financiamiento para incrementar el inventario de productos del mar. Ella sueña con tener su propia empresa de marisco con todos los requerimientos que exige la ley para poder expandir su negocio a otros mercados.

loans.use: para incrementar el inventario de productos del mar

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Madam A. Abla was born in 1960 at Tsévié. She is married and is a mother of four (04) children. She contributes at least 75% of the family expenditures as her husband, a teacher in a private school at Tsévié with meagre and unstable salaries, does not have a consequent income to provide for the elementary needs of the family, despite her good will. Illiterate, she has as main activity the fabrication of the maze bread (Ablo), a traditional meal well appreciated and consumed in Togo. Being one of the rare women of the suburb to do such an activity, she has a very enough important customary which she does not succeeding to cover. Faithful and model woman in good management, she has nothing less than those who are educated. She has succeeded to well managed her two first credits respectively $100 and $300 obtained and promptly repaid. Madam A. requests actually a credit of $850 to make the whole purchase of maze and wood fire. With this project, she could strengthen her activities and increase her incomes to better take care of her children and help her husband and in house expenditures.

Madame A. est née en 1960 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle contribue à moins 75% des charges familiales car son époux, un enseignant dans une école privée à Tsévié aux maigres et irréguliers salaires, n’a pas réellement un revenu conséquent pour subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de la famille, malgré sa bonne volonté. Analphabète, elle a comme pour activité principale la fabrication de pain de maïs (Ablo), un mets traditionnel bien apprécié et consommé au Togo. Etant l’une des rares femmes du milieu à faire ce genre d’activité, elle a une clientèle assez importante qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire. Femme fidèle et exemplaire en bonne gestion, elle n’a rien à envier aux lettrés. Elle a su bien gérer deux premiers respectifs de $100 et $300 obtenus et promptement remboursés. Madame A. Abla sollicite actuellement un crédit de $850 pour faire des achats en gros de maïs et du bois de chauffage. Avec ce projet, elle pourra renforcer ses activités et augmenter ses revenus pour mieux s’occuper de ses enfants et aider son mari dans les dépenses de la maison.

loans.use: to make the whole purchase of maze and wood fire

loans.name: Sapnah

texts.en:
Sapnah is an MBK member who requested her third loan of $100. She helps her husband by collecting second-hand or used goods. She sells the collected goods once a month. From Rp. 600,000 sales, she can get Rp. 300,000 profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Penampungan Barang Bekas (Collecting secondhand goods)

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
For the last two years, Juana has sold underwear and jewellery from catalogues: she is married and has two small children aged 4 and 8. She started her own underwear and jewellery business because she wanted to be independent and to contribute to household expenses, especially as her husband earns a relatively small salary which isn’t sufficient to meet all the family’s needs.

Juana wants to increase her number of customers, and to do this she needs to ensure she has a good range of products. For this reason, she’s asking for a loan of $150 dollars which she will use to purchase stock: thanks to recommendations from family and friends she already knows of many more potential customers. Please contribute to the growth of this business and help Juana.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace dos años, Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y joyería por catálogo, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 4 y 8 años. Inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa interior y joyería porque a ella le gusta ser independiente y contribuir con las obligaciones de su hogar, ya que su esposo tiene un sueldo relativamente bajo, insuficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

Juana quiere incrementar su número de clientes, para hacerlo necesita contar con un buen surtido de sus productos, para lo que solicita un préstamo por $ 150 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, gracias a la recomendación de sus familiares y amigos ha logrado conocer a muchos posibles compradores. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Juana.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is a 19-year-old single mother of one. She sells shoes by catalogue order in her neighborhood. She also has a tiny post in her house where she sends fruits and vegetables. She belongs to a collective with Juana Lopez Panela, who sells decorative bracelets and belts. With the loan, they plan to stock their business with more merchandise and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

VERONICA TIENE 19 AÑOS , MADRE SOLTERA CON UN HIJO, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CALZADOS POR CATALOGOS Y A PEDIDO LOS VENDE CON LOS VECINOS DE SU COMUNIDAD .TAMBIEN TIENE EN SU CASA UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL DONDE VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS . FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SONORA 7 JUNTO CON DOÑA JUANA LOPEZ PANELA ( VENDE PULSERAS Y CINTURONES DE ARTESANIA ) CON EL PRESTAMO AUMENTARAN SUS COMPRAS Y ASI TENDRAN SUS NEGOCIOS MAS ABASTECIDOS DE LAS MERCADERIAS QUE VENDEN .

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sopiah

texts.id:
Sopiah is the mother of 3 children, and a grandmother of 7; yet Sopiah still has a strong will to be productive despite her elderly age. Sopiah has a catering business to make cakes for the family living. The business she is in includes making colored rice, mixed rice, uduk (meat & spices) rice, yellow rice, bolu (some sort of local) cake, tart cake, and others. In a week Sopiah received orders of around 200 to 500 rice products, and each rice package were priced between Rupiah 5000 -7000 (about 60-80 US cents) depending on the taste of the orderer. Sopiah begins to work on her food around 03:00 in the morning, until finished, then deliver the order by her motor bike. In a week Sopiah is able to profit about Rupiah 500,000 (about $56), and with that profit Sopiah was able to provide basic schooling for her children until they finished; now she even like to help her grandchildren to fulfill their dream.
__________________

Sopiah adalah ibu dari 3 orang anak dan nenek dari 7 orang cucu namun dengan begitu Sopiah masih mempunyai semangat yang luar biasa untuk menjadi manusia yang produktif meskipun usianya sudah semakin senja. Sopiah mempunyai usaha Catering serta membuat kue untuk menghidupi keluarganya. pekerjaan yang dia tekuni adalah; membuat nasi jinggo, nasi campur, nasi uduk, nasi kuning, kue bolu, kue tart, dan lain-lain. dalam waktu seminggu Sopiah mendapat orderan sekitar 200 sampai 500 bungkus nasi yang perbungkusnya diberi harga bervariasi antara 5000 rupiah - 7000 rupiah tergantung dari selera pemesan. Sopiah mulai mengolah bahan makanan sekitar jam 03.00 pagi sampai selesai kemudian diantar ke pelanggan dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. dalam seminggu Sopiah mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan dari usahanya sampai 500.000 rupiah/minggu dan lewat keuntungan itu Sopiah mampu menyekolahkan anaknya sampai selesai bahkan bertekat untuk membantu cucu-cucunya dalam menggapai cita-cita mereka.

loans.use:
To buy Food ingredients ________________
Membeli bahan-bahan makanan

loans.name: Ikechukwu

texts.en: Ikechukwu E. is 27 years old and lives in Benin City. He sells provisions, and is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to enable him to buy more provisions for sale. He has been in business since 2003.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Flora Francisca

texts.es:
We found Doña Flora ready to leave to sell her kitchen condiments: thanks to her sales skills, she goes offering her products from shop to shop through the streets of the town where she lives, Juliaca. This activity fills her with happiness and satisfaction, due to the daily good results that she obtains with her long walks.

Flora’s wish as a enterprising and hardworking mother is to improve the quantity of merchandise she can offer, until she manages to become the most important distributor of condiments in the town. She works incredibly hard, hoping to improve her quality of life. While she devotes herself to this noble aim, her husband works in a mine far from their village: between them they look to provide their five lovely children with well-being and education.

To realise her aims Flora is asking for a loan which she promises to repay within six months. Let us make this possible for her, in order that Flora and her family continue to prosper.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Encontramos a doña Flora, lista para salir a ofrecer sus condimentos de cocina, negocio que gracias a su habilidad de venta va ofreciendo tienda por tienda por las diferentes calles de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca. Esta actividad la llena de mucha alegría y satisfacción por los buenos resultados que día a día va obteniendo con sus largas caminatas.

El deseo de doña Flora, madre emprendedora y muy laboriosa es aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería, hasta lograr ser la distribuidora de condimentos más importante de su ciudad, ella trabaja arduamente con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y mientras ella se dedica a esta noble labor su esposo se desempeña como obrero en una mina muy lejana de su pueblo, y entre ambos buscan ofrecerles bienestar y educación a sus cinco queridos hijos.

Para concretar sus deseos solicita un préstamo que promete reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses.Posibilitemos su petición para que siga prosperando junto a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase a larger quality and variety of condiments in order to consolidate her business and in a short time become the most important distributor in her town.

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi A. is a widow with seven children. Her husband died some years ago and she is still fighting for her children’s future. She has had no job and she is now joining the SPBD programme for help.

This is her first loan and her plan is to start up a pancake business, together with her existing plantation. She is from the village of Saoluafata where a secondary school is located, and she is planning to sell pancakes at this school for more money. Lagi is striving to the limit to make sure her children will have a better education and be successful in the future.

loans.use: Buy chemicals and bush knives for her little farm, and a bag of flour and a fryer for her pancakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in her and her husband's furniture making business

loans.name: Sonia Sanjuana

texts.es:
Thanks to my other loan I was able to buy new clothes, of better quality, different sizes and models, and as a result my business has grown and I have more clients. I would like to buy a tarp so that I can roof the place where I sell my merchandise so that during the summer season the sun does not damage the clothes. I am requesting a loan of $500 in order to buy the tent that will protect my merchandise from the sun and will make my clients more comfortable while browsing through the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Gracias por el préstamo pude comprar ropa nueva, de mejor calidad, diferentes talla y modelos el negocio a crecido bastante y tengo mas clientes. Me gustaría mucho compara una carpa de lona para techar el lugar donde vendo para esta temporada de calor y con el sol no se vayan a dañar la ropa. Solicito un préstamo de $500.00 Dlls para la comprar de una carpa de lona para cubrir la mercancía del sol y que los clientes al ver la mercancía no estén incómodos.

loans.use: To buy a tent for my business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 33-year-old woman. She works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has one child. Fatima sells household products and accessories. This is the second time she's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Farida's Baraka Group

texts.en:
Farida is 30 years old, married and has a child who is 12 years old. Farida owns a small food store, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rukia, who also has a food store.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Mrs. Bola A. lives in Lagos State in Nigeria. She is a hair stylist in her area. Bola acquired her skill over three years and has been in this business since 1998. She is 32 years old and married.

She needs a loan amount of $1025 to buy more weavons, attachments, and hair cream so that she can serve her customer better.

loans.use: To buy weavons, attachments, and hair cream for her salon.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is a member of the LA MUJER RIOJANA Bank, and lives in San Martín, Rioja Province, Rioja District. She sells salchipapas (fried hot dog slices and french fries) and salchi-pollo (fried chicken and french fries). Her business is based on the main streets in the city, where there are plenty of customers on a daily basis who enjoy this type of food. She started this business with the help of her daughters, as a result of the difficult economic situation they were facing. And so, their situation improved and now the business is making consistent sales on a daily basis. With the loan of S/ 3000.00 which will be paid back over a period of 6 months, she will buy the ingredients needed for her dishes such as: bags of hot dog slices, vegetables for salads, tubs of oil, sauces such as mayonnaise, ketchup, tubs of mustard, as well as utensils such as: throw-away plates, forks, and cups, which will bring her more customers and ensure her business of the highest quality and hygiene standard. Isabel is a persistent and friendly woman. She is 52 and lives with her two daughters, who motivate her each day. For the future, she hopes to improve and expand the environment where her business can develop and offer a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Isabel es socia del BANCO COMUNAL “LA MUJER RIOJANA”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. Rioja y distrito D. Rioja se dedica a la venta D. Salchi-papa y salchi-pollo, su negocio se ubica en un local D. las principales calles D. la ciudad, donD. diariamente acuden gran cantidad D. clientes que gustan D. este tipo D. comidas. Se inicio en este negocio con la ayuda D. sus hijas debido a la difícil situación económica en que estaba atravesando , iniciando así su crecimiento económico, hoy en día tiene asegurada su venta diaria. Con este préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 que devolverá en un plazo D. 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación D. salchi papas y salchi pollos, como: papas en sacos, verduras para las ensaladas, aceite en baldes , cremas como, mayonesa, kepchu, mostaza en baldes ,utensilios como: platos, tenedores, vasos descartables que harán posible la buena atención a sus clientes ya cada vez son numerosos y exigen una atención D. buena calidad e higiénica. Isabel es una mujer perseverante y muy amigable, tiene 52 años, vive con su sus dos hijas, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y alcanzar sus objetivos, desea para el futuro mejorar y ampliar el ambiente donD. desarrolla su negocio y así dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Elice's Group

texts.en:
Elice has owned a beauty salon in Arusha for one year. She is 26 years old and married with one 3-year-old child. She works everyday from 8:00am to 9:30pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $100 each month.

Elice is hoping to use this loan to buy more hair dryers for her salon. She will share the loan with her fellow group members who also own businesses in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more hair dryers for her salon.

loans.name: Crecimiento De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Paulina es casada, tiene 7 hijos con edades D. 10 a 27 años, ellos están en L. escueL. y los mayores en L. universidad, se dedica a L. venta D. comidas y tiene una tienda D. abarrotes. Su negocio empezó cuando elL. vivía en Ambato, donD. los gastos los costeaba su esposo que era el único que trabajaba como Promotor D. Salud, el dinero no les alcanzaba, entonces Paulina empezó a llevar dulces al Colegio, con mucho esfuerzo empezó a incrementar sus ventas y a preparar almuerzo para los profesores, así inicio su negocio. Paulina solicita un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles, para comprar mas mercadería entre carne y verduras y así surtir su tienda y cafetín. Paulina sale adelante, uno D. sus hijos tiene retardo mental, el cual necesita cuidados especiales. ElL. esta segura que podrá salir adelante.

Leoncia, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, tiene un negocio D. tejido a palitos, hace medias, guantes, gorros. Leoncia nos cuenta que su esposo era machista no le gustaba que elL. trabaje, elL. tenia que hacer sus tejidos a escondidas y luego los vendía y a veces hacia trueque con azúcar o verduras. Ahora elL. maneja sus ingresos con L. ayuda D. los prestamos compra lanas en cono y moldes y continua tejiendo. Leoncia solicita un préstamo D. 200 soles, que le ayudaran en su negocio. ElL. sueña con tener su propia empresa textil.

Emilia es casada y tiene 6 hijos, tiene su negocio D. venta D. hoja D. coca y hace tejidos que venD. por semanas. Emilia solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles con los que desea surtir su negocio. ElL. espera ahorrar para poder construir su casa y poner una tienda D. abarrotes que le ayudara a pagar los estudios D. sus hijos y tenerlos profesionales.
texts.en:
Paulina is married and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 27. All of them are in school, the older ones in university. Paulina's job is selling food and she has a grocery store. Her business began when she lived in Ambato, where her husband used to pay for everything as he was the one with work. He used to be a health advocate, but he didn't earn enough, so Paulina began taking candy to the local high school. By working hard she began to increase sales and to prepare lunches for the teachers--in this way her business got going.

Paulina is asking for a loan of 1000 soles to buy more merchandise such as meat and vegetables to stock her store and small cafe. She is making progress, but one of her children is developmentally challenged and needs special care. She is sure that she will succeed.

Leoncia is married and has five children. She has a knitting business making socks, gloves, and woollen hats. Leoncia says that her husband used to be a male chauvenist and didn't like his wife working. She had to do her knitting, hiD. the items, and then sell them. Sometimes she exchanged them for sugar or vegetables. Now she manages her income with the help of loans. She buys wool and patterns and continues her knitting. She is asking for a loan of 200 soles which will help her with the business. Her dream is to open her own textile company.

Emilia is married and has six children. She has her own business selling coca leaves and she also does weaving which she sells during the week. She is asking for a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to stock her business. She hopes to save enough to build her own house, open a grocery store which will help to pay for the education of her children, and have her children in professional jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The bank Crecimiento de Jes´su is asking for a loan of 5,500 soles to support its members and allow them to buy stock for their businesses.

texts.es:
El bancomunal Tayta Espíritu esta ubicado en la comunidad de La Mejorado, distrito de Mariscal Cáceres en Huancavelica.

Elsa C., se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, se inició hace 10 años junto a su esposo, fue muy difícil porque tenían poco capital. Cuando sus hijos fueron creciendo los gastos eran mas grandes, Elsa usará su préstamo en incrementar su negocio.

Edeliza Quispe, se dedica a la venta de ropa en las ferias de Yauli, Ascoria e Izcuchaca, su esposo trabaja en la chacra, así solventa su hogar de sus 7 hijos, ellos se iniciaron con poco capital, pues los bancos les pedían muchas cosas y era difícil solicitar un préstamo. Con el apoyo de FINCA a comprado mercadería, ahora desea invertir porque se vienen las fiestas navideñas y el negocio es bueno en esa época.

Ana Antonia, tiene una bodega, antes vendía hojas de coca y gaseosas, ella desea con el préstamo incrementar su negocio para ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: El bancomunal Tayta Epiritu necesita 6300 nuevos soles para que sus 11 socias inviertan en sus negocios.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
De 44 años, el señor Milton ha dedicado 17 de ellos en su ferretería, gran sostén económico de su familia ( esposa e hijos- de 16, 14 y 1 1/2 años de edad-), debido a la gran competencia por parte de las grandes tiendas comerciales del sector en el país, tuvo que mudarse junto con su tienda hace 2 años a dicho barrio de Puente Piedra (1 hora al norte del Centro de Lima);  fue una gran decisión, le ha ido más que bien, brindándole a sus hijos una buena educación y a su más pequeñita, una sana alimentación y óptima crianza. El señor Milton teme de su salud pero, a la vez, asegura que no hay mejor herencia que la educación y un ingreso, como lo es el de la ferretería.

Para tan añorada meta y, en aras de poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, de poder contratar a alguien que lo supla o asista en las ventas, así como en la compra de más mercadería, es que necesita de 1400 soles.
texts.en:
Of his 44 years, Mr. Milton has dedicated 17 of them to his hardware store, an important economic support for his family (consisting of his wife and three children aged 16, 14 and one and a half years old). Because of the strong competition from the large stores in the country, Milton had to move (as did his store) two years ago to the neighborhood of Puente Piedra (1 hour north of the Center of Lima). It was an important decision and it has turned out very well, giving his children a good education and his youngest daughter an optimal growth chart and healthy nutrition. Mr. Milton is worried about health, but at the same time he knows that there is no better tool than education and a good income, which his hardware store provides. It is his yearned for goal, with the idea of spending more time with his children, that he wants to hire someone to help with sales or other activities like the purchase of merchandise at the store, that he needs 1400 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise due to the high demand for his products and also hire an additional worker for his store

loans.name: El Amor Group

texts.en:
"El Amor" is a large group of 25 borrowers. In this loan, 5 members of this group are hoping to receive their third loan. The first two loans helped each of these members start a small business, and all members started to experience a little bit of success.

Martina R. is the group representative, and a perfect example of the power of micro credit. Martina took her first two loans and started a small business selling used clothing. She has really increased her business, and is finally starting to feel able to take care of her family. Martina is the mother to 4 children, and would love to send all her children to college someday. She is very excited about the things that are starting to happen in her life, and ready for the challenges ahead.

On behalf of Martina, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support.

loans.use: Buy used clothing

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi I. is a trader. She sells kenkey (maize dumplings) and gari (cassava that has been grated, fermented and roasted) at Atrankwa near Elmina, which she has been doing since 1997.

Esi is divorced and has five dependents. She has received no formal education.

Esi will use the money from her loan to buy more cassava and maize for the preparation of the gari and kenkey. She will use the profits to feed her children and to save towards building a house.

In the photo she is demonstrating how the kenkey is prepared.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and maize for the preparation of gari and kenkey.

loans.name: Bibosi Group

texts.es: El grupo "Bibosi" esta representado por la señora Felicia y conformado por 22 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como al transporte público, secretariado y al comercio D. productos como los cosméticos, panadería, cocina y al comercio D. productos D. la época. Como es D. saber existe gran competencia en el mercado en especial en el ámbito comercial y nuestros socios (as) no son la excepción ellos luchan en sus diferentes puestos D. trabajo para lograr adquirir el ingreso diario para el sustento D. su familia y para cumplir con las diferentes obligaciones D. cada uno D. ellos (as). El destino D. los fondos otorgados por la Fundación Agrocapital es para el incremento D. sus mercaderías y su material D. trabajo para poder rendir mejores ingresos y mejorar así su calidad D. vida. El grupo se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo en la institución en la cual demostraron responsabilidad, cumplimiento y calidad humana, por lo que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y como un grupo numerosa saben como salir adelante juntos.
texts.en:
The "Bibosi" group is represented by Felicia and is maD. up of 22 members who work in different activities such as public transportation, office work, and sales of products such as cosmetics, bakery goods, food and seasonal products. There is a lot of competition in the marketplace, especially in sales, and the members of this group are no exception; they struggle in their different jobs to earn a daily wage to support their families and meet their different obligations. The proceeds of the loan granted by Fundación Agrocapital will be used to increase their inventories and their working materials so that they can be profitable and improve their standard of living. The group is in its second round with Fundación Agrocapital and has shown responsibility, compliance and camaraderie because they all have experience in groups and as a large group they have learned how to pull together.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua K., 55, is the widowed mother of five children - four boys and a girl. Her daughter has completed junior high school and is currently learning a trade, hairdressing, while the boys are still in school. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small town close to Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Akua works very hard to provide for her children as a seller of bananas, purchasing the unripe commodity from farmers in nearby villages and then selling them after ripening to retailers in the local market square. In business for three years, she dreams about saving enough money to support her sons in school, so she is requesting a loan to procure bananas in bulk in order to maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure bananas.

loans.name: Cojocaru

texts.en: N. is a business woman in the town where she lives. She is 64 years old and currently earns an average monthly profit of $200. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting a loan to buy more pumpkin seeds so she can buy more items for her business. She hopes, that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. N. is married and has two children. She must support her children even when her profits are low.

loans.use: to grow her business

loans.name: Somialo

texts.fr: Née le 30 mai 1975 à Adjengré, Mme Somialo A. est marée et a trois personnes à charge. N’ayant pas en la chance d’aller à l’école, faute de moyen financier, elle entreprit le petit commerce de vente de sandalettes devant sa devanture. Très soucieuse de son avenir, elle sollicite un financement pour ouvrir une boutique et mieux s’installer. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter son revenu et veiller à la survie de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on May 30, 1975 in Adjengré, Mrs Somialo A. is married and responsible for 3 people. Not having had the chance to go to school, given a lack of financial means, she started a small business to sell sandals on her stand. Very mindful of her future, she is asking for a loan to open a shop and establish herself better. She will therefore be able to increase her revenue and ensure the survival of all her family.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sell shoes

loans.name: Faauuga

texts.en:
Faauuga F., 26, is married with 3 children. She has 5 years of experience in the pancake and pork bun business. She sells to the general public 5 days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 125 Tala (58 USD). SPBD loans are Faauuga’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Faauuga plans to use the loan to purchase basins, fryer, flour, sugar, yeast, containers, onions, lamp flaps, oil, soya sauce and garlic onions.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her pancake and pork bun business

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.en:
The “Renaissance” Bank is a made of fifteen people - male and female entrepreneurs. There 3 groups that make up the bank receiving a loan. After successfully repaying their 1S.and 2nd loans they are looking forward to the continuing success and growth of their businesses with their 3rd loan. Though small, the group has a wide rA. of businesses: from cosmetics to artwork. 

ClosS. G. is the president of the group. He is a husband and father of 7 children. This hardworking dad sells a variety of products including cosmetics, notebooks, and artwork.  As a result of his hard work and with the help of the previous loans, his business has increased profits.
