He is grateful for the experience because prior to the loan it was difficult to afford paying for the children’s food and schooling. The experience of borrowing has made these expenses more manageable.  He also contributes his strengthened relationship and faith in God to his interaction with Esperanza and the staff. He realizes that his story isn’t unique in that there are many people in the area who are experiencing more success and are able to feed and educate their children. On behalf of ClosS., Renaissance and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase lotions, cosmetics, notebooks, writing materials, artwork for their businesses.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru:
Рафоат Азимова добрая, трудолюбивая женщина. Занимается Рафоат продажей пищевых продуктов на рынке города Истаравшана.
 Ее муж Чурабой Мамуров и их сын работают мастерами по производству деревянных окон и дверей.
 Предпинимательская деятельность Рафоат и мастерство ее мужа и сына, все вместе взятых, приносят доход в их семью.
 Рафоат подала заявку на получение займа.На полученный займ хочет приобрести компьютер для своего любимого внука. Она мечтает, чтобы ее внук  мог свободно владеть компьютером, а сам Далерджон (имя внука Рафоат),  с нетерпением ждет подарок от бабушки.
texts.en:
Rafoat A. is a good, hard-working woman, who sells food at the Istaravshan town market. Her husband Churaboy Mamurov and their son are master craftsmen who manufacture wooden doors and windows. Rafoat's business endeavors and her husband and son's craftsmanship, all told, provide income for the family. Rafoat applied for the loan to purchase a computer for her favorite grandson, Dalerjon She hopes that her grandson will become an adept computer user; he is waiting patiently for the gift from his grandmother.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer purchase

loans.name: Dolores Aleyda

texts.es: La joven Dolores López de 26 años de edad, con su casa de habitación situado en el barrio Camilo Chamorro de la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de apenas un año de vida. Madre soltera trabajadora, luchadora por la igualdad de oportunidades y reguardadora de los derechos de la niñez, de principios éticos y morales, por lo cual ha escogido la profesión de maestra. Desde hace cuatro años labora en una escuela de la capital en donde se desempeña enseñando a los futuros profesionales de nuestro país. Tiene como planes de corto plazo la construcción de un cuarto para tener mayor seguridad y protección. Gracias al préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, zinc, clavos, hierro, bloque, perlines y piso. Realizando su cuarto que es de mucho beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores López is 26 years old and has one child who is barely a year old. Her house is located in the Camilo Chamorra neighbourhood in the capital, Managua.
She is a hardworking single mother, who, as an ethically and morally principled advocate for equal opportunities and defender of children’s rights, has chosen the teaching profession. For four years she has worked at a school in the capital, where she teaches the future professionals of our country.
Her short term plans are to construct a room that will give her better security and protection. Thanks to this loan through Afodenic, she will be able to purchase construction materials like: cement, zinc, nails, iron, blocks, beams and flooring. Completing this room will be very beneficial for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora N. is thirty-four years old. She is a married and has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in the nursery school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason.

Debora is a seamstress by profession. She designs and sews for clients and also for sale. Debora has her workshop on the street in her community. She says that, at the moment, she has six apprentices under training. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie M. is from the village of Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a "sari-sari", or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Perla Leonor

texts.es: La Señora Perla Méndez tiene 35 años de edad, habitante de la comarca Villa del Carmen del municipio de Managua, Soltera con tres hijos de 19,16 y 8 años de edad. Madre emprendedora que en primer estancias esta la mejora de su condiciones de vida para sus hijos. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de secretaria de registro público desde hace 6 meses anteriormente trabaja en una farmacia como despachadora. Con dificultades  pero ha logrado ir construyendo su vivienda poco a poco le falta unos de lo cuarto, el cual gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara: bloque, cemento, perlines y arena construyendo un cuarto seguro.
texts.en:
Perla Méndez is 35 years old and a resident of Villa del Carmen in the municipality of Managua. She is single with three children who are 19,16 and 8 years of age. She is a hard-working mother whose primary goal is to improve her children's living conditions. For six months, she has worked in the Villa del Carmen town hall in the role of Public Registry Secretary. Previously, she worked in a pharmacy as a dispatcher. Despite difficulties, she has been building her house gradually but lacks a room. Thanks to the Afodenic loan, she will purchase cement, beams and sand to build a safe room.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room.

loans.name: Edelma Del Rosario

texts.es: Edelma está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), vive en la  colonia la Unión, trabaja como docente de la Esc. Rubén Darío # 2, desde hace 9 años tiene un hijo de 6  añitos de edad estudia su  primer grado, su esposo trabaja como albañil y comparten los gastos del hogar,  es una mujer  con alto espiritu de superación personal, muy responsable, es una mujer que ama su trabajo, su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la carrera en ciencias de la Educación, tener salud  y terminar de construir su  vivienda para así darle  mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Edelma is asking for refinancing of her 3rd loan in order to invest in the improvement of her home (construction of a room.) She lives in the La Union district, and has worked in education in the Ruben Dario School #2 for the past 9 years. She has a 6 year old son who is currently in primary school, and her husband works as a builder and shares the costs of their home. Edelma is a woman who loves her job. Her dream is continue her career to finish studying education science, to be healthy, and to finish constructing her home so as to provide better conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Tojikul

texts.ru: Точикул Юсуфова проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 41 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж вместе с сыном работают на частной стройке. Сама Точикул дома занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. У нее имеются постоянные клиенты. Кредит просит для закупа скота.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: 22 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El grupo “22 de Agosto” esta representado por la señora Marioly y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución, la mayoría de los socios se dedica  a la venta de pan, empanadas y a la prestación de servicios. La competencia dentro de su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pese a que es su primer ciclo gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital y están dispuestas a sacar adelante a sus pequeños negocios ya que de ello dependen sus familias.
texts.en:
The “22 de Agosto” (August 22nd) Group is led by Sra. Marioly and consists of 12 members who are starting their first loan cycle with the Institution. Most of the members either sell products, such as bread or empanandas, or provide services. Competition is high in the marketplace, but they know how to get ahead in their respective businesses.

Their loan will be used to grow their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools needed to increase their earnings and improve the quality of life for their families. Regarding their credit experience, the members have worked with solidarity loans before at other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are prepared to succeed in their small businesses because their families depend on them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro G. and Margarita Lopez have been married for more than 30 years. They live in their own home, which is located a few kilometers away from the city. The couple have grown children who contribute to the household income.

Pedro, age 56, has owned a sausage factory for over 25 years. The factory is operated by Pedro and his children. He has formed a strong clientele over many years, making his business sustainable and profitable.

Pedro needs credit to purchase raw materials to manufacture his products, which are in high demand because they are of good quality.

loans.use: To buy raw materials that will be used in the factory

loans.name: Ataa

texts.en: Ataa sells secondhand textile goods such as bed sheets and dresses. She is 39 years old, married and has a child who is in school. Ataa lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. Ataa buys her goods from Kumasi and sells on a tabletop at the local market square. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for a year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy secondhand textiles

loans.name: Arvin Ian

texts.en: Arvin Ian S. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. He is 22 years old and is single. Arvin Ian owns and operates a business providing motor services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Arvin Ian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie P. is from the village of Rizal Jimenez Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Margie is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Margie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Margie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Margie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby piglets to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly S. A., 46 years old, lives with her own small family in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Ly S. A. is a good homemaker who stays A. home to either care for the children or do housework. She also cultivates a rice crop during the approaching farming season. Ly S. A. is married and blessed with eight children, one of whom works in construction.

Her husband is a local construction foreman who has many employees who help provide his service. Ly S. A. requests a loan for her husband to use as capital to purchase more building equipment in order to better provide for the needs of his customers.

loans.use: Purchase more building equipment to better provide for the needs of customers

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
.   
El comité “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas”tiene  mas de 2 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 2 señoras que emprenderán actividades.
 Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras , venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso ,venta de mercaderías varias como :fideo ,azúcar , harina ,aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos ,venta de ropas , venta de remedios etc. Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales  para  su desarrollo y formación. 
Unos de los casos es el de Doña Francisca vendedora de yuyos quien desde muy temprana se traslada en el mercado para comprar su mercadería y recorre para venderla en las despensas y casas particulares de diferentes Barrios de la ciudad de Asunción.
Ella muy querida por sus clientes y los mismos siempre compran sus productos nos comentó Doña Francisca y a la ves agradece al a Fundación Paraguaya por apoyarle en su trabajo que sostiene a su familia con 10 integrantes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajando Juntas" (Women Working Together) village bank has been in existence for two years and works with the Fundación Paraguaya. Most of its members are already working productively, but two of its members are women who have yet to begin activities. The activities they carry out include the sale of fruits and vegetables, sale of home-made foods such as meat, chicken and ham empanadas (savory pastries); the sale of various goods like noodles, sugar, flour, oil, and ham; and articles such as clothing, home remedies and others. They dream of a better future for their children, and for this reason work twice as hard to provide them with the things they need for their development and education.

One example is that of Doña Francisca, a seller of medicinal herbs who goes to the market early in the morning to buy her merchandise and hurries back to sell it among the shops and households in different neighborhoods in the city of Asunción. She is much loved by her clients, and the same ones always buy her products, says Doña Francisca, who in turn thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for supporting her in her work which maintains her family of ten.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale such as: Christmas items, Herbal Remedies, and Food Ingredients.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
K. Zuhro fights daily to help increase the family income so her children may have all that is necessary to have a good life. Her perseverance has given her family the assurance that she does everything possible to make their lives pleasant. Thanks to the hard work she invested in agriculture, she was able to purchase a small plot of land that she is farming together with her husband. However, the produce has decreased and the family expenses are using up the little capital they have. Zuhro, her husband and her daughter (pictured) have decided to purchase potato and onion seeds, as this crop is needed by the community year round. The situation that Zuhro finds herself in has made her ask for a loan of 3,500 Somoni. She hopes that she will find sensitive collaborators to help her get through these hard times. Your support will really help her.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Saylamo

texts.ru: Хасанова Сайламо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 49 лет. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Хасанова Сайламо имеет высшее образование по специальности "Товаровед". В области торговли работает более чем 28 лет. Она торгует в своем собственном магазине. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saylamo H. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 49 years old, married and has one child. Saylamo has a higher education in the merchandiser specialty. She has been working in the retail sales field for over 28 years. She sells at her own store. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Úrsula

texts.es:
La señora Ursula M. se dedica a la venta de verduras en el municipio de Chichigalpa donde ofrece diferentes tipos de verduras tales como papa, cebollas, yuca, entre otros.
La razón por la que ella está solicitando el crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de las verduras tales como la papa, cebollas, yuca, tomate y chiltomas con el propósito de venderlas y de esta manera generar sus ingresos para su desarrollo y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Ursula M. sells vegetables in Chichigalpa. She stocks several kinds of vegetables like: potatoes, onions, yucca, among others. The reason behind her loan request is to buy more vegetables like: onions, yucca, tomatoes and peppers to sell so that she can continue to earn income for her own and her family's development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Kyakapekye Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
M. Alice, in the small photo in the top left-hand corner, is the leader of her lending group, although she does not appear in the big group photo. She is a friendly and very hardworking lady. She is married with seven children and also takes care of two dependents. 

Alice is in the business of selling produce from Kiboti trading centre. She ensures that her produce is of good quality in order to maintain her customers. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of produce and to have a stable family. Alice needs a loan to buy more produce and increase her stock, and thereby, increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza A. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread cooked by frying it in oil and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour for making more bread to sell. Zaza is 49 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour to make more bread to sell.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Née en 1982, A. Philomène vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Djassin Daho dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo au Bénin. Philomène est mariée à HOUESSOU Honoré, un vendeur de gravier et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble et le couple assure les différentes charges de la famille. Philomène n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Philomène vend depuis 15 ans, du poisson frais au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. Philomène s'approvisionne à Djassin Tokpa, un quartier de Porto-Novo. C'est la première fois que Philomène sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à augmenter son fonds de roulement et à renforcer son activité, pour mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1982, A. Philomène has lived for twenty years in the Djassin Daho quarter in the third district of the city of Porto-Novo in Benin. She is married to HOUESSOU Honoré, a gravel seller, and is the mother of four children, who are all in school. The family lives together, and the couple ensure that their various family expenses are covered. Philomène did not attend school. To make sure her needs and those of her children are met, she has been selling fresh fish for fifteen years at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. She gets her supplies in the Djassin Tokpa quarter, in Porto-Novo. This is the first time Philomène is requesting a loan from ALIDé. It will be used to augment her working capital and to bolster her business. This will allow her to cope with the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fresh fish

loans.name: Ntonwa Bakyara Group Of Kyenjojo

texts.en:
On the face of it, B. Deus seems a hard-grinding businessman. The 39-year-old married father of seven school-going kids sweats his guts out selling produce in a small rural town called Ntonwa in Kyenjojo district. He has been doing this for the last three years.

In a month Deus makes close to 30,000 shillings. This is quite modest by any standards. As such he requires a loan that will help him buy more food supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy additional produce like beans maize and coffee

loans.name: Kon Tol

texts.en:
Mrs. Kon Tol B., born in 1983, lives in Kaoh Reah Leu village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who hires a small piece of land on which to grow crops to support her family.

In her crop field Mrs. Kon Tol B. has some problems because her field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve her crop, she decided to ask for a loan to buy gasoline to pump water to support her papaya field.

Mrs. Kon Tol B.’s husband, Mr. Sok Oun, is a horse and cart driver who is able to earn some money to support his family living. They have two children who are too small to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to pump water to irrigate her papaya field

loans.name: Unidos Por El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Ana A. tiene 30 años D. edad convive con el padre D. sus tres menores hijos , integra  la  Alcancía Comunal  Unidos por el Triunfo, ella se inicio ven la venta D. ropa D. forma ambulatoria  por el sector donD. vive , empezó con una pequeña capital, con el tiempo su ingreso fue mejorando ya que  sus ganancias  lo ahorraba para la  inversión   D. su mercadería como ( polos , pantalones, sabanas)   ha incrementado su venta  y ahora venD. también la venta D. zapatos y zapatillas también realiza los domingos en su domicilio la preparación D. caldo D. cordero  plato típico D. la sierra central del  Perú y los venD.  Este préstamo actual lo invertirá  en la compra D. su mercadería  como también en ingredientes  para la preparación del caldo D. cordero.

Las metas que se ha propuesto es  en  la compra D. un carrito sanduchero  para poder vender salchipapas y pollo broaster  meta que está segura  D. realizarlo,  y lo más importante el apoyo, educación y amor a sus hijos
texts.en:
Ana Maria is is 30 years old and lives with the father of her three youngest children. She is a member of the Alcancía Comunal Unidos por el Triunfo (United for Triumph Community Bank). She started selling clothes as a street vendor in the area where she lives: she started with a small sum of money, but as her earnings have improved in time, as she saved money to buy products such as T-shirts, trousers, sheets. She has increased her income, and now she is also sells shoes and slippers, and on Sundays she prepares and sells caldo D. cordero (lamb soup), a typical dish of the central mountain area of Peru. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy both garments and ingredients to prepare the lamb soup. She aims to buy a sandwich cart to sell salchipapas (sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries) and Broaster chicken, a goal she is sure to achieve, even if the most important thing to her is to help, educate and love her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy garments to sell and ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Los Angelitos Group

texts.es:
Los Angelitos está conformado por tres jovenes trabajadoras una de ellas es María F. L. quien tiene una venta desde hace dos años y comercializa cosméticos. El sueño de ella es tener un tramo en el mercado oriental objetivo que lograra gracias a su trabajo arduo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha H. quien vende ropa nueva y usada en su casa y Gloria C. tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosas y chiverias desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
Los Angelitos is made up of three young workers. On of these women is María F. who has been selling cosmetics for two years now. Her dream is to have a lot in the Eastern Market that she has earned thanks to hard work. The other group members are Martha H. who sells new and used clothing from her house and Gloria C. who has a small stand selling sodas and snacks, which she has been doing for four years

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic grain, meat, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou/ndoffene Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité « SOPE ERIGNE FALLOU » du Banc Villageois deNDOFFENE1 est composé de 11 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles ont créé leur groupe de solidarité par liens de parenté et d’affinité depuis la mise en place de leur Banc Villageois en 2007. Dans le groupe on trouve des femmes d’âges différents (entre 35 et 50 ans), elles sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 3 enfants. Elles ont comme activités principale l’embouche bovine et/ou ovine. Et comme activité secondaire elle font du petit commerce de céréales locales. La proximité des marchés hebdomadaire leur facilite l’écoulement de leurs produits. 

La responsable du groupe de solidarité Madame NAR N. debout à droit de la photo en grand boubou  jaune avec de fleurettes, est âgée de 58 ans ; elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et vend du mil et de l’huile d’arachide qu’elle prépare de ses mains. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de se procurer de plus de bénéfices qui contribueront à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The borrowing group "Sope Erigne Fallou" of the NDOFFENE1 Village Bank consists of 11 women, all from the same village. They created their group through links of kinship and affinity after the establishment of their Village Bank in 2007. In the group are women of different ages (between 35 and 50). They are all married and mothers of at least 3 children. Their main activities are beef fattening and/or sheep fattening. As a secondary activity they have small local grain businesses. The proximity of the weekly markets facilitates the sales of their products. The head of the group is Mrs. Nar N., standing in the right of the photo in the full yellow robe with flowers. She is 58; married and a mother of 7 children. She fattens sheep and sells millet and groundnut oil that she prepares by hand. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business in order to obtain more earnings which will contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions, such as food and health.

Translated from French by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote their businesses

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: S. Julienne est née en 1946 et vit depuis cinquante ans environs au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou,  capitale économique du Bénin. Julienne est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et qui ne sont plus à sa charge. C’est une veuve, qui vit donc seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Julienne n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Julienne vend divers produits (arachide grillé, bombons, biscuits, lait, etc.) à son domicile. Julienne exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans. Julienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne a déjà obtenu une fois de prêt à ALIDé et a bien remboursé. Julienne sollicite à nouveau un crédit afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de revenus, grâce à ses ventes.
texts.en:
Julienne S. was born in 1946 and has lived for about 50 years in the Abokicodji neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She has five children who all went to school. None of them is now dependent on her. She is a widow who lives alone and supports herself. She never went to school. To meet her needs, she sells various products from her home (roasted peanuts, candy, cookies, milk and so on). She has been doing this for about 15 years. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. She has paid back one loan from ALIDé, and would like a second one to grow her business and increase her income.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products such as candy, cookies and peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man living with his family and four siblings in Lebanon. This young man has been working in a tattoo parlor for the past three years. He makes all kind of designs, and he is very talented on his occupation. He said that he chose this occupation because he feels that it is an art, and he’s very thankful for his decision. Despite his young age, he has been able, during those three years, to build a good business reputation. Today, he is requesting $800 to buy a new tattoo machine in order to expand his business operation into other areas. In the future, he is hoping to open another branch location. He feels positive about his business potential for the coming year.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans through Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: buy a new tattoo machine

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es: Ana Bertha S. C. es una mujer que prefiere estar en el hogar para cuidar a sus hijos, es por ello que desde hace 13 años opto en poner un negocio en su propia casa; lo cual es llamado “Miscelánea Claudia” donde ofrece todo en abarrotes, refrescos, botanas, dulces y mas. El crédito que requieren es para comprar más mercancía y ofrecer a sus clientes calidad. Esta familia es agradable que ha demostrado ser muy responsable ya que con este crédito será el segundo.
texts.en:
Ana Bertha Sanchez C. is a woman that enjoys being at home to take care of her children. For this reason she has been running her business out of her home for the last 13 years. Her business is called "Mescelanea Claudia" where you can buy groceries, soft drinks, snacks, candy and more. She is requesting this loan so that she can offer more products to her clients and continue to offer quality service. Ana has proven to be very responsible, this is her second loan she has taken out with FVP.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock the business

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba T. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Melba is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Melba owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Melba has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 per month.

In 2010, Melba joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melba is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Melba from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana V. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en la escuela Simeón Pereira donde tiene 30 años de laborar para dicho centro. Se le han otorgado tres créditos en ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda. El crédito solicitado lo va invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de seguir mejorando su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Ana V. is originally from the municipality of El Sauce. She works as a primary school teacher in the Simeón Pereira School, and she has 30 years of experience working for this institution. She has received three loans from CEPRODEL, with the objective of improving her home. The loan she is requesting will be invested in buying cement and sand and paying for labor with the aim of continuing to improve the home where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cement and sand, and paying for labor

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Monsieur K. Joseph est né en 1980 à Gamé dans le Zio. Marié et père d’un (01) enfant, il vit actuellement à Wonougba où il gère une pharmacie villageoise dans laquelle il vend les produits pharmaceutiques génériques. Son dévouement et surtout la qualité de ses produits lui ont permis d’avoir beaucoup de clients qui lui sont très fidèles. Toutefois, il n’arrive pas à faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de ses clients faute de moyens financiers. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer suffisamment sa pharmacie. Cela lui permettra de faire de bon chiffre et de meilleurs bénéfices.
texts.en: Monsieur K. Joseph est né en 1980 à Gamé dans le Zio. Marié et père d’un (01) enfant, il vit actuellement à Wonougba où il gère une pharmacie villageoise dans laquelle il vend les produits pharmaceutiques génériques. Son dévouement et surtout la qualité de ses produits lui ont permis d’avoir beaucoup de clients qui lui sont très fidèles. Toutefois, il n’arrive pas à faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de ses clients faute de moyens financiers. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer suffisamment sa pharmacie. Cela lui permettra de faire de bon chiffre et de meilleurs bénéfices.

loans.use: vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques

loans.name: Aalan Yaseen's Group

texts.en:
Aalan lives in the small Pakistani city of Vehari. She has been living in a small area named 555/EB in a three-roomed brick house with her family for many years.
Aalan is a quality embroiderer. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on different types of clothes. She is an expert in preparing wedding clothes. She has been in this business for the past eight years and receives regular orders every month. She knows different embroidery techniques and applies these in making new designs.
Aalan is married to Y. who runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. He sells daily use items such as eggs, sugar, rice and spices. His sales help him to make more income. Aalan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy grocery items in bulk for his grocery shop. These will increase his sales and income because he will have more products to offer to his customers. Aalan is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and that her family’s living standard will improve.

loans.use: To buy grocery items in bulk

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
Abdurasul K. has been offering transportation services in Kanibadam in Northern Tajikistan for the past eight years. He has a beautiful wife and four adorable children. Having already benefited a great deal from IMON International financial services, Abdurasul is now requesting a loan of $1400 USD to cover some maintenance costs and to repair the running gear of his vehicle. He is always trying to find ways to reduce costs and increase his profits.

One of Abdurasul’s main goals is to provide for his family of six. We believe Abdurasul’s perfect credit history with IMON International and focused approach as a businessman will secure prompt loan repayment of the loan to all Kiva lenders.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Marisol De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La joven Marisol de los ángeles A. E., es trabajadora de la alcaldía de Chinandega  desde hace 3 años se desempeña en el cargo de secretaria, es primera vez que saca financiamientos en la institución y los está solicitando para gastos personales para pago de sus estudios
texts.en:
Marisol de los Ángeles A. E. has been employed as a Secretary by the City of Chinandega for the last three years.

This is her first loan request from the institution.  She will use the funds to pay personal educational expenses.

loans.use: For Personal Educational Expenses.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor Jorge Luis T. L., tiene la edad de 41 años es casado y su esposa es secretaria de una empresa privada, ellos tienen un hijo de 9 años, el cual estudia la primaria, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 10 años, en los cuales se ha enfrentado a problemas de plagas y sequia, que han disminuido las cosechas, ocasionándoles problemas económicos que afectan a toda la familia, es para sus terrenos que solicitan un préstamo para un mantenimiento fitosanitario que favorezca los terrenos, con el préstamo compraran fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos, que ha futuro admitan la diversificación de sus siembras y/o la obtención de un terreno para la ampliación de sus plantaciones, que mejoren continuamente las condiciones socio-económicas en las que actualmente habitan.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis T. L. is 41 years old and married. His wife works as a secretary at a private business and they have a 9-year-old son in elementary school. They have been farmers for more than 10 years, during which time they have faced pest and drought problems that have diminished their crops, causing financial problems that affect the entire family.

They are requesting a loan for their farmlands to provide plant health care that helps the crops. With the loan, they will purchase fertilizers, fungicides and plant supplies which will allow for the future diversification of their crops and/or obtaining a piece of land to expand their croplands, which will continuously improve their socio-economic conditions.

loans.use: Plant health care

loans.name: Imtiaz's Group

texts.en:
Imtiaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business of making furniture. Her husband is a carpenter by trade and makes furniture on order. He also makes furniture for his own shop to display his talent to attract more customers. He is a talented and hardworking person and due to his unique furniture designs he gets good orders from his customers. With the loan, he will buy wood and nails in larger quantity and a furniture polisher to make more furniture and improve his sales. 

Imtiaz herself is a housewife and comes from a city called Khanewala in Pakistan. Khanewal is a small city, famous for its agriculture industry. She stays at home and does her household work. She is a mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are enrolled in school and are getting their education except the youngest one who is just 3 years of age. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application.  In her previous loan year, she has built a good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Imtiaz.

loans.use: To buy woods, nails and furniture polisher for furniture-making business

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
La Sra Ninfa de 25 años es casada, su marido, de 27 años se llama Cristian Riveros. Ellos tienen una pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. 
La Sra. Ninfa es propietaria de un negocio, el cual inicio con una plata que tenia ahorrado, fruto de su anterior trabajo en el cual se desempeñaba como secretaria de una prestigiosa empresa de la Argentina. 
Actualmente su negocio tiene 3 años de antigüedad y esta estrategicamente ubicado sobre la avenida principal de la ciudad de Caaguazú.
Solicita el crédito para comprar vestidos de fiesta y gala, pro que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año y colaciones, ademas ya tiene varios pedidos de los mismos. 
Desea un país que tenga a sus gobernantes comprometidos con la gente. Que haya mas trabajo y oportunidades para las personas y no tengan necesidad de viajar al extranjero para progresar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ninfa is 25 years old and is married to her 27 year old husband, Cristian Riveros. They have a little 3 year old girl.

Mrs. Ninfa is a business owner; she began her business with some money that she saved from her previous job as a secretary for a prestigious company in Argentina.

At present, her business is 3 years old and is strategically located in the principal avenue of the city of Caaguazú.

Mrs. Ninfa needs the loan to buy dresses for parties and galas since the end of the year is approaching as are its parties and she already has some requests for some dresses.

Mrs. Ninfa wishes that her country have politicians that are committed to the people, that there are more jobs and opportunities for people and that they don’t have to travel abroad to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy dresses.

loans.name: 11.04.23 Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lien H. T. is a 31 year-old female living in the town of Thieu Hoa. Lien is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 23 (45234).


Lien is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Lien operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Lien has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lien is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  H. T. lien is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  T. T. dan is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  T. T. hue is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  N. T. long is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lien H. T. (10) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Hoa.  Lien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 23 (45234).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lien đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  H. T. lien (10) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  T. T. dan (8) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  T. T. hue (9) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. T. long (7) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.en:
Baktygul S. is the mother of a young and very tight-knit family with three little daughters. Her husband works as an officer at the local administrative branch. To find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Baktygul decided to open a grocery store. She worked hard and managed to develop her business, which now has a monthly profit of 5,000 KGS.

In 2005, with the revenues from selling groceries, Baktygul and her husband started their cattle-breeding business. Presently, they don't have good conditions to maintain their livestock, so Baktygul plans to obtain a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase building materials to construct a barn for her cattle. In the future, she dreams of owning a big farm with a huge number of cattle.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to build a barn

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn M. is from the village of Dansalan Labason Zamboanga Del norte. She is 23 years old. Junelyn is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Junelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Junelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Junelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junelyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Junelyn's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena R. es una joven muy activa que vive en Puerto Colombia, un municipio a la orilla del mar, alli tiene un negocio de miscelanea llamado Variedades Loma de Oro; ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad , su negocio inicò hace dos años con una pequeña vitrina metalica, en la que exhibia articulos de una manera muy tecnica, pues justamente es una experta en mercadeo y ventas porque estudiò esa carrera y ademàs tuvo experiencia de trabajo en un depòsito de viveres,  donde conociò a su hoy esposo y con el que tiene un hijo en la edad de dos años de edad; ambos renunciaron de esta empresa y se dedicaron a trabajar de manera independiente como hasta hoy lo hacen. Por un lado Maria iniciò su negocio de miscelanea a la que agregò un computador portatil y una impresora, pues tambien presta el servicio de transcripciones, comunicaciones por fax y fotocopiaje  y  por otro lado su esposo se dedicò totalmente a su tienda de viveres, ambos negocios han sido importante el el mejoramiento de sus ingresos. El sueño de Maria es ver convertido su miscelanea en un gran almacen, con un surtido que responda a las necesidades de sus clientes en cada temporada del año; por eso hoy aplica a su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, a travès de la lìnea credikiva, con el cual comprarà una fotocopiadora , artulos de papelerìa para atender la demanda de los estudiantes de los colegios cercanos, especialmente en esta època en que los padres de familia deben hacer sus compras de utiles escolares, para responder a las necesidades educativas de sus hijos.  De esta manera Maria y su esposo se esfuerzan por construirle a su pequeño hijo un futuro pometedor, para que cuando sea adulto y mire la inmensidad de su mar encuentre felicidad, en un hermoso escenario donde sus padres forjaron su destino.
texts.en:
Maria Elena R. is a very active youth who lives in Puerto Colombia, a municipality on the edge of the ocean. There she has a miscellaneous business called Variedades Loma de Oro. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. She started her business two years ago with a small metal cabinet in which she displayed items very professionally-- she is an expert in merchandise and sales because she studied this subject and has also had experience in a warehouse. This was where she met her husband. They both left the company and started working independently, which they are still doing today.

Maria started her miscellaneous business, and got a laptop computer and a printer because she also offers transcription, fax, and photocopying services. Her husband works full-time in the grocery store. Both businesses have been integral to the improvement of their income.

Maria's dream is to see her shop grow into a large store, with stock to supply the demand and needs of her customers in every season of the year. With this goal in mind, she is applying for her first loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through Kiva. She will use the loan to purchase a photocopier and stationery to supply the demand of the students from the local schools. This is a season of high demand, when fathers are buying school supplies for their children's educational needs. 

Maria and her husband are working hard to build a promising future for their young child, so that when he is grown and looks upon the vastness of the sea he will find happiness in a beautiful setting where his parents forged his destiny.

loans.use: she will purchase a photocopier and stationery to satisfy the demand of the students from the local schools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her business supplies.

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en:
Duaa is a young woman from Nablus. She finished high school and took a few courses such as computer literacy and English language.
Duaa took a loan from FATEN to pay for a Business Administration course that will help her find a job easier. Duaa has been applying for jobs since she finished her previous jobs and didn't succeed.

Duaa is photographed in the picture here in FATEN's branch office in Nablus.

loans.use: To pay for courses to improve her skills

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and onions. She is 29 years old, married to a driver, and has 5 children who all go to school. Christine took a loan to stock more cooking oil and onions to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusra lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Rasheed Park for the past 30 years. She is a widow and had a very difficult time after the death of her husband. She relied on house rent income which she used to raise her children. Now her children are grown up and have started working. So Nusrat spends most of her time at home doing her household responsibilities. 

She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son has a motorbike rental business and her younger son operates a grocery store in the market. Her daughters stay at home and help their mother in her housework. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her younger son’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy daily use items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, etc. which will enable him to make more sales and earn larger profits. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will bring even  more profits to him and she will be able to save some profits for her daughter’s marriage.   

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time in the previous loan year. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en: Zosimo, a 50-year-old single man, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a vegetable/spices vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. He has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell in his stall. In the future, Zosimo would like to build up and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell in his stall.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn S. and her husband work by planting mushrooms around their house. From this business, this family normally earns an average of $4 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. Presently, when Oeurn S. needs to use the water, she always goes to take it from her neighbor’s well because she doesn’t have a well of her own.  Oeurn S. is seeking a Kiva loan to dig a well for the whole family to use and to expand  her mushroom-planting business. 
Oeurn S., her young baby and her old mother appear in the photo.

loans.use: to dig a well and also to expand  her mushroom-planting business.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Sokunthea, age 29, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sokunthea is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $8 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Sokunthea has been in her business. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase wood to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a farmer in Litein in South Rift Kenya and has been in farming for 12 years, producing tea and eggs and selling to the local market. He employs the services of two farmhands in the farm. He is married with 5 children, ages between 5 and 15 years.

Richard has made a request a loan of 20,933 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is planning to grow the business and set up a modern dairy unit.

Richard mentions expensive labor and poor infrastructure as the challenges in a farming business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo is 55 years old and lives in Taboo, Jimenez. He is married with 3 children. He works in the fishing industry and catches and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 2 years. 

He has requested a loan to purchase materials for his fish cage. Ireneo has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Ireneo hopes that his business will progress so that the extra income will be available for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his fish cage.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: She is 25 Years Old. A Married woman, She will use the loan for Expanding her business and earning  more income for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand the business.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a textile industry in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials and threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth materials and threads

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married and has 12 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelly is 66 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Nelly has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Nelly has been in this business for 22 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 47 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Rosalina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru:
У Юсуфа есть небольшой бизнес по продаже товаров моющих средств и парфюмерии на центральном рынке своего города. Будучи опытным предпринимателем, несмотря на свой юный возраст, он успешно занимается этим видом бизнесом в течение 2 лет и предлагает продукцию хорошего качества по низким ценам. Юсуф поддерживает своих родителей и является образцом среди своих сверстников. Он попросил займ в размере 5500 сомони для расширения ассортимента своего товара. Это первый займ Юсуфа и он надеется, что он поможет ему повысить прибыльность его бизнеса и таким образом улучшить условия жизни его семьи. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Yusuf has a small business of selling cleaning products and perfumery, located at the central market of his town.  Being an experienced entrepreneur, despite his young age, he has been successfully running this business for two years and offers good quality products at low prices.  Yusuf supports his parents and, as such, is a role model among his peers.  He requested a loan in the sum of 5500 somoni in order to expand the assortment of his merchandise.  This is Yusuf's first loan, and he hopes that it will help him increase his business profits and, thus, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase laundry detergents, soap, toothpaste and various cleaning products

loans.name: Nargizahon's Group

texts.en:
Nargizahon is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married to a constructor. He earns about 5,000 KGS per month. Her husband is a retiree, and he also gets a monthly pension 1,800 KGS. Nargizahon has two daughters and a son, all of whom study at school. 

In order to earn additional money Nargizahon breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after being fattened. In this way she contributes an additional 5,000 KGS per month. This profit made it possible to repair the house. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, Nargizahon plans to celebrate her daughter’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Sy-Sikasso-01223 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA au nombre de 4 sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 37 ans,  3 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles polygames dans la  ville de Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait diverses activités telles, l’alimentaire, l’habillement et les prestations de services.
AMI, en boubou bleu foncé fait le commerce de poissons dans ce groupe DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  60kg de poissons soit 25kg de poissons frais et 35 kg de poissons fumés. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché de Hamdallaye de la ville  de Sikasso, et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The "Danaya" group is composed of 4 married women with an average age of 37 years and on average 3 children, who live in polygamous families in the town of Sikasso. This will be their twelfth loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and they are requesting it in order to be able to invest in their businesses so that they can satisfy customer demand. All their previous loans have been fully repaid. The 4 women are all active in different areas including food, clothing and the supply of various services.

Ami, wearing the navy blue dress, sells fish. She will use her part of the loan to buy 60 kgs of fish (25 kgs of fresh fish and 35 kgs of smoked fish). She gets her supplies in the Grand Market of Sikasso and, together with her family, resells them from a fixed location at the Hamdallaye market in Sikasso, for cash. She predicts an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, some of which she will use to repay her loan, the rest of which she plans to save. She would like to increase her revenues so that she can re-invest in her business and increase her level of customer service.

loans.use: to buy smoked and fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn engages in a food vending business in her community to supplement her husband's income. She is 40 years old and has four school-aged children. They aimed to continue sending all of their children to school but due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they cannot afford to finance them all. 

In this regard, Marilyn is aiming to improve her business in order to increase her income and support the education of her children. She is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy sweet potatoes, bananas, pork chops, potatoes, and vegetables to cook and sell in the community. She believes that through her patience and hard work, she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes, bananas, pork chops, potatoes, and vegetables to cook and sell.

loans.name: Bokk Diom 23 Group

texts.fr: Soda est la présidente du groupement. Ce groupement s'active dans le commerce et leur localité se situe à l'ouest du Sénégal. Soda s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans le but de renforcer son stock en marchandises en achetant des paniers de fruits (mangues, mandarines, papayes, arachides) qu'elle va revendre au marché de la ville. Elle veut avoir beaucoup de bénéfices dans son commerce et être autonomie financièrement afin de répondre aux besoins de sa familles et de payer les frais de scolarisation de sa fille
texts.en: Soda is the president of this group.  The members of this group work in commerce and they live in the west of Senegal.  Soda has been working in commerce for more than 10 years.  She is requesting this loan to strengthen her stock of merchandise.  She will buy baskets of fruit (mangos, mandarins, papayas and peanuts).  She will re-sell these products in the town market.  Soda would like to make a lot of profit in her business and be financially independent so that she can respond to her family's needs and pay her daughter's school fees.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fruit)

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un menuisier. Elle a 03 enfants. 
Abra travaille comme profession depuis 2008. Elle vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place après achat à ANIE. Elle travaille avec 01 personne.
Abra a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs, du haricot et des sacs de charbons.
texts.en:
Abra is a 40 year-old lady who is married to a carpenter with whom she has three children. 
She has worked for a living since 2008. She buys cereals from ANIE and sells them to her customers from an area near her home. She works with one other person. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase corn, beans and bags of coal.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hardworking businesswoman aged 27. She is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling clothes for over two years to support her family. Joyce has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers.
