In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to the stock of clothes for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To add to her clothes inventory.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 62-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in farming. Lourdes primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also started a small sari-sari store business at her house. She sells various items like biscuits, coffee, and soap. Lourdes works hard to improve her earnings.

Lourdes has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. Lourdes hopes to succeed in all her ventures.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 26 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. Monique sells potatoes. Her business is well known and well organized. She has one year of experience in this business. She currently employs three people to help her and she works from 8am to 4pm every day except Sunday.

Monique has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her agricultural business by cultivating more potatoes to sell. With any profit, Monique will be able to buy her own house, save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand her agricultural business by cultivating more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 31-years-old and married with seven children.

Jacqueline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jacqueline has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from shell's crafting.

Jacqueline aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, aged 40, is a single mother of one child.  She runs a food stall that has been operating for 15 years.  The business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000.   

This is Anna's second loan with KADET.   She has repaid the previous loan successfully.  She will use the funds to buy food supplies like flour, cooking oil and rice.  Anna hopes to own a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, flour and rice

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 25 years old, married to Samuel, and they are blessed with one child. She has been operating a beauty salon for past two years and gets a monthly profit of 2,000 Kenya shillings per month.

She is requesting her first a loan of Kes 10,000 which she plans to use in expand her salon by buying a blow dryer and steamer thereby having the tools to be able to cater for high-end market clients. 

Her dream is to be able to cater for her family needs.

loans.use: To expand her salon  business by buying another blow dryer and steamer.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia María se ha caracterizado por ser una madre cabeza de familia perseverante y dedicada en su trabajo. Claudia María a sus 37 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 6 años y es separada de su pareja, el cual le enseño la actividad del mantenimiento de computadores. Con esta actividad aprendida, Claudia María inició un negocio de café Internet, en el que atiende todos los días de la semana y así genera los ingresos necesarios para sostener su hogar y brindarle a su hijo todo lo que necesita. Claudia María sueña con que su negocio crezca, se consolide, y sus ingresos aumenten para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, además de ahorrar para garantizarle una buena educación en un futuro próximo.

Debido al uso constante de los computadores de su café Internet, Claudia María necesita hacerles mantenimiento para garantizar su óptimo desempeño, es por esto que necesita de un préstamo para comprar los repuestos necesarios para sus computadores.
texts.en:
Claudia María has described herself as a persevering mother and head of family who is dedicated to her job.  Claudia María, 37, has a six-year-old son and is separated from her partner, who taught her the job of computer maintenance.  Having learned this work, Claudia María started an internet café business that she operates every day of the week.  In this way she generates the necessary income to support her home and give her son everything he needs.  Claudia María dreams that her business will grow and get stronger, that her income will increase so she can give her son a better quality of life, and also that she will save to guarantee him a good education in the near future.

Owing to the constant use of the computers in her internet café, Claudia María needs to do maintenance on them to guarantee their optimum performance.  This is why she needs the loan to buy the necessary parts for her computers.

loans.use: to buy parts to do computer maintenance at her internet cafe.

loans.name: Duo Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
DUO BUENA VISTA
La señora Beatriz Elizabeth está en la necesidad de pedir un nuevo capital ya que ve que sus ventas han crecido, la venta  principal de ella es productos comestibles (frijol,arroz,aceite,jabon,etc)esta venta  quiere de mucho capital y no le alcanza lo que tiene, por eso ella hace una nueva solicitud y así poder comprar lo que el cliente le pide y no perder la oportunidad de superarse a través de sus ventas. aparte de eso como venta secundaria se dedica a La venta de tamales es muy buena para ella ya que cocina muy delicioso y tiene pedidos siempre de tamales. La carne de marrano que es la que ella mas utiliza le subieron de precio y necesita comprar más carne para poder entregar sus pedidos a sus clientes.ella a tenidos otros credito y los a cancelado con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Duo Buena Visa

Beatriz Elizabeth needs to request a new loan because she sees that her sales have grown.  Her primary sales come from grocery products such as beans, rice, oil, soap, etc.  This products require a lot of capital, and she does not have enough.  That is why she is making a new request.  This way she will be able to buy what the customer asks for, and she will not lose the opportunity to succeed via her sales. 

In addition to the products above she also sells tamales.  Tamale sales are very good for her because the way she cooks them is very delicious.  She always has tamale orders.  The pork that she uses the most has gone up in price.  She needs to buy more meat in order to be able to deliver the orders to her customers.

She has had loans in the past and has always paid them off responsibly.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as beans, rice, oil, soap, etc. as well as to buy ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó en esta actividad tiempo atrás cuando decidió vender su volqueta y con la ayuda de su padre, decidió comprar un taxi dado que es era un negocio más rentable.  Labora todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana.  No es casado ni tiene hijos.  Desea a futuro tener una casa propia y de ser posible comprar otro vehículo para hacerlo funcionar como taxi también.  Por ahora requier invertir el crédito en los arreglos para el funcionamiento de su vehículo.
texts.en: This client is from the city of Portoviejo.  He started this activity some time ago when he decided to sell his dump truck and with his father’s help decided to buy a taxi which is a more profitable business.  He works every day starting very early in the morning.  He’s not married and has no children.  He wants in future to own a house and if possible to buy another vehicle and have it work as a taxi too.  For now, he needs the loan to repair his taxi.

loans.use: to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Julia is 53 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Aora Dak village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Aora Dak village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Genga borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Julia and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Julia works as a subsistence farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Julia and four other promoters in her community, including Evalyne, William, Janes and John, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Julia will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Julia wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser system will kill bacteria in water, preventing waterborne diseases and improving health within the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Julia’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Manik

texts.en:
Manik is a 27-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. In 2011, Krishna established her fruits and vegetables business. She started the business to help her husband with their home expenses. Now she runs this business alone because she got separated from her husband last year. Her business is located in a small town called Jeypore and her main customers are Jeypore residents. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 4,000 INR every month from this business. She would like a loan of 35,000 INR. 

Manik requires this loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell. She hopes that this loan will add to her business and bring in more clients. In the future, Manik plans to educate her children and expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Frashier wants to buy packs of matchbox, soft drinks, sacks of sugar, maize, beans, boxes of flour, and cans of cooking fat

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Elei printing is a common business in Samoa that is in high demand with overseas and locals alike. Elei is the art of drawing patterns on a plate and then cutting it into shapes. In Samoa, it is usually in the patterns of traditional Samoan war weapons or national flower, herbs and flowers found on the island. It is then attached to the fabric and painted over with different colours. Epenesa sells her elei materials to people in her village, overseas, at the local market and stores that order her designs.

loans.use: To purchase a dozen paints for printing and designing patterns on the fabrics

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.en:
Ms Bertha is a widow of five years with four children who are financially dependent on her. In the past, her husband had a place where he sold traditional Mexican sweets. Bertha continued the business after his death. She also incorporated other goods, like pottery, cosmetics, etc., for sale. Her youngest child of 12 helps with the business, and together they have been able to move the business forward.

Lamentably, Bertha’s mother died recently, and Bertha spent her savings on the funeral. Now she requests a loan of $325 dollars to stock up on pottery and continue with her work. You can help improve this family’s way of life. They appreciate your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertha es viuda desde hace cinco años, tiene cuatro hijos que dependen económicamente de ella. Anteriormente su esposo tenía un local en el que vendía dulces típicos mexicanos, y ella continuó con el negocio, después fue incorporando la venta de otros bienes como alfarería, coronas para difuntos, cosméticos, etc. En el negocio recibe la ayuda de su hija menor, de 12 años de edad, y juntas han logrado sacarlo adelante.

Lamentablemente, hace poco falleció la madre de Bertha y gastó sus ahorros en el funeral, ahora necesita un préstamo por $ 325 dólares para surtirse de alfarería y poder continuar con su trabajo. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, ellas agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase pottery

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
With most of her children in school age and a swineherd sold off to avoid destruction by epidemy, Duong thi L. has to shoulder the heavy burden of family economy. Her husband, Duong van Hai, a vetenarian, has lost an arm in a work-related accident. Nevertheless he remains productive. Apart from tilling a acre of land, L.'s main concern is her feed store. Being trustworthy and honest, she has built up a stream of clientele who visits her store frequently. She projects to take a loan of US$575 to stock up bran, expand her business and finally raise a new swineherd.

Translated from Vietnamese by Doan Mai, Kiva volunteer.

¾ con đang trong độ tuổi đi học, cả đàn lợn được bán đi sau khi có dịch, gánh nặng kinh tế trong gia đình càng đè nặng lên hai vai chị Dương Thị Luyến, 45 tuổi, xã Bá Hiến, Bình Xuyên. Chồng chị, anh Dương Văn Hải, một y sỹ thú y bị tai nạn lao động mất một cánh tay, vẫn tích cực tham gia lao động sản xuất. Ngoài việc làm 1 mẫu ruộng, công việc chủ yếu của chị Luyến là tập trung vào cửa hàng thức ăn gia súc. Làm ăn có uy tín, cửa hàng của chị Luyến luôn có khách đến mua thường xuyên. Dự định của chị Luyến là vay 575 USD để mua thêm cám, tăng lượng hàng bán ra, sau khi hết dịch chị sẽ gây dựng một đàn lợn mới.

loans.use: buy bran

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy curtains, fabrics, and bedcovers for resale

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos is a self-sacrificing, loving father, 64 years old with eight children, six of whom are independent. In spite of his age, he continues to fight to get his beloved family ahead and improve their economic situation. Ever since he was very little, Santos has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to selling herd animals, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of all herd animals – cattle, sheep, and alpaca – he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Santos harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By selling these, he can create more income and pay for the higher education and trade of each of his two younger children. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his darling wife María, who always supports him unconditionally in his daily work. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well being and security to the members of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Santos tiene 64 años de edad y es un padre abnegado y muy cariñoso, tiene ocho hijos y seis de ellos ya independientes, pese a la edad que tiene aún sigue esforzándose y luchando para salir adelante y mejorar su situación económica y la de su querida familia.Santos desde muy pequeño siempre ha estado en contacto directo con la labor y crianza de animales y gracias a este conocimiento se dedica a la comercialización de ganado, oficio que aprendió de sus humildes padres y con la experiencia que ha adquirido durante todo este tiempo en la compra y venta de ganado (vaca, oveja y alpaca) ha podido brindarle estabilidad a su familia. El deseo que tiene Santos albergado en su corazón es el de incrementar su capital de inversión para adquirir más animales y con la comercialización de estos generar mayores ingresos económicos con el fin de brindarles una educación superior adecuada y acorde a la vocación de cada uno de a sus dos menores hijos y sobre todo ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su querida esposa María, quién siempre la apoyó incondicionalmente en su labor diaria.Solidaricémonos con la solicitud de este diligente padre para que siga brindándole bienestar y seguridad a los miembros de su familia.

loans.use: Acquisition of more animals for sales

loans.name: Cesar Daniel

texts.es:
I have a used clothing business and I would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise in order to boost sales. I make a living from and feed my family with this business, so I have to look for ways to increase my sales. I am requesting a loan of $800.00 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio de venta de ropa usada y en esta temporada de invierno me gustaría invertir en la compra de más mercancía para que mis ventas aumenten ya que este negocio es de donde yo alimento a mi familia, por lo tanto tengo que buscar la manera de vender más” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio”.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Thei

texts.en: Mrs Thei N., 22, is married with one little kid and lives with her husband in SiemReap province, where is the vital tourist site in Cambodia. She works selling souvenir products in front of Angkor Temple to a number of tourists passing through. By the time, her husband work driving a trailer attached with a motorcycle to transport passengers making around $5 per day. Mrs. Thei N. hopes to use this loan to change her husband old trailer which is frequently fixed and waste her family a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase  a  new trailer for her husband to operate a business.

loans.name: Paula Demencia

texts.es:
For the last thirteen years, Mrs. Paula M. has dedicated herself to selling all sorts of products in the city of Chinandega in Nicaragua. She devotes herself to this business so she can keep her son in school, and in so doing, help support her husband in the upkeep of the household, which is of course of limited resources.

Before dedicating herself to this business, she busied herself as a housekeeper, but due to the low income in their economy, she and her husband decided to invest in products for a general store and sell them. She has worked with Ceprodel, which has granted her great opportunities to improve her business. Through these credits, she has acquired a larger sales volume, which has benefited her store, but above all, the support of her son. Her greatest need is currently the acquisition of more products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Paula M. se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos desde hace 13 años en la ciudad de Chinandega de Nicaragua. Se dedica a este negocio para poder mantener a su hijo en sus estudios y de esta forma apoya a su esposo para mantener su hogar que por cierto es de muy bajos recursos.

Antes de dedicarse a este negocio se ocupaba en la labor de ama de casa pero al percibir bajos ingresos en su economía decide invertir junto con su esposo para comprar los productos de pulpería y venderlos. Ha trabajado con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado grandes oportunidades para mejorar su negocio. Por medio de estos créditos ha adquirido mayores volúmenes de venta que le han beneficiado en su negocio pero sobre todo en el apoyo de su hijo. Su mayor necesidad actualmente es la adquisición de los productos para comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nayamt Allah

texts.en: Nayamt Allah lives with his own family in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single, and he has a retail shop. He has been involved in this business for more than 2 years. He has a good number of customers but he wants to expand his business. He wants to take out an individual loan to complete his stock and make a better income to support his family and build up a good business for himself for the future.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Mr Alcides Ramón P. is married to Irene Cabrera de P.. The couple has two daughters, Viviana who is 16 years old and Lady who is 7. Both girls hope to become doctors, and Alcides know only too well how much money this will take. Therefore he is trying his very best to save in order to be able to pay their university fees in the future.

Alcides began his work as a travelling salesman, selling clothing and haberdashery items. Then, in time, he was able to rent a premises in the municipal market, and slowly but surely he began to sell electronic goods. Alcides is an example of a good man, something which others can aspire to be. He did not receive any official business training, yet today he owns a shop which sells plenty of different items and is growing day by day.

Alcides has requested a loan as he wants to buy IT supplies such as pen drives, cds, keyboards, mouse etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Alcides Ramón P. está casado con Irene Cabrera de P., la pareja tienen 2 hijas, Viviana de 16 años y Lady de 7 años de edad sus dos hijas sueñan con ser doctoras en medicina, Alcides sabe que esta carrera es muy costosa y esta haciendo sus mayores esfuerzo ahorrando para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios.

Alcides empezó a trabajar como vendedor ambulante, vendía prendas de vestir y artículos de mercería; luego de un tiempo el pudo alquilar un local comercial en el mercado municipal y poco a poco empezó a vender artículos electrónicos. Alcides es un ejemplo de hombre, ejemplo de que las personas pueden progresar si se proponen, ya que el solo curso hasta la primaria, no recibió capacitación en negocios pero aun así hoy día posee un comercio que vende bastante bien y día a día crece más.

Alcides solicita el crédito pues con el quiere comprar insumos de informática como pen drive, cd´s, teclados, mause, entre otras cosas.

loans.use: To purchase sound equipment, televisions and electronic goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with 2 children, aged 12 and 8 years old. Grace is a tailor and she started her business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business

loans.name: Judy

texts.es:
Judy works untiringly with one objective: to provide for her beloved little child for whom she is the sole provider in the world. She travels monthly to the city of Lima to acquire unique goods to sell upon her return in the Sunday fairs in her city. She wishes to improve her market stall and for this reason she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Judy, trabaja incansablemente con un solo objetivo otorgarle bienestar a su querida pequeña para quién es ella la única ayuda en este mundo. Mensualmente viaja a la ciudad de Lima para adquirir novedosos artículos para ofertarlos a su regreso en las ferias dominicales de su ciudad. Desea mejorar su stand de ventas y por esta razón solicita un préstamo

loans.use: Capital to buy a greater number of unique items from the city for resale in regional fairs

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana E. G. is from the city of Bluefields, she is 64 years old, and is a single mother with 9 grown children. Mrs. E. has made ‘Nacatamales’ (large tamales very popular in Central America) for over 40 years, having as clients the residents of her neighborhood and passers-by who buy from her because she offers a native product from our country. It should be mentioned that selling Nacatamales is her only income. Right now Mrs. E. needs to buy 50 pounds of pork at US$2.00 per pound; this is one of the ingredients of this typical dish from our country. Since she does not have sufficient capital to buy this ingredient in large quantities, with this loan she will be able to increase her earnings and satisfy her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Juana E. G. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 64 años de edad, es madre soltera de 9 hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. E. hace Nacatamales por mas de 40 años, teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio y transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer un producto típico de nuestro país, cabe mencionar que el único ingreso que recibe es el de su negocio de venta de Nacatamal. En estos momentos la Sra. E. necesita comprar: 50 libras de carne de cerdo a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, que es uno de los ingredientes principales de este platillo típico de nuestro país, ya que ella no cuenta con el suficiente capital para comprar este ingrediente en grandes cantidades, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase pork

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing E. is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She learned this business from her friend for 5 months and she started her own business in 2002. She sells the second-hand clothes in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of US$ 525 to buy more second-hand clothes for re-sale. She says thank you to all.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren.

Teodosia is a widow; she is 55 years old and has 7 children. She travels to the Ccejelambras fair on Saturdays, where she buys cereals that she sells in the city of Ayacucho to business owners and markets. The rest of the days, Teodosia sells "emoliente" (hot beverage made from herbs and flax seed), and traditional "chicha" (fermented beverage). She is a traveling salesperson and carries her containers of drinks.

Teodosia needs a loan of $475 USD which she will use to purchase blue corn, barley, and various cereials. He hopes to improve her business and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Teodosia es viuda, tiene 55 años y 7 hijos, Teodosia viaja a la feria de Ccejelambras los días sábados en donde compra cereales que luego lo vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho a los comerciantes de los mercados. Además Teodosia los demás días vende emoliente (bebida caliente elaborada con hierbas y semillas de lino) y chicha típica, actividad que realiza caminando cargando sus baldes de chicha.

Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz morado, cebada y cereales variados. Los sueños de Teodosia son mejorar su negocio, su casa y brindar buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Teodosia needs a loan of $475 USD which she will use to purchase blue corn, barley, and various cereials.

loans.name: Virgen Maria Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Virgen Maria, esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. Chaccarillos en el distrito D. Yauli en Huancavelica. Esta comunidad es una zona ganadera, L. comunidad es muy bonita porque tiene arboleda D. Eucaliptos.

Antonia S., antes vendía medias tejidas, ahora con os prestamos que recibe a comprado cerditos y gallinas para vender. Con los prestamos quiere comprar mas animales para tener una granja. Su meta es comprarse una vaca para así incrementar su negocio y ayudar en el estudio D. sus hijos.

Aquilina H., esta muy triste porque uno D. sus hijos falleció, su negocio es L. venta D. quesos y cuyes que lleva a Lima, con su prestamos incrementará su negocio y con sus ahorros comprará un televisor para sus hijos.

Raymunda M., es transportista, apoya a su esposo en este negocio y aprovecha en vender queso, leche, gallinas y huevos. Raymunda antes andaba hospitalizada pues tiene cáncer a las mamas, elL. se ha operado y ahora se siente mejor, tiene mucha ganas D. continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
EThe community bank Virgen Maria is located in the community of Chaccarillos, in the District of Yauli, in Huancavelica. This community is in an area with lots of livestock farming. The community is very pretty because it is forested with Eucalyptus trees. Antonia S. used to sell knitted socks. Now with the loan that she will receive she will buy pigs and chickens to sell. With the money we lend her, she wants to buy more animals in order to have a farm. Her goal is to buy a cow and so improve her business and help with the studies of her children. Aquilina H. is very sad because one of her children passed away. Her business is the sale of cheese and guinea pigs that she takes to Lima. With your loan she will increase her business and with the savings buy a television for her children. Raymunda M. is a commercial carrier. She helps her husband in this business and helps to sell cheese, milk, chickens, and eggs. Raymunda was hospitalised for breast cancer. She has been operated on and now she feels better, she has the drive to continue working in order to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For 13 businesses to invest

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina L. B. pertenece al banco comunal San L., tiene 48 años y vive en la calle Los Ángeles  54 del caserío de  Motil distrito de Agallpampa provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria y no siguió estudiando porque en Motil no había más grados de instrucción en la escuela.
 Se casó con el señor Víctor Pesantes con quien tienen 4 hijos, dependen de ella 2 hijos.
Florentina vende ropa interior en Motil y en Trujillo. Compra su mercadería en el Mayorista de Trujillo y vuelve a vender en Motil. Manifiesta también que en algunos caseríos realizan el trueque, consistente en cambiar animales por ropa. Su negocio lo realiza en forma ambulatoria. 
Con su primer préstamo que fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, incrementó su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles que serán cancelados en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en su negocio comprando enaguas porque se vende mucho en la zona de la sierra.
Florentina sueña con poner un centro comercial.
texts.en:
Ms. Florentina L. B. is a member of the San L. microfinance institute. She is 48 years old and lives on Los Ángeles 54 Street in the hamlet of Motil, in the Agallpampa province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad Perú. She studied up to the third grade in elementary school but did not continue with her education because they did not have higher grades in the schools of Motil. She married Víctor Pesantes, with whom she has 4 children, two of whom are her dependants. Florentina sells undergarments in Motil and Trujillo. She purchases her merchandise at the wholesale market in Trujillo and then sells it in Motil. She states that she also barters in certain hamlets by exchanging animals for clothing. She works as a street vendor. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, she expanded her business. With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she plans on investing in her business by purchasing underskirts because they are in high demand in the sierra zone. Florentina dreams of opening up a shopping center.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale women’s undergarments

loans.name: Cruz Adilia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 56 años de edad, habita en un bario de la capital de Managua que se llama la primavera, es madre soltera, con un hijo de 24 años de edad, que tiene dificultades ya que es enfermo de síndrome de daunw, lo cual para ella es difícil, ya que necesita muchos cuidado, doña Rosa logro instalar un salón de belleza desde hace diez años, lo cual inicio con dinero que un banco presto, las dificultades que tiene abecés es cuando se va la energía eléctrica, casi todo el día, lo cual ella no puede laborar y es un día perdido. Ahora estoy en Afodenic esta es mi segunda solicitud lo cual es de gran beneficios ya que he podido mantener mi negocio y por que tiene taza de interés bajas con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar cosméticos, y tratamientos para el cabello ya que estamos en una temporada donde las jóvenes comienzan a cambiar de look, y deseo aprovechar a los clientes, espera obtener muchas ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. A largo plazo es remodelar el local y ampliarlo, y hacerlo en una estética, a si como abrir una cuenta de ahorro para asegurarle el patrimonio a mi hijo para que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is 56 years old, and lives in a suburb of the capital, Managua, known as spring. She is a single mother, with a 24 year old son, who has difficulties because he has down syndrome. This is difficult for her, as he needs a lot of care. Señora Rosa managed to install a beauty salon 10 years ago, which she did with a bank loan. The difficulties she sometimes has are when there is no electricity for nearly a whole day, because she can't work and loses a day. Now she is in Afodenic and this is her second request for a loan. From these loans she has received great benefits and has been able to maintain her business, because it has a low interest rate. The loan is to buy cosmetics, and hair treatments. They are now in a time when young people begin to change their look, and she want to make the most of her clients. She hopes to obtain many earnings to continue inveseting in her business. Her long-term objective is to remodel the premises and expand it, making it a cosmetic surgery, so she can open a savings account to ensure that there are assets for her son, so that he doesn't want for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tints and cosmetics for hair treatments

loans.name: Valérie

texts.fr:
Née à Aného en 1970, Madame N. Valérie est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Le commerce de denrées de premières nécessités est son activité quotidienne. Elle a ouvert une petite boutique d’alimentation générale qu’elle gère avec soins. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle subvient aux besoins de son foyer.
Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un financement pour approvisionner sa boutique en produits nécessaires afin d’être à la hauteur de la demande de ses clients et de la concurrence. Le revenu de son activité lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille sur le plan sanitaire, scolaire et alimentaire.
texts.en:
Born in Aného in 1970, Ms. Valérie N. is married and the mother of a child. The work she does each day involves commerce in staple items. She opened a small grocery store and manages it with care. Thanks to this business, she is providing for the needs of her household. Today, she is requesting financing to get a supply of beauty products necessary to rise to the demands of her customers and the challenges of her competition. The income from her work enables her to meet numerous family needs with regard to sanitation, schooling, and food.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get merchandise for her store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Halima S. is 33 years old and she is from Mwanza. She is married with three children, who are between the ages of 6 and 13 years old.

Halima has been running a clothing business since 2007. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Halima currently earns about $250 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to buy more clothes to sell. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Halima thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna H. is thirty years old. She is married and has six children: two sons and four daughters. Five of her children are currently in school, both junior high and primary school. Her youngest child is still too young to attend school. Muna’s husband is a farmer who cultivates cassava and palm nuts. The family lives in a house in a small town called Koforidua, located near Offinso in the Ashanti Region. It is a farming as well as a commercial community.
Industrious as she is, Muna is engaged in a banana sales business to help her husband financially support the family. She buys bags of banana from farmers in the surrounding villages and then sells them to retailers in the local market. Muna has been in the business for over ten years. Currently, she needs a loan to buy more banana in large quantities to be able to increase her sales and profit. She hopes to thereby improve her family's living conditions and help pay for her children's further education.

loans.use: Purchase of banana for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà  58 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng là thương binh và 1 con đã trưởng thành tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương . Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại  công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ buôn  bán hoa quả. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương của chồng nên  kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định với mức thu nhập 2.500.000.đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ  để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hoa quả của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 58 years old. She is living with her husband (a war-disabled vet) and one grown-up children in Ninh Giang district, Hai Duong province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, fruits reselling is the business that brings the main source of income for her family. In addition, her family receives the pension of the husband, therefore the economic situation of her family is very stable with an average income of VND2,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND6,000,000 to buy more fruits to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Djaharatou

texts.fr: Madame S. exerce comme activité le commerce de bijoux, ce commerce est très rentable et est pratiqué par beaucoup de femmes à Lomé, elle a commencé à faire ce commerce en 2007, et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et aussi à Cotonou parce que dans ce pays certains bijoux sont chers. Voulant agrandir son commerce elle sollicite au près de WAGES un premier prêt en vue de s’acheter des bijoux. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, son mari est un revendeur et avec ce qu’elle gagne dans son activité elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
S. sells jewelry, a very profitable business which many women are involved in in Lomé. She started in this business in 2007 and gets her stock from the main market of Lomé as well as from Cotonou because in this country some jewelry items are expensive. Wanting to grow her business, she is asking WAGES for this, her first loan, in order to buy jewelry. She is married and the mother of three children; her husband is a merchant and with the money she makes from her business she helps her husband pay the household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different types of jewelry

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok R. is a 26 year old vegetable grower. She can plant twice a year and normally sells her produces to buyers every two months. To help the family's food needs a little more, her husband drives a motor taxi. The young couple has only one young child who is not enrolled in school.

Sok R.'s husband is facing a problem that his motor breaks. They have decided to apply for a loan to repair their old motorbike.

loans.use: To repair her husband's old motorbike.

loans.name: Narcisa Silvia

texts.es: La Señora Narcisa Silvia Rodríguez tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Narcisa tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad económica es costurera. Hace más de 20 años. Dio inicio con pocas telas  por lo que elaboro sabanas, y mas tarde las comercializaba en el mercado, por lo que la ubicación de su negocio es su casa de habitación. Doña Narcisa es una mujer muy luchadora por que ha tenido que salir adelante es por eso que sus propósitos son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y escojan las diferentes opciones. Y es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas para apoyarla en capital de trabajo y además comprar materia prima como tela, agujas, tijeras, hilos y ziper. Y el sueño de Narcisa es establecer un taller de costura para apoyar a otras personas que necesitan trabajo.
texts.en:
Narcisa Silvia Rodríguez is 44 years old and is single. Doña Narcisa has 2 children and they both study. She has worked as a seamstress for more than 20 years. She started her business with a small amount of material and made sheets. Later on she sold them in the market and her business is located in her home. Doña Narcisa is a hard-working woman who has had to struggle to get ahead. One of her objectives is to improve the quality of her products and offer variety to her customers so they can choose from different options. This is why she turned to Fundación León 2000 and other related organizations to receive support for working capital and to buy supplies such as material, needles, scissors, thread and zippers. Narcisa´s dream is to set up a dressmaking workshop in order to support other persons who need work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.ru:
Угул Абдувахобова замужем,имеет 5 детей. Ей 47 лет. Место ее деятельности вещевой рынок, где она торгует школьной одеждой. В этой сфере деятельности ей помогает ее  старший сын.
 Для товарооборота ей нужны денежные средства, поэтому она запрашивает 1000 сомони, сроком на три месяца. В будущем она планирует разнообразить ассортимент своего товара и открыть еще одну точку торговли для своего сына.
 Дополнительным источником доходов в ее семью, является работа ее мужа Абдурахмона. Он водитель такси.
texts.en:
Ugul A. is married and has five children. She is 47 years old. She works at the clothing market, where she sells school uniforms, and her eldest son assists her with the work. She needs funds for inventory, so she is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni. In the future she plans to expand the variety of goods she carries and open an additional trade outlet for her son. Her husband Abdurahmona's work is an additional source of family income. He is a taxi driver.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Alimad

texts.ru: Алимад Ашуров более 10 лет занимается земледелием. До этого он 8 лет работал по своей специальности шофером. Проживает Алимад в районе Хамадони. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. Другой сын помогает отцу. Алимад получает хороший урожай овощей и удовлетворяет потребности своей семьи, а также  половину своего урожая продает на Базаре.
texts.en:
Alimad A. has been farming for over 10 years. Earlier he worked as a professional driver. He lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 50 years old, married, and has four children. His eldest son is working in Russia. Another son helps Alimad. Alimad receives good yields of vegetables; enough for his family and for half of the harvest to be sold at the market.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and irrigated land

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is a married mother of four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is forty-eight years old. Comfort lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Comfort’s husband is a farmer. She deals in agrochemicals. She sells agricultural chemicals such as weed-killer, pesticides, fertilizers, etc. She sells in a shop by the road side. Comfort supplies to farmers in her community and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy agrochemicals in bulk. Comfort desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals

loans.name: Khamiat

texts.en: N. Khamiat has been in the retail business for over ten years. She has a retail shop in Nateete. She is using the loan to purchase retail shop items such as soap, sugar, salt, tea leaves, sweets, breads, etc. to sell in her shop, hence adding stock and expanding her business. She is encouraged by her husband, who is also a hardworking businessman. They are blessed with five children who are going to school. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as soap, sugar, salt, tea leaves, sweets, breads, etc. to sell in her shop

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela D. 54 años, es vecina muy querida en su barrio, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es tener una vejez digna. La venta D. papa es su actividad diaria, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Cerro Colorado (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido debido a la buena ubicación que tiene, ella es una vendedora muy carismática y siempre convence a sus clientes D. llevarse algo a casa. Lo que más le gusta D. su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta y hacer D. esta manera más amenas las largas horas D. trabajo, lleva 28 años en esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo. Para un futuro cercano anhela tener una tienda más granD. donD. pueda vender papas y otros productos. Este es el sexto préstamo D. Marcela con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más papa para incrementar la cantidad que tiene actualmente en venta.
texts.en:
Marcela, 54, is a beloved neighbor in her neighborhood. She lives in her own house. What she wants most is to have a decent old age. She sells potatoes every day. Her stand is located in the Cerro Colorado market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). It is very busy because of its good location. She is a charismatic sales person. She always convinces her customers to take something home. What she likes best about her business is talking with her neighboring sales people. That makes the long working hours more amenable. She has been doing this for 28 years. The most difficult part is having to stay in her stand all day. Even so, she knows that this is her work, and she has to do it. In the near future her goal is to have a larger store where she could sell potatoes and other products. This is Marcela’s sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She wants to have access to other loans in the future. She is a well liked member of her community bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy more potatoes in order to increase the current amount she now has for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Rafaela M. C. , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en el barrio Los ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , él cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , actualmente estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 16 años trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su papá , los planes hacia un futuro con su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder tener mejores resultados. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo otorgado ya que atrvez de ello logra mejores beneficios para su siembra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rafaela M. C. is 30 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Ríos, located in the town of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband, who helps her with the house expenses. They have two children, who are students. She plans to improve the life conditions of her family.

She works as a farmer for 16 years and the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funding. She started this activity with the support of her dad and she plans to diversify her crops in the future.

With this loan she will buy fertilizers and materials to obtain better results. She thanks the institution for the loan she received since through it she will attain greater benefits to her planting.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to apply to plantation

loans.name: Shaiyr's Group

texts.en:
Shaiyr is the leader of this loan group. She has three children. Her eldest daughter is married and lives separately. Her eldest son works in a canning plant in Russia and her youngest son, 14, is a school student. Many years ago, Shaiyr’s sister urged her and her husband to open their own snack bar on a major road to sell shish kebabs.  Shaiyr took her sister’s suggestion and very soon a new snack bar appeared on the road. 

Shaiyr and her husband are happy as they have begun to earn a decent income, have successfully married off their daughter, and have bought a house! Shaiyr and her husband would like to request a loan to purchase meat in order make more shish kebab. Once the entire kebab gets sold, their next plan is to do some renovation at home. In the future, Shaiyr would like to expand her business and give her two sons the best affordable education.

Shaiyr’s other loan partners include Madanbek, Kalyiman and Maral. 

Madanbek, 37, is a father of three. He earns his and his family’s living by working as a taxi driver. Madanbek needs a loan to repair his car before it completely breaks down. His earnings depend on his car. 

Kalyiman, 48, is a mother of two. Her husband is retired but he works as a taxi driver. She works as a nurse at maternity hospital. She needs a loan to send her daughter to study in China.

Maral, 30, is a housewife with two daughters attending school. Her husband is a farmer. Maral sells milk, yoghurt and sour cream. They plan to increase their livestock population. The are requesting a loan to purchase a calf.
======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy meat for shish kebab

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y su hijo de 4 años en la casa de sus padres. Ya son 7 años los que se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su propia camioneta, la cual es su herramienta de trabajo. Percy cubre la ruta dentro de su ciudad en la zona urbana, todos los días. Para este trabajo tiene la ayuda de su cobrador, que es quien controla el ingreso económico de los pasajes de sus clientes. Debido a sus años de experiencia ha visto la rentabilidad de su negocio a pesar de las dificultades que se pueden presentar, como cuando su movilidad necesita de reparación que requiera dejar de trabajar obligatoriamente un día. Percy desea tener una camioneta moderna para mejorar el servicio que brinda. 
Esta es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es uno integrante muy responsable y activo de su banco comunal, reafirmando su compromiso en este nuevo crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando será para utilizado en la compra de repuestos para su camioneta y el mantenimiento mecánico de la misma.
texts.en:
Percy is 31 years old. He lives with his partner and their 4 year old son in his parents’ house. He already has 7 years of experience providing transportation services to passengers in his own van. Percy’s route runs through the urban areas of the city, which he travels every day. For his work, he has the assistance of a dispatcher who controls the number of passengers he can take at one time. Due to his years of experience, Percy has been able to maintain a profitable business even when he encounters difficulties or experiences work stoppages in order have his vehicle repaired. Percy would like to have a later model van so that he can improve his service.

This will be Percy’s second loan with MFP. He is a very responsible and active member of his Communal Bank and reaffirms his commitment with this new loan. The money he requested will be used to purchase spare parts for his van and pay for maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs & maintenance to his van

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida A. is from the village of Pangabuan, Tangub City. She is 49 years old. Zenaida is married and has 4 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Zenaida joined Kiva's partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools needed for the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Zenaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment & tools needed for the business

loans.name: Life Group

texts.en:
The Life Group is a group of two borrowers led by Abu K. K., who is 32 years old. Abu is married with two children, ages 2 and 6, who are in the educational level of kindergarten and first grade. He is a high school graduate but could not attend university due to lack of financial support. Abu and his family live in the Sheriff Quarter, a large Muslim community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Abu's business is a general provisions shop. He buys general provisions wholesale and sells to the residents of Sheriff Quarter. He has been running this business for one year and is hoping to improve to a bigger store with branches around town in the future. Abu had been facing some financial problems over the last months with his business but fought hard to maintain it because it is his only means of income. He talks to his customers in a good manner in order encourage them to continue buying from him.

Abu needs this loan in order to purchase more provisional goods like vegetable oil, bath soap, cigarettes, margarine, etc., to improve business. Abu dreams of giving his children a better education and of building a big house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more provisional goods like vegetable oil, bath soap, cigarettes, margarine, etc., to improve business

loans.name: Lawrence Paul

texts.en:
Lawrence Paul N. is a married, 32 year-old man with three children. He does not own a shop; instead he is a mobile sales person and sells his secondhand clothing in several locations. He has been in business for seven years. He gets a profit of about 80000 KES per month.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend. He has never borrowed from another MFI and hopes to have a bigger shop to sell clothes in bulk. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to buy more clothes and establish a permanent place in Kikuyu town.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more jackets and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is from the village of Purok Piape, Sinonoc Sinacaban Mis. Occ. She is 58 years old. Emma is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products like fish and shrimp in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ines

texts.en: Ines is involved in a buy & sell kind of business. She is 38 years old, married and has four kids. Her oldest is only 18. A majority of what she sells is dried fish. She also acquires bananas and other vegetables and sells them in their community. Ines shares that she needs additional capital for her business. She joined CEVI to gain access to its financial program. She requested a loan of PHP10,000. With this loan, Ines will be able to buy fish and other vegetables. Ines is hopeful that this loan will help her achieve her dream to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy dried fish and vegetables

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La señora Marta es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador de Conchaca” desde hace 01 año atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de sogas.
Marta nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar materiales para la fabricación de sogas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,600.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar hilos, lana, nylon.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta has been a member of the “Child of San Salvador of Conchaca” Community Bank for the past year. She is from the Llave District, in the El Collao Province, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, is married and has two children. She has finished her secondary studies. She buys and sells rope. Marta told us that with the first loan that she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 500 new soles, she was able to buy materials to make rope. She is asking for a loan of 1,600.00 new soles that she will use to buy thread, wool and nylon. Her dreams for the future are to have a store in Llave and to have children that have professional careers. What she likes the most about the community bank are their savings and the meetings with their members.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy thread, wool and nylon.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi K. is a 37-year-old single mother. She is a mother to Kelvin, a 12-years-old boy. She was introduced to Kadet by a friend. Naomi is in the business of selling shoes in Mombasa Town near Digo Road.

Her  business is situated at a  strategic place where she has many customers from every corner of Mombasa town. She has been in the business for last 10 years. This is her first loan with Kadet and she has never borrowed from any MFI before. Naomi plans to use the loan  to increase her stock of shoes.

Naomi hopes to import shoes from Dubai and China hence being able to meet all her clients needs and being ahead of her competitors.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en: Sar R., age 29, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is an employee selling zoo tickets at Tamao Mountain. On average, she is able to make about 2 USD each day. Her husband is a motorbike mechanic and also a construction worker in homebuilding. He typically makes 4 USD each day. Sar R. would like a loan of 700 USD to make a new investment. She will use this money to raise cows.

loans.use: To raise cows

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine C. ets une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a une expérience de 4 prêts qu'elle bien gérés. Elle Fait un petit commerce de parfums, de couscous et d'arachides. Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa famille et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Yacine C., 47, is married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years and has gathered experience with the four loans she has received and has managed well. She has a little business selling perfume, couscous, and peanuts. Her goals are to support her family and add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael R. M., tiene la edad de 61 años, está casado, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El tiene 22 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de dos vacas, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Rafael tiene muchos años de trabajar con ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rafael R. M., is 61 years old, he is married and has a son who is his top priority. His son is 22 years old. With this loan he wants to buy two cows, the idea is to have cattle for the dual purpose of milk and meat. He hopes to adequately care for them in order to earn the highest possible income when he sells them. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that they offer. Don Rafael has worked with cattle for many years. He hopes that he will be able to provide for his family a better quality of life and a more stable economic situation and to be able to continue growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en:
Foluke is a hardworking and honest woman. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is married with a child and she is 47 years old.

Foluke sells fruit like bananas at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to grow her business as, currently, her business income is not enough to meet all her family needs. She wants to take a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more fruit to increase her business income.

Foluke has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Tete Michel

texts.en: Tete Michel K. makes and sells a local Togolese beverage called sodabi in Lomé, Togo. Sodabi is a very strong moonshine that is very popular among locals. Mr. K. has been selling this product since 2007 and is now asking for his second loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to resupply his stock of sodabi and keep his customers satisfied. Mr. K. is single and does not have children.

loans.use: Increase sodabi supplies

loans.name: Norma Justina

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Norma Justina A. Montalván tiene 72 años de edad, es viuda, con 7 hijos todos mayores de edad, 5 de ellos viven en sus propias casas y dos aun conviven con ella al igual que 3 nietos. Doña Norma tiene una pulpería desde hace más de 20 años y con la cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Por el tiempo que tiene de administrar su pulpería es bien conocida en el sector por lo que su negocio es bastante visitado. Doña Norma ya ha sido beneficiada en dos ocasiones por préstamos de kiva y ha cancelado los dos anteriores en tiempo y forma. Además aprovecha para agradecer a todos los prestamistas que han confiado en ella y le facilitaron los préstamos anteriores.

Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar:

3 Quintales de Arroz americano a US 45 cada quintal, 80 libras de pollo a US 1.40 cada libra, 60 libras de  carne de res a US 1.50 cada libra, 3 quintales de frijoles a  US 45 cada quintal,  2 bidones de aceite a US  30 cada bidón,  2 quintales de azúcar a US 35 cada quintal, 25 sacos de  carbón a US 3 cada saco y 3 quintales de  harina a US 41 cada quintal.
texts.en:
Norma Justina A. Montalván is a 72-year-old widow with 7 adult children, five of whom live independently and two who still live with her; three grandchildren live with her also. Norma has had a grocery store for over 20 years that has made it possible for her to raise her children. After all this time running her store, she is well-known in the neighborhood and her store is quite popular. Norma has had two previous Kiva loans and repaid both on time. She thanks all the lenders who have trusted her and provided the past loans. She is asking for funding to buy the following: 3 quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of American rice at US45 each, 80 pounds of chicken at US1.40 each, 60 pounds of beef at US1.50 each, 3 quintales of beans at US45 each, 2 large jugs of cooking oil at US30 each, 2 quintales of sugar at US35 each, 25 sacks of charcoal at US3 each and 3 quintales of flour at US41 each.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy American rice, chicken, beef, beans, sugar, charcoal and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Car Repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new machine

loans.name: Ana Narcisa

texts.es:
Ana de 42 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran  (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución), su esposo es obrero con el tiene tres hijos. Ana es distribuidora de agua en el sector por donde vive debido a que no hay alcantarillado y las personas necesitan de agua limpia y pura para tomar. 

Ella entrega a domicilio los botellones de agua, cada botellón lo vende a $ 1.00. Trabaja todos los días en un triciclo reparte los botellones de agua a las casas del sector. Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas para ya vender los botellones desde su casa. 

En el futuro quiere tener una tienda con todo tipo de víveres.
texts.en:
Ana, 42, lives in Primavera de Duran (an area on the outskirts of the city that originally had an irregular landscape, with several hills, streams, and lakes that still appear as remains of a dissolving ecology). Her husband is a worker, and they have three kids together. Ana distributes water in the area where she lives because there is not a water system set up, and people need clean and pure water to drink. She delivers large bottles of water to people's homes. Each large bottle costs $1. She works every day on a rickshaw to deliver the bottles to the homes in her area. With this loan, she wants to buy display cases to sell the bottles from her home. In the future, she would like to have a store with all kinds of supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Display cases, large bottles of water

loans.name: Mercedes Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes vive en la Sequita, parroquia de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro, desde hace 19 ciclos forma parte del banco comunal la sequita.

En los actuales momentos nuestra socia se dedica al negocio familiar junto al esposo, el negocio consiste en la venta de legumbres en el canton Montecristi, mientras la señora Mercedes se dedica a su hogar y a sus hijos, el esposo sale los días jueves, viernes, sábado y domingo a las ventas con dos de sus hijos hasta el medio día porque ellos estudian, las compras de las legumbres la realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo donde  están los grandes mayoristas.

La señora Mercedes tiene de casada 19 años y  4 hijos, con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia podrá invertir  en el negocio de las legumbres, tiene sus clientes fijos sale desde la madruga y regresa a casa en las tardes.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in La Sequita, a parish in Montecristi, a canton known for being the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro [José Eloy Alfaro (1842-1912) was an Ecuadorian revolutionary leader and president. He is the great hero of Ecuadorian radicals]. She has been a member of the La Sequita communal bank for 19 cycles. She is currently involved with the family business with her husband; it consists in vegetable sales in Montecristi. While Mercedes takes care of the children and the home, her husband goes out on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays to sell until noon because two of their children, who still have to go to school, help him. The vegetables are purchased in the city of Portoviejo which is where the large wholesalers are. Mercedes has been married for 19 years and has 4 children. She will use this new loan to buy vegetables for her business. She has regular customers and she goes out at dawn and returns home in the afternoon.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, carrots, corn, broad beans, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorn S. is 36 years old and lives in Damnak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectares of land which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. 

In order to support her farm, Mrs. Savorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from being a farmer, she is also a congee (rice porridge) seller in her local village which provides a small additional income to support her family.

Mrs. Savorn S. is a widow with four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, two are students, while the last one is a car driver.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for laborer

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet wants a loan to buy cosmetics and hair braids to sell. She is a married woman aged 30 years and the mother of two. She lives in a rented house but dreams of building her own house and educating her children.

Violet operates a salon in Kyenjojo district, Uganda. A lack of capital has been limiting her salon business that she started three years ago and which has grown steadily.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair braids to sell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela N. is from the village of Cebulin. She is 42 years old. Marcela is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcela owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marcela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marcela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marcela is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marcela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina lives in a big city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is famous for its culture, history and food. She lives in the area of Lahore named Yadgar, which has its own historic importance: the 1947 Pakistan resolution passed in Yadgar. Sakina is above 40-years of age and lives with her family in a three-room brick house. She is married to H. F. A., who makes shoe boxes on order. He has contracts with different shoe-making companies. They give him orders and he makes the boxes according to different shoes sizes to make an income. His business is going very well and he is making good profits from it. Sakina makes and sells bread. She operates a tandoor (a wood-burning over made of mud that is used to make breads on commercial level in Pakistan) and works very hard in the burning heat all the day to earn a living for her family. Her business is also going well. She sells her bread for 5 PKRs and earns almost 100-150 PKRs on daily basis. Sakina has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her husband, who has large orders to fulfill these days. With the help of the loan, he will buy raw materials that are used to make of shoe boxes, such as hard paper and gum, in large quantities.

Sakina is very confident that her husband will not let her down and that he will make good use of the loan to gain maximum benefits from his business. Sakina is a regular user of Asasah. In the previous three years, she proved to be a responsible member who always paid her loan installments on time.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making shoe boxes

loans.name: Argentina De Jesús

texts.es: La Sra. Argentina de Jesús G. P. se dedica al negocio de pulpería vendiendo Granos Básico, Gaseosa, Golosina y a la vez al destace de cerdo tiene  dos año de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casada actualmente tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para ayudarse para ampliar y mejorar su negocio los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Argentina de Jesús G. P. has a grocery business where she sells basic grains, sodas, candy, and occasionally butchered pigs. She has been in this business for two years. Argentina is married and has a child who is of school age.

She has had two loans with CEPRODEL which were used to help expand and improve her business. The loans have been a great benefit because they have helped her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, sodas, butchered pigs, and other products

loans.name: Dolores
