texts.es: La señora Dolores es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, y su esposo el señor José Ángel  trabaja en una ferretería, la señora Dolores combina el cuidado de los niños con su trabajo ya que la venta de ropa solo la hace los fines de semana. Ellos necesitan de este préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda. Ya que la casa solo cuenta con dos cuartitos muy pequeños y por mayor comodidad para su familia ellos requieren esta construcción.
texts.en:
Dolores is a hard-working woman. She is in the business of selling used clothing. Her husband, José Ángel, works in a hardware store. Dolores only sells clothing on the weekends and spends the remainder of her time caring for her children. They need this loan to build a room in their house. Since the house only has two very small rooms, they need the extra space so that the family may live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Seiha

texts.en:
Mr. Seiha Y., is 35 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Thoun Kchorng (pictured), is 38 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2004 and have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. 

Seiha has been driving a motor taxi for two years; his wife sells chicken in the local market. His motorbike is old and breaks often, so he spends a lot of money to repair it. Facing this, he decided to ask for his first loan of $600. He will use the loan to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

Mr. Seiha Y. was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for continuing his motor taxi business

loans.name: Samuel Kimosop

texts.en:
Samuel Kimosop I. is 49 years old, married to Nelly Chebet and has four children aged twenty-two years, eighteen years, twelve years and two years. He has been in the public transport business for ten years in Kapsowar, Eldoret, Kenya. His wife is also a business lady who adds to the family’s income. From his transport business Samuel earns a profit of 50,000 KES per month.

Samuel is applying for a second loan from KADET after having successfully paid back his first loan. He plans to use this loan to buy cereals for resale as a secondary business. From the anticipated profits he plans to establish a hardware shop for his wife.

In the future Samuel hopes to own a bus with a capacity of eighty seats, the profits from which will enable him to provide for his family’s basic needs and also see his children become enlightened through education and be successful in life.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Josué De Jesús

texts.es:
El Joven Josué de Jesús C. L. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega desempeñándose como Operador grafico tiene 7 años de trabajar  en la Alcaldía y adquirió crédito a través de un convenio que hay con la Alcaldía  y Ceprodel.
Este es el crédito No. 5 que lleva con la Institución lo cual  todos los anteriores los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para pagar gastos de la Universidad y medicamentos ya que su mama se encuentra un poco enferma, el vive con su esposa y su mamá ya que hijos no tiene hasta los momentos.
texts.en:
Josue de Jesus Cabreras L. works at the Mayor's office in Chinandega as a graphic designer. He has worked at the Mayor's office for the past 7 years and qualified for his loan through a joint program between the Mayor's office and Ceprodel. This is his 5th loan with the institution and all his previous loans were paid on time. 

He plans to use this loan on college expenses and some medications that his ill mother needs. He lives with his wife and his mother and doesn't have children as of yet.

loans.use: University and medical expenses

loans.name: Idilfonso Aquilino

texts.es: Idilfonso Aquilino tiene 54 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio porque él se dedicaba a la venta de ganado y agricultor, ya que su esposa le dio la idea a Idilfonso que establecieran este medio de vida en su hogar para ambos obtuvieran un medio de ingreso por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer un buen servicio el es un hombre muy trabajador. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergente y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Idilfonso Aquilina is 54 years old, and he has a small grocery store.  He has had this business for over ten years.  He used to sell livestock and farm, and then his wife gave Idilfonso the idea of establishing this way of earning a living in their home.  Both of them would have a way of getting income.  He is always known for providing good service, and he is a hard-working man.

The loan is to buy products like sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and basic grains.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edgardo José

texts.es: Edgardo José de 65 años, vive en el municipio de Galapa,área metropolitana de Barranquilla, allí tiene su negocio de vender viveres, ranchos y abarrotes, que inició con la experiencia del año 2008 que le suministró su trabajo en una tienda que administraba, propiedad de su hija y que ella por motivos laborales dejó a él. En la actualidad tiene buenos clientes y Edgardo vende de contado y algunos creditos muy selectos. Este es el segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mraio Santo Domingo, con  su credikiva, comprará viveres, ranchos, refrescos en mayor cantidad antes de que sus precios aumenten, porque en Diciembre es justamente lo que sucede.Con su anterior financiamiento, aumentó su capacidad de compra de contado y encontró mejores precios en este sistema lo que incrementó ligeramente  sus utilidades. El sueño de Edgardo José es ampliar su tienda y adicionarle gradualmente productos de papelería que le ayudan a diversificar su oferta y potencializar nuevos clientes, porque su mayor desafio es tener un capital de trabajo para ello permanentemente, mientras su negocio rrefleja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 6 dias, y de sus mercancia de 27 , en tanto su rentabilidad es de un 23% y su capacidad de pago de un 65%.
texts.en:
65-year old Edgardo José lives in the municipality of Galapa in metropolitan Barranquilla where he runs a business selling supplies, snacks, and groceries. He started the business in 2008. He used to manage his daughter’s shop, which she then left to him for work reasons.

Nowadays Edgardo has a good customer base; he sells on account and offers credit to select customers. This is his second loan with Kiva partner the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the money he plans to buy more supplies, snacks, and drinks before prices go up in December, which is usually what happens. With his previous loan, he bought more stock at better prices so his profits went up slightly. 

Edgardo’s dream is to expand his store and gradually bring in stationery to sell. This will help him diversify into other areas and bring in new customers. His biggest challenge is having enough working capital. His customers pay their bills every six days, and he pays for his merchandise every 27 days. His profit margin is 23%, and he has a credit capacity of 65%.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, snacks, and drinks before prices go up

loans.name: Roger Jaime

texts.es: El Sr. Roger tiene como actividad la venta de comida atendiendo con el servicio de comida y bebida a una institución de la ciudad, esta actividad la desarrolla juntamente con su mamá, esta actividad se constituye en su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia. El Sr.  Roger es una persona joven con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida, siempre mejorando su negocio, , en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de una heladera, un microondas y un kit completo de menaje de cocina para así de esta manera brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Roger sells food and beverages in a company in the city, he does the job with his mother and the work is the main source of income for him and his family. Mr. Roger is a young person and wishes to get ahead in life by always improving his business. At this time he needs the loan to buy a freezer, a microwave oven and a complete kit of cooking tools to give better service to his customers. Mr. Roger is very grateful to the institution for the support given to him.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and microwave oven.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, reside junto a su familia en el sector Pilar Nores del distrito de Paiján, una zona comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Ascope y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de abarrotes en un quiosco ubicado dentro de uno de los mercados más importantes del distrito, ella cuenta con varios años de experiencia en este rubro y siempre se ha esforzado por brindar a sus clientes productos de calidad y un buen servicio. Rosa utiliza los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad para solventar la economía de su familia y sacarlos adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y bastante responsable. 

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayude a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old.  She is the single mother of two children and lives with her family in the Pilar Nores sector of the Paiján district, a commercial zone within the Ascope province and the La Libertad region, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayaeque.

She sells groceries from a kiosk in the one of the most important markets in the district.  She has many years experience in this field and always makes an effort to provide quality products and good service to her customers.  Rosa uses the income from this activity to cover her household expenses and move them ahead.  Those who know her consider her to be a very easy going and responsible person.

Rosa wants to expand her business by acquiring more products to satisfy her customer demands, so she has seen fit to request this loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa, so that she can reach her objective.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Konichbek

texts.en:
Konichbek S. is a talented artist with some disabilities. He was born into a large family with seven children and from childhood was compelled to be healed because of poor health. Unfortunately, his sense of hearing seriously suffered and now he needs to use a hearing device. From early childhood, Konichbek had a propensity to fine arts and gave his first performance in 4th grade. After graduating from college, he became an artist and worked as a layout man.

In 1980, Konichbek got married and soon became a father of one son and one daughter. His marriage was very happy, but in 1997 tragedy shattered his life - his beloved wife died and he became a single parent, taking care of his children by himself. Despite his difficulties, Konichbek made every effort to provide his children with all they needed. In order to cover all of his family's expenses, he started to take on different orders, for decorations and interiors. Konichbek also takes part in regional exhibitions and trade fairs, where his work has become very popular and in great demand.

In order to broaden his activities, Konichbek took his first loan from Bai Tushum in order to purchase canvases, pigments and baguettes, which were used as intended and the loan was repaid. Now, Konichbek has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy artistic materials (colours, canvases, etc), revenues of which will allow him to renovate his studio. In the future, Konichbek dreams of showing his paintings in international exhibitions under his motto: “Cooperation leads to the peace of the world”.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beauty supplies

loans.name: Walisuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALISUMA” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, el día de la reunión estaba presente una señora que acompañaba a otra socia, por eso se ven 9 personas en la foto.   La asociación comunal “WALISUMA” está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Fidela.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: atención de una Pensión,  confección de enaguas, venta de ladrillos, venta de celulares, tejido de camas y venta de ladrillos.

La señora Fidela, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C.  “WALI SUMA” un ciclo, pero antes estaba en otro grupo también por un ciclo, lo que significa que es cliente de Pro Mujer aproximadamente un año,  el mismo tiempo que tiene el negocio de venta de ladrillos.  La señora Fidela  se ha dedicado a la elaboración de ladrillos por que ha visto que es un negocio rentable, antes atendía una Pensión. El crédito de este ciclo será destinado a comprar aserrín y leña, combustible que la señora utiliza para cocer  los ladrillos.  La venta es realizada en la zona de Villa Exaltación, Av. Aroma.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  el crédito.
texts.en:
The 'Walisuma' community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The group has eight members.  On the day of the meeting a woman was present who was accompanying one of the group members.  For this reason, there are 9 people in the photo

The 'Walisuma' community bank is managed by an executive committee led by a president, Fidela.  The bank's members have different businesses such as: working in a guest house, making traditional skirts, selling bricks, selling cell phones and knitting bedspreads.

Fidela, the bank's president, says that she has been a member of the 'Walisuma' community bank for one loan cycle but she was previously a member of another group for one loan cycle too.  This means that she has been a client of Pro Mujer for approximately one year.  This is the length of time she has had her brick selling business.  Fidela makes bricks because she saw that it is a profitable business.  She used to work in a guest house.  She will use this loan to buy sawdust and firewood, fuel that she uses to bake her bricks.  She makes her sales in Villa Exaltación district, Av. Aroma.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: To buy sawdust and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn S. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling snack foods , candies and biscuits in her community. She is a 35-year-old married woman from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. Roselyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and beverages. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est créé depuis 1996. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par liens de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de BABACK.

Madame MBAYANG G. (debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. 

Elle fait u petit commerce, elle vend précisément des poissons frais. Elle est la principale fournisseuse de poissons dans le village.

Le nouveau crédit de 200.000 francs CFA lui permettra de financer son activité de vente de poissons

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille en participant à la prise en charge de la nourriture et au payement des fournitures scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DEGGO was founded in 1996. It has 13 women members all from the same village. They have formed the group from among the neighborhood and among relatives. The group is a part of the Banc Villageois, BABACK.

Mrs. MBAYANG G. (the women on the left with her hand raised) is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old, married and has 10 children.

She has a small business of selling fresh fish. She is the main supplier of fish for the village.

The new loan of 200,000 CFA francs will allow her to finance her business of selling fish.

Her goal is to help her husband with the family expenses by paying for their food and for their children's school supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Atanacia

texts.es:
La Sra. Atanacia tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 están en edad escolar, durante toda su vida vendió pescado ya que su marido es pescador.
La profesión lo adquirió de su madre, ella comentó que cuando era niña ellos vivían al costado del río y después de una crecida (aumento del nivel del agua, previa a una inundación) se mudaron a una zona de mayor altura.
Posee casa propia, y confesó que no sabe hacer otra cosa que vender pescado.
Tiene dos sueños, uno de ellos es que todos sus hijos tengan casa propia y la otra es la oportunidad de mejorar su casa para que pueda vender los pescados allí mismo.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, mediante Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Atanacia is 42 years old and has 3 children, 2 of whom are school-aged.  All her life she has sold fish, as her husband is a fisherman.
She acquired the profession from her mother.  She tells us that when she was a girl, her family lived beside a river.  After a "crecida" (an rise in the water level just before a flood) they moved to an area of higher ground.
Sra. Atanacia has her own house and confessed that she's never known any other work than selling fish.
She has two dreams.  One is that her children have their own homes one day, and the other is to have the opportunity to improve her house so that she can sell her fish from her home. 
Sra. Atanacia is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity to access a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen S., 56, has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in Chamkar Leu district, Kompong Cham province. Since 1990, Sen S. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate rice and vegetables, from which she earns a daily income. She is a widow who currently lives with six children. Three of them are employed in a variety of jobs and other provinces while the other three are single and enrolled in school. 

Sen S. would like to ask for a loan to buy cashews in bulk from her neighbor for resale and also plant vegetables on her farmland.

loans.use: to buy cashews in bulk from her neighbor and also plant vegetables on her farmland.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 that will serve as additional capital to buy hog feeds. She also wanted to buy vegetables to sell to generate extra income. Josephine hopes to give her family a progressive living. That is why she is working hard and diligently looking for extra sources of income.

Josephine is 23 years old, a young mother to her child. Her husband works as a truck driver. She has been raising fattening pigs for more than a year now. Her income from business, which is PHP 8,000 whenever she sells one of her raised pigs, is being used for their daily basic needs. In the future, Josephine wishes to become successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Lin is 27 years old, married, and has children They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Lin is employed at the factory, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction worker, earning an income of $2 per day. The standard of living has been improved since Lin has been working. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Redemia is in her early thirties and is married with a small child who is in school.

For the past four years Redemia has been selling fruit, other small food items and tea. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. each day and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Redemia’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will share this loan with her loan group. The group is called “Ebeneza” and has 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Redemia used her previous loans to buy more small food items to sell along with her tea and has successfully paid back all of her loans. She hopes for a loan to sell more fruit. Her dream is to own her own restaurant where she can sell drinks, chips, meat and other food items.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.ru:
Ilkin rodilsya v 1989 qodu. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Ilkin jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy kotoraya boleyet i Ilkin prismatrivayet za ney. 
Uje 2 qoda kak Ilkin rabotayet taxistom. On etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje bil taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya yego mashini, tak kak ona isportilas i on ne mojet razvodit kliyentov. Poka yego mashina ne rabotayet on ne mojet pokupat svoyey mame lekarstvo i poeotmu on v skorom vremeni xochet pochinit yeyo.
texts.en: Ilkin was born in 1989.  He is not married and does not have children.  Ilkin lives in the Baku region together with his ailing mother, whom Ilkin has been looking after.  He has been working as a taxi driver for two years.  He learned this business from his father, who was also a taxi driver.  Currently, Ilkin needs 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts for his car because the car has broken down, and he cannot transport clients.  While his car is broken down, Ilkin cannot buy medications for his mother, and this is why he hopes to receive the loan soon.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a resident and farmer in Eldoret, North Rift Kenya. He is 34 years old and married with four children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. He has been in farming for over 14 years producing and selling maize, beans, wheat and milk.

Jacob has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will improve his milk production and in turn improve his family's living standards. Jacob has pointed to poor market prices as the major challenge in the farming business, especially for dairy.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene casa propia donde vive con su familia, él posee un taller y venta de bicicletas, tiene 10 años de haber iniciado el negocio, cuenta con experiencia pues este negocio lo heredo de su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso sobre la reparación de bicicletas.
Actualmente necesita de financiamiento para comprar herramientas y repuestos para el taller, ya que necesita llaves, sierras, frenos, pedales, llantas, rayos, entre otros más que ofrece a los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara para fortalecer el taller y estar más competente.
Su aspiración es ofrecer a su familia una condición de vida más estable, tener mayores comodidades a través del negocio, por tal motivo se esfuerza por mantener surtido el taller.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He has his own house here he lives with his family. He has a workshop and bicycle shop. He started the business 10 years ago and has experience because he inherited the business from his father, who taught him all about repairing bicycles.  

At present, he needs a loan to buy tools and replacement parts for the workshop. He needs wrenches, saws, brakes, pedals, wheels and spokes, among other things that he offers his customers. This loan will help his strengthen the workshop and be more competent.  

His aspirations are to offer his family more stable living conditions, and to have a more comfortable workplace. That is why he is working to keep his workshop supplied.

loans.use: to buy tools and replacement parts for his workshop, since he needs wrenches, saws, brakes, pedals, wheels and spokes.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurn works as a massager staff in one hotel in Siem Reap Province. She always gets a salary in monthly. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income around $5USD each day to share some responsibility with Mrs. Oeurn in daily expenses.  The couple blessed with two children who are young and still studying in local school. Mrs. Oeurn will use a loan in amount of $1,200 in order to change a new motorbike for her husband as his existing motorbike is getting old and buying a new boat for fishing activity.

loans.use: to change a new motorbike and to purchase a new boat for fishing activity.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Dolgorsuren is 66 and is a retiree and widow. Her husband died just one year ago. Now she lives only with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is divorced from her husband. 

Mrs. Dolgorsuren and her daughter own a house which is built from ceramic. The house has been going bad and becoming stale, so Mrs. Dolgorsuren needs to make some repairs or adjustments to her house including patching the roof and adding insulation to the walls. The loan Dolgorsuren is taking will be used to purchase some building materials for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been operating his general store in the town of Limuru for the past one year. He is 52 years old, married to Susan. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use the loan amount to add a stock of sugar, ground nuts, and detergents.

In the future, Stephen hopes his business will prosper and grow so as to lift the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To add a stock of sugar, ground nuts, and detergents.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 23 years old and single. To earn a living, he repairs phones to earn a living. He has been operating the business for four years. He started his business immediately after finishing school.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business. Nowadays, he has a busy day with customers. Peter hopes to fully establish his business in five years.  He has requested 40,000 KES to buy mobile phone spare parts.

loans.use: to buy phone spare parts.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Maïmouna est agée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux  et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire dans la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Maïmouna a mené beaucoup d’activités mais sans réussite, c’est ainsi  qu’elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’ achat et  de vente d’habillements et  de bijoux : des pagnes wax, des tissus brodés, des colliers en chaines, des boucles d’oreilles, des bracelets, etc. depuis plus de six ans. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso ( au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires dans une association des femmes de leur quartiers, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
Ce deuxième prêt individuel, elle compte acheter, 10 pièces de pagne wax, 5 complets de tissus brodés et 10 paquets de colliers en chaines et 10 paquet de boucle d’oreilles.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Maïmouna is 50 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband and children in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Maïmouna started trading in clothing and jewellery over 6 years ago, after several failed business ventures. She sells items like wax pagnes, embroidered fabrics, chain necklaces, earrings and bracelets, and she gets her merchandise in the town of Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). She then resells it on the street, mostly to women, and is much in demand due to the good quality of her products.

In order to be able to satisfy increasing customer demand, Maïmouna joined the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago and, after several group loans taken out with fellow members of a neighbourhood association, is now on her second individual loan. All her previous loans have been fully repaid. She will use her loan money to buy 10 Wax Pagnes, 5 embroidered suits, 10 packets of chain necklaces and 10 packets of earrings. She predicts an average monthly income of 90 000 francs, part of which she will use to contribute to her family´s expenses and repay her loan interest, part of which she will reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to restock on merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Marisue

texts.en:
Though her family lives less fortunate lives, Marisue describes herself as a jolly person who is thankful to have a hardworking husband who provides motorcycle services to the people in their village, especially students. He earns a daily net profit of P200, just enough to cover their daily meals and allowances for their three children.

Marisue is now requesting a loan of P8,000 to buy a new pair of tires and side mirrors for the motorcycle in order to improve the services rendered by her husband. She hopes to continue financing their children's education so that they can achieve a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a new pair of tires and side mirrors for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan trabaja realizando cortes y bañando a perros a domicilio. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar herramientas de trabajo como ser: cepillos, shampoo, tijeras y demás insumos; así podrá a futuro abrir un salón de belleza canina. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y  no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan provides dog grooming services from his home. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies for his work such as brushes, shampoo, scissors, and other items. In the future, he would like to open a dog grooming salon. This job is how he earns income to cover his expenses. Juan lives at home with his parents in the District of San Antonio of the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy brushes, shampoo, scissors, and other items for his dog grooming business.

loans.name: Patricial

texts.en: Patricial  is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and  she has  four children aged  2 to 15, some currently in  school. Two live with their grandmother and  the others live at home. For the past twenty years, she has been selling plastic dishes and buckets  in the  local  market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plastic dishes and buckets  for her business. She hopes to  build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic dishes and buckets  for her business.

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru: Абдувохид женат имеет 4 детей. Он занимается купле - продажей легковых автомашин более 10 лет. Приобретает автомобиля из местных рынков, а потом ремонтирует его и продает за выгодную цену. Он сам является владельцем бизнеса и успешен в своем деле. Его супруга домохозяйка. Кроме этого он занимается купле – продажей автозапчастей б/у для автомашин. Абдувохид хотел бы получить займ для ремонта легкового автомобиля и пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Abduvohid is married and has four children.  He has been involved in buying and selling cars for over ten years.  He buys cars from local markets, repairs them and then sells them at more profitable prices.  Abduvohid is the owner of this business and is successful in his business.  His wife is a homemaker.  Besides this, he is also involved in buying and selling spare parts for cars.  Abduvohid wants to obtain this loan to repair a car and increase his revolving capital.

loans.use: to repair a car and increase his revolving capital

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Odgerel is 40 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Selenge Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a chauffeur. Odgerel operates a vegetable and fruit trading business. She started her business in 2001. She is a trusted supplier of many shops, however she needs to build a storage area to save some supplies. She is a hard-working and diligent woman who says, "In the future we are planning to make our own grocery store." She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more fruits and vegetables and to save some supplies, because in the winter the prices will be high.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Khalunyanu A Group

texts.en:
Abraham is the facilitator of the Khalunyanu A group. Abraham and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Abraham takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Abraham had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Abraham was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Abraham and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Abraham will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khalunyanu A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Abraham is pictured with his group members. The field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
JIGUIYA est constitué essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Ouayerma Zone, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
SITAN  fait le commerce de chaussures, il y’a environ 4 ans et souhaite devenir grossiste. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  plus d’une centaine de paires de chaussures en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne dans au grand marché de Sikasso chez les grossistes. Elle les revend en détail à une place fixe les jours de foires hebdomadaires de la ville de Sikasso, de façon ambulante les jours ordinaires et en famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The JIGUIYA group consists mainly of married women who average 33 years of age and two children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Ouayerma Zone, a district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). This is their fifth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

Sitan has been selling shoes for approximately four years and wishes to become a wholesaler. She will use her loan to buy over a hundred pairs of plastic shoes from wholesalers at the Grand market of Sikasso. She sells the shoes at retail in her usual spot at the weekly fair of Sikasso, and door-to-door the rest of the time, to a clientele composed of both men and women, for cash. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 27,500 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay the interest and the loan and the rest added to her savings. She hopes to increase her sales and better serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jérome

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune pharmacien vétérinaire, célibataire sans enfants.Il tient une pharmacie vétérinaire.Il exrece dans cette activité depuis 2005  après une formation de deux ans.Il vit avec ses deux parents, ses frères et soeurs.Son commerce lui assure des bénéfices qui l'aident à prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des antibiotiques, des antiparasitaires, des vaccins et des vitamines.Son ambition est d'agrandir sa pharmacie.
texts.en: He is a young veterinary pharmacist who is single and does not have children. He manages a veterinary pharmacy. He has been in business since 2005 after two years of training. He lives with his parents and siblings.  His business generates enough profits so he can help his family with daily expenses as well as meet his own needs. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 cfa francs to purchase antibiotics, antiparasitics, vaccines and vitamins. His goal is to grow the pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, antiparasitics, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 35 years old and lives in Canicapan,Clarin. Tessie is married with 2 children. 
Tessie has a store that sells variety of products.Tessie has had this business for 5 years.Tessie requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods,noodles,beverages,detergents,etc.
Tessie has been a member of PMPC for 10 mos.  In the future,Tessie hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods,noodles,beverages,detergents,etc.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 33 years old, married to James; both were blessed with three children between the ages of nine years and two years old. She is a hardworking woman who is in the business of selling second-hand clothes and also has rental houses with a good income.

Rahab is applying for her third loan from KADET in the amount of KES 70,000 which she plans to use to purchase more stock of second-hand clothes for sale. The anticipated profit will be used to buy another plot or a land. 

She hopes to make a profit from this loan to enable her to start other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase for more stock of second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old, married and has seven children, five of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets and sacks of feeds.

Mary Jane has been pig fattening for 30 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and sacks of feeds

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don Carlos, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. La mujer es comerciante. 
Carlos es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, el trabaja en una fábrica en Manta, pero también para generara mejores recursos también se dedica junto a la mujer al comercio, ellos venden ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, su mujer sale casi todos los días y el por su parte vende en su lugar de trabajo a compañeros y los fines de semana sale junto a su mujer a vender y cobrar ya que dejan a crédito y cobran cada 8 días. Ellos  llevan más de 15 años dedicados a esta actividad la cual le deja buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y otras prendas. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.

loans.use: comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y otras prendas.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a fruit distributor and vendor in Guayaquil. She has been in this type of business for about 17 years because she helped her parents when they were in the same line of work. For a while she worked as a nanny but she did not make enough to make ends meet at her home. About 8 years ago she started working with about $200 in capital and sold at a stand on the street. She now was a spot in a market and is much better off.

She needs this loan in order to buy very large quantities of fruits. Alexandra has started distributing to other fruit vendors in her area and has been very successful. In order to continue she needs to have access capital to buy at wholesale prices. She has 3 children of which one is already independent. She hopes to one day open a business out of her home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fruits in bulk for her stand and to distribute to others

loans.name: Maluimaauga

texts.en:
Maluimaauga (Malu) is married and has three children.

She joined the SPBDF program in 2004, and since then has borrowed four times to expand and improve her plantation and start an ice-cake business, which are the primary sources of income for her family.

Every day she travels to the market to sell her bananas and coconuts from her plantation and ice-cake business.

Malu is now applying for her 5th loan to allow her to expand her plantation in order to enable her to export produce to New Zealand.

loans.use: Improve her Plantation to enable her to export produce to New Zealand.

loans.name: Warni

texts.en: Warni is 43 years old and is married with two children. Both of them are boys. To supplement her husband’s income, Warni sells vegetables and household goods like sugar, coffee, soap, washing powder, toothpaste, and other toiletries at a small kiosk in front of her house. Warni very much wants to earn more money for her children’s education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She needs additional working capital of $100, so that she can buy more goods to sell at her kiosk, and thus more or less double her income.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: There are 5 people in Canh's family. Their youngest child is in the 8th class. Canh is a worker for the "green dragon" company and her husband cultivates rice and "green dragon" (fruit) plants. Last year his income was very low because of insect damage. They still owe $ 625 to the bank from when they bought land for cultivation. Their average income is $13 per month per person. Now Canh wants to borrow $75 to invest in their "green dragon" plants. She is sure they can repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: improving their "green dragon" fruit harvest

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith I. is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five (5) children. She sells eggs wholesale to market men and women. She has been in this business since 1987 and hopes to increase her business if the loan is given to her.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
Ni Made M. is a highly motivated housewife. Due to her diligence in praying everyday, she realized that there is an opportunity to start worship supplies business. She sells things like saucer, basket, broom, flower, coconut leaves, etc. She obtains the ingredient from her neighbors' backyards. After collecting raw materials, she sells her products in the market. Some buyers come directly to her home. To increase volume and purchase more ingredients, Ni Made M. needs more capital. Through her local women's organization, No Made M. obtained additional capital and training from DINARI which helped her tremendously. From this business, Ni Made M. may obtain up to $2.20 - $3.30 profit which may supplement her husband's income, I Putu Denen, who works as a farmer.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Made M. adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang tidak pantang menyerah dan tekun dalam mencari peluang usaha. Karena setiap hari melakukan sembahyang dan memerlukan prasarana yang digunakan, maka secara kecil - kecilan Ni Made M. menyediakan bahan untuk prasarana sembahyang. Barang yang dijual seperti aneka canang sari, keranjang, semat, sapu lidi, janur dan lain-lain. Bahan baku didapat dengan cara membeli dikebun - kebun tetangga. Setelah barang dagangan terkumpul biasanya Nii Made M. menjualnya di pasar dan ada beberapa pembeli yang datang langsung kerumahnya.Untuk meningkatkan usahanya dan untuk membeli bahan baku lebih banyak lagi, Ni Made M. memerlukan tambahan modal. Melalui organisasi ibu – ibu didesanya Ni Made M. memperoleh tambahan dana dan pembinaan - pembinaan dari Yayasan DINARI yang tentunya sangat bermanfaat dalam melangsungkan perjalanan usahanya. Dengan usaha inilah Ni Made M. dapat memperoleh keuntungan bersih sekitar Rp. 20.000,- s/d Rp. 30.000,-. Dari keuntungan ini dapat menambah membantu penghasilan suaminya, I Putu Denen, yang seorang petani dan dapat untuk memenuhi

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia A. Rivas is married to a shopkeeper and she is a mother of 3 children. She sells cosmetics from house to house. Her clientele is made up of mostly friends and neighbors in the area. She has been doing this for 2 years. She's a representative of the most popular cosmetic companies in Latin America which is Avon.

Previously, Delicia used to sell basic food supplies, but she had to stop doing this because of the long distances she had to travelled and it was a day-long type of job.

At this time, Delica owns her home with one of her sons. Her husband does a lot of work-related travelling and she needs to provide for her family, especially to the needs of her daughter who currently needs a computer for school. This is why Delica would like to invest more money into her business so that hopefully she can make a bigger profit.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Delicia A. Rivas, casada con un comerciante y madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante, sus principales clientes son sus amistades o conocidos del barrio o de la zona. Ya son 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, representando a una de las empresas populares de cosméticos en latino América (AVON). Anteriormente a esta actividad, Delicia se dedicaba a la venta ambulante de víveres de primera necesidad, pero por razones de salud tuvo que dejar, ya que las distancias eran muy largas a recorrer, y era trabajo de todo el día. Actualmente Delicia vive en casa propia, con uno de sus hijos, su esposo se encuentra ausente por razones de trabajo, lo que le obliga a responder por las necesidades de su casa, principalmente las de estudio de su hija, la que precisa de una computadora para poder proseguir su carrera. Es por eso que Delicia precisa de dinero para poder generar mayor ganancia en su egocio, de esta forma comprar lo que su hija necesita.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Tulibako

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela, Tanzania! This is 34 year old Tulibako M.. She is married with three children, aged 16, 13, and 10.

In 2002, Tulibako established a hardware business. Tulibako has already successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy hardware appliances. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To buy hardware appliances in bulk

loans.name: Yesuamala Ic Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Deziranta N.. She is currently in the local brewing business and is requesting a loan to increase the volume of brew sold. Deziranta is 46 years old and is married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has 6 children ranging from age 9 to 28 and four of them go to school. Each week, Deziranta makes approximately UGX 75000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her family. Deziranta has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her brewing business and the loan was paid back on time.

Deziranta is joined in her small group by Rose N., Joyce N., Prossy N., and Barbara N.. Rose N. has a local brewing business and wants to add to the business. Joyce N. is currently operating a business selling fresh food and wants a loan to purchase more food to sell. Prossy N. operates a business selling fish and wants to boost business. Barbara N. is currently in the business selling fresh food and is requesting a loan to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To add to local brewing business and increase quantity of brew sold

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia S. is 43 years of age, and she is married to Aurelio Pereira who is 41 years of age. The couple has 5 children, of which 2 are in high school, 2 in primary school, and the last one, who is the youngest in their home, is not yet in school.

Nimia S. is a peddler and started out in this profession working for someone else. After a long period of time, and with sufficient experience and a little bit of capital, she started her own business, which today runs wonderfully. She already has a very important tool – her motorcycle, which helps her transfer to greater distances in a shorter period.

Her plans for the future include setting up her own stand, but to do so she will require more capital. She dreams with having her children complete their studies and becoming successful professionals and assets to society. Her greatest wish for her country is change; that there is less corruption and more work to avoid massive emigration of her people to other countries, for many families suffer greatly due to the separation that it implicates.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nimia S. de 43 años de edad, esta casada , su esposo se llama Aurelio Pereira y tiene 41 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 van al colegio, 2 a la escuela primaria, y la última, la más pequeña de la casa, aún no va a la escuela.

Doña Nimia S. es vendedora ambulante, se inicio en esta profesión trabajando para otra persona, después de mucho tiempo y ya con experiencia suficiente y con un poco de capital, emprendió su propia microempresa, en la cual hoy día le va de maravillas. Actualmente ya cuenta con una herramienta muy importante, su moto que le sirve para trasladarse a una distancia mayor y en menor tiempo.

Sus planes para futuro es tener un puesto fijo, para ello necesitaría de mayor capital, ella sueña que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales exitosos y útiles a la sociedad. Lo que mas desea para nuestro país es el cambio, que haya menos corrupción y mas fuentes de trabajo de este modo se pueda evitar la emigración masiva de personas a otros países, pues las familias sufren mucho por la separación que eso implica.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as undergarments, towels, tablecloths, coolers, pot and pan sets, casseroles, perfumes, skirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Amida's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Amida is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, aged 6 and 2 years old. Amida owns a small salon, which she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatuma, Rukia, Tatu, Khadija and Amina, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales, market sales and food sales.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
For 15 years the husband of Irma was dedicated to the exchange of used clothes. Because of that, she knew the business of selling scrap, in which she has labored for 12 years.

Irma and her husband have a business that is dedicated to the buying and selling of scrap in the provinces. They travel constantly to the interior of Peru to buy scrap, that then will be sold to wholesalers in Lima. 4 years ago they bought a truck and currently they have 3 mototriciclos (motorized tricycles), with which they collect the scrap. One mototriciclo is found in Lima, and the other two in Ica.

She goes to Ica weekly in her truck to collect scrap, while she travels to the forest every month or more, with all her family. She says that there she is more profitable because there are boots, metal and batteries.

In Ica, Irma has a localitions where she stores all the scrap, that then will be transferred to Lima.

From moment she bought the truck Irma was without capital to buy more scrap, for which she had to request loans.

She would like to have a large warehouse in lima to store her scrap, so that she could work only in the capital and not travel so far away so that she would be able to take care of her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 15 años el esposo de Irma se dedicaba al canje de ropa usada. A raíz de eso, ella conoció el negocio de la venta de chatarra, en la que labora desde hace 12 años.

Irma y su esposo tienen una empresa que se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra en provincias. Ellos viajan constantemente al interior del Perú a comprar chatarra, que luego será vendida a mayoristas en Lima. Hace 4 años se compraron un camión y en la actualidad tienen 3 mototriciclos (triciclos motorizados), con los que recogen la chatarra. Un mototriciclo se encuentra en Lima, y los otros dos en Ica.

Ella va a Ica semanalmente en su camión a recoger chatarra, mientras que a la selva viaja por lapsos de un mes o más, con toda su familia. Dice que allá es más rentable porque hay botas, metales y baterías.

En Ica, Irma tiene un local donde almacena toda la chatarra, que luego será trasladada a Lima.

Irma, al momento de comprarse el camión se quedó sin capital para comprar más chatarra, por lo que tuvo que pedir préstamos.

A ella le gustaría tener un depósito grande en Lima donde almacenar su chatarra, al igual que trabajar solo en la capital, para así no viajar tan lejos y poder cuidar de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more scrap in the provinces for resale in Lima.

loans.name: Samoern

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoern P. is a villager in Chaoeng Kdey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a subsistence farmer. In her farming, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough cows to plow her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to add to the old one in order to be used as draft animals.

Her husband, Mr. Doem In, is a teacher and farmer. Mrs. Samoern P. is a 38 year old mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to the old one in order to be used as draft animals.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the sale of meat. She has been in this business since 2005 and she learned this business for a year. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more meat for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Vilma Nelly

texts.es:
Vilma is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For the past four years she has worked intensely to raise small animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs, although she specializes in raising chickens. She purchases the chickens in bulk, fattens them, and then sells them later for a better price. She does the same with the hogs, waiting until they grow in order to sell them. The guinea pigs, however, are generally for personal consumption. The difficulty for Vilma comes when one of her animals gets sick and dies, which can bring a loss of income. Vilma will invest the money from her loan in improving her chicken farm.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica intensamente a la crianza de animales menores, como pollos cerdos y cuyes, pero en mayor proporción a los pollos, los compra al por mayor, los hace engordar para luego venderlos a un mayor precio, de igual manera hace con los cerdos, espera a que sus crías crezcan para venderlos, los cuyes son generalmente para su consumo personal. Lo dificultoso para ella es cuando a veces uno de sus animales se enferma y llegar a morir, lo cual le puede generar pérdidas. Vilma invertirá el dinero del préstamo en mejorar la granja de sus pollos.

loans.use: To improve and supply the farm where she raises chickens

loans.name: Gesarela

texts.es: Gesarela a sus 54 años es madre 5 hijos que ya son profesionales e independientes. Se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante, ahora vive solo con su esposo Octavio quien es albañil.Ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas heladas (gaseosas, néctar y cerveza), es una mujer prometedora y luchadora cuando dice algo lo cumple y eso lo aplica en la mejora D. su calidad D. vida. Quiere implementar su negocio con otros productos, así como también ampliar y mejorar los ambientes donD. venD. sus productos, sin embargo, para lograr este propósito requiere D. esta cantidad D. dinero que solicita.
texts.en:
Gesarela is 54 years old and the mother of five children, who are all working professionals and living on their own. She now lives alone with her husband, Octavio, who is a contractor. She sells cold drinks (sodas, juices and beer), and works very hard to get ahead. She is a very promising woman and a fighter; she always keeps her word, especially when it comes to improving her own quality of life.

Gesarela would like to stock her store with different products and would also like to expand and improve the space in which she sells her drinks. She needs this Kiva loan to accomplish these goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a wider variety of products to sell, improve and expand store

loans.name: Ana Milagritos

texts.es:
La señora Ana Milagritos H. F.  pertenece al banco comunal JERID Camino al Éxito II, tiene 31 años y vive en la calle Negreiros manzana 2 lote 2 pueblo joven Aurora Díaz del distrito de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria pero no continuo estudiando debido a que se casó con el señor Cristian Chirinos y tiene un hijo varón de 11 años y una hija mujer de 7 años.
Inició su negocio vendiendo marcianos, pero  como es una mujer que continuamente  analiza donde puede rendir mejor el negocio entonces incursionó en la compra venta de material para botes de madera y redes de pesca.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles pagados en 4 cuotas compró material para marcianos de hielo porque fue en la época de verano.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en clavos y madera para botes.
Ana sueña con que un día Manuela Ramos crezca tanto como para poder brindar prestamos de mayor envergadura.
texts.en:
Ana Milagritos H. F. belongs to the JERID Camino al Exito II ("JERID Road to Success II") community bank. She is 31 years old and lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She dropped out of school after two years of high school to marry her husband Christian Chirinos. They have a son, 11, and a daughter, 7. She started out selling "marcianos" (a traditional sweet) but because she's always looking for ways to generate more revenue from the business, she jumped in to selling material for building small fishing boats and nets. With her first 300-soles loan, that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought material for iced marcianos because that's what her customers wanted when she got the loan in the summer. With this 1000-soles loan, to be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in nails and wood for building small fishing boats. Ana dreams that one day Manuela Ramos grows so much that it can make loans of great scope.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for resale.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvenida and her family live in Malamag West, where farming is the main livelihood of the residents.  Her husband is a farmer while Mrs. Samuco is engaged in meat vending.  Their four children serve as the inspiration to improve their lives. 

For almost three years now, Mrs. Samuco, with the help of her husband, has raised pigs in their backyard, selling the meat in their community. Their store, very accessible to her customers since it is  located in front of their house, earns a weekly average gross income of about $70 which they use as revolving capital.  They are so thankful that increasing demand enables them to sell all of their meat products everyday.  

Bienvinida is now requesting a loan to purchase more pigs in order to satisfy this demand and is very optimistic that through their business, they will improve their way of life and be able to send all of their children to college.  “All things are possible with God on our side,” says Bienvenida.

loans.use: To buy more pigs.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Née à Aklakou en 1959 où elle vit jusqu’à ce jour, Madame K. Akossiwa est une veuve avec cinq (05) enfants. Elle est seule à prendre en charge ses enfants. Par les maigres revenu tirés de son petit commerce de patte de maïs «Kom», elle a de la peine à répondre aux besoins de la famille.
Elle sollicite un financement pour se ravitailler en maïs et bois de chauffe afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et rehausser son pouvoir d’achat.
texts.en:
Born in 1959 in the city of Aklakou, where she resides to this day, Mrs. Akossiwa K., a widow, lives with her five (5) children. She is alone and responsible for the upbringing of her children. From the tiny revenues of her small business of making corn dough, she finds it difficult meeting the needs of her family.

She is requesting a loan to increase her stocks of corn and fire wood and expand her buying power to better serve her customers

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies of corn and fire wood

loans.name: Husna S.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Husna O. from Mbeya. She is married with four children, between the ages of 5 and 13. Husna has been running a salon since 2005. This is a place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

Husna works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Husna currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 700 USD in order to purchase salon facilities. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Husna thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase salon facilities

loans.name: Vivienne

texts.en: Vivienne sells clothes and jewelry. She travels to Lagos and Onitsha to purchase her goods to sell in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria whee she lives. She loves this business and is requesting a loan amount of $475 (N70, 000) to purchase more clothes and jewelery to sell. She is 27-years-old and single. Vivienne is grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en: Thirty-seven years old and married with two children, Kayode sells tyres. Hoping to expand this business, he is requesting the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more tyres to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tyres  to sell

loans.name: Rosa Josefa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA EXCELENTE CLIENTE QUE INGRESA A EMPRENDER UN 25 D. MARZO DEL 2002 EN EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO JERUSALEM LUEGO D. UN TIEMPO DECID. SACAR UN CREDITO EN FORMA INDIVIDUAL, LA SEÑORA ESTA EN LA SECUENCIA OCHO D. SU CREDITO INDIVIDUAL, ELLA SE D. DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CALZADOS EN SU PUESTO UBICADO EN LA AV. 16 D. JULIO EN LA CIUDAD D. EL ALTO, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION D. CHAMARRAS QUE ACOMODA POR MAYOR EN LA FERIA 16 D. JULIO, LA SEÑORA Y SU ESPOSO TIENEN CUATRO HIJOS LOS CUALES AUN CURSAN LA ESCUELA PRIMARIA. NECESITAN EL CREDITO PARA SURTIR EL NEGOCIO CON CALZADOS D. NUEVOS MODELOS.
texts.en:
Ms. M. D. L. is an excellent client who joined “Emprender”, with the Jerusalem Solidarity Group, on March 25th, 2002. After some time, she decided to request an individual loan and is on her eight-loan cycle for individual loans. She sells shoes at a stand on Av. 16 D. Julio in the city El Alto. Her husband makes (chamarras) coarse, heavy jackets and sells them, wholesale at the market, 16 D. Julio.

The couple has four children who are still in primary school. They need the loan to stock new styles of shoes in their store.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock new style of shoes

loans.name: Sulu

texts.en: Sulu M., 48, is married with 9 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the Taro plantation business. She sells to the village people, especially the public, 3 days per week.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 60 Tala (about US $21).  SPBD loans are Sulu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Sulu plans to use this money to pay for her children's school fees, things needed to improve her plantation, and house repairs.

loans.use: For school fees, farming supplies, and house repairs

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 36 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijos; Luis de 14, Gabriel de 4, Bony de 6 y Katy de 2 añitos. Se dedica a la atención de su librería, la cual implementó en su propia casa hace 4 años, felizmente el negocio le ha ido bien y espera seguir creciendo en bien de sus hijos. Angélica es una mujer muy empeñosa, es por eso que atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche para lograr las ganancias deseadas. Su hijo mayor la ayuda cuando regresa del colegio, porque sola no podría darse abasto para la atención, a Angélica le gusta mucho la interacción con al gente, pero en algunos casos le resulta muy cansado, por las largas horas de trabajo, felizmente las ventas son buenas y su negocio va creciendo cada vez más. Ella espera en un futuro consolidar su negocio y adicionalmente tener un restaurante.  Ella es una cliente muy antigua en MFP, empezó en bancos comunales, en los cuales le fue muy bien, ahora decidió solicitar un préstamo individual, en el cual promete ser tan responsable como lo fue en el pasado. Con este dinero implementará su librería con más útiles, también irá comprando algunos muebles para ir haciendo realidad sus metas de poner su restaurante.
texts.en:
Angélica, 36, is single and lives with her children: Luis is 14; Gabriel is 4, Bony is 6; and Katy is 2. She runs a book store, which she started four years ago in her house. Happily, the business has goon well, and she hopes it keeps growing for the good of her children. Angélica is a very tenacious woman; she works in her store from 6 in the morning until 8 or 9 at night to be able to get the desired income. Her oldest son helps when he gets home from school because she couldn’t get everything done all by herself. Angélica really likes interacting with people, but sometimes she gets very tired due to the long hours she works. Happily, sales are good and her business is growing more every day. In the future, she hopes to consolidate her business and add a restaurant. She has been a client of MFP for a long time. She started in community banks, and she did well. Now she is asking for an individual loan, and she promises to be as responsible as she has been in the past. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her bookstore. She will also buy some furniture to start making her dream of having a restaurant a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary C., 46 years old, lives at Oroquieta City. She is famous for pillow cases, dress- & curtain-making. She obtained the skills when she was still young with her grandmother being the owner of a fashion design shop. When  she got married, she continued the said business. Her primary customers are her neighbors & relatives. As time goes by, tested & proven over the years that many had known them already, some from banks, teachers and even government employees. In order to cater to them, she hired part time dressmakers and paid them based on the number of pieces. Today, she is applying for PHP5,000 to buy additional fabrics and materials. In the future, she hopes that they might have a registered tailoring shop in the heart of the city.

loans.use: To buy additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a 34-year-old woman. She and her husband, Sulaiman, have four children - three girls: Bashayer who is eight years old, Dima who is six years old, Nada who is four years old; and one boy Ghandy who is one and a half years old.
 
Kifah and Sulaiman noticed that there was high demand for natural herbs medicine and started a business selling these products a few months ago. The idea for the business came from Kifah, who has good experience in this area and wanted to help her husband to improve the family income. Many people prefer natural herbs over ordinary medicine since they have no side effects. Also, they are cheaper, especially since the GAZA strip is under siege and modern medicine is very expensive. So, Kifah thought of creating this micro business.


The business is primarily managed by Kifah since her husband is employed elsewhere, but he helps her after finishing his work. They asked FATEN for this loan in order to meet the high demand and buy new herbs and oil. They also want to upgrade the store decoration. 

(In the picture, Kifah appears in her shop with her husband.)

loans.use: Raw Materials

loans.name: Sabougnouma 5 Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma 5 est constitué de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 2 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 16.5  hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau des marchés  de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma 5 is composed of married women who average 29 years of age and 2 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 16.5 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 16.5 hectares

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann N. is a 27-year-old mother caring for one school-aged son. She and her husband work as farmers everyday planting various crops, especially rice crops, which they grow on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandmother. Chann N. hopes to grow rice after the heavy rains fall; thus, she has decided to seek a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers in the hopes of producing a good harvest at the end of this raiN. season. Note: Chann N.’s husband appears in the photo above at their farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
La socia se llama Gilda, ella vive en el barrio de Kennedy, en el distrito de huanchac, está situado este barrio a 15 minutos de la plaza principal de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y trabaja aún en el instituto nacional de cultura, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal, ella requiere un capital de trabajo para invertir en un pequeño negocio que tienen en mente hace ya mucho tiempo, ella aún no nos indica en que negocio, debido a que por sus creencias personales, ella desea guardar en secreto hasta que se cumpla su sueño.

Nuestra socia se muestra feliz y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda.
texts.en:
This member's name is Gilda and she lives in the Kennedy neighborhood of the Huanchac district of Cusco which is located 15 minutes from the city's main plaza. Gilda is 51 years old, is single, does not have children, and works at the National Cultural Institute. She is requesting a loan for personal use. She needs capital to invest in a small business that she has been thinking about starting for a long time now. She is not specifying what her business is yet, because due to her personal beliefs she would like to keep it a secret until her dream is realized. Gilda is happy and appreciates the loan being made to her in this way and she is committed to paying back the total of her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi E. est un homme de 35 ans marié et père de  trois enfants. Il habite à AVENO, un village situé  environ 90 kilomètres de Kpalimé.  Avec ce prêt, komi voudrait acheter une moto pour en faire TAXI. Le travail de Komi consiste à faire monter les passagers sur la moto et les faire déposer à leur destination et prend les frais de déplacement. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il veut améliorer sa vie en envoyant ses trois enfants à l’école.
texts.en:
