Komi E. is a 35-year-old man who is married and the father of three children. He lives in AVENO, a village located about 90 km from Kpalimé. With this loan, Komi would like to buy a moto, a motorbike serving as a taxi. His work involves having passengers climb onto his motorbike, dropping them off at their destination, and charging a fee for the trip. With this initial FECECAV loan, he wants to improve his life by sending his three children to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi-moto

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita B. is from the village of Bay Bay Bonifacio. She is 39 years old. Jovita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a business of selling fish to local community members. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $62 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jovita joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and save as a reserve for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.en:
“If you are responsible, you will be successful someday” says Ma. Celia P. of Barangay Tuao North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. 

Ma. Celia is 37 years old and has a high school education. Her parents could not afford to finance her studies in college, so she married early to Rodel P. from Solano Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with a child, Madelyn P., who is ten years old and in fourth grade in elementary school. She wants her child to become successful in her studies someday so that she will have a bright future.
 
Despite their poverty, the couple does their best to earn income so they can satisfy their daily basic needs and finance the schooling of their child. Ma. Celia's husband is a tricycle driver. She sells cooked snacks and vegetables from a simple vending stall in front of her house. She started her business with only  PHP 2,000 (~ $40 USD) in capital, which she used to buy goods for her food snack and vegetable vending business. 

Ma. Celia earns a weekly income of PHP 1,000 from her business, but she says that this is not enough, so she wants to borrow PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders to use as additional business capital so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Marcos Roberto

texts.es: El señor Marcos López de 43 años, vive en Ciudadela Nicaragua en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 8 años de  edad que cursa su primaria, don Marcos es dueño de un taxi el cual ha trabajado por doce años, este vehiculo lo compro con dinero de su liquidación que trabajaba en jaboneria el hogar, su meta es comprar otro carro moderno en donde pueda seguir dando su servicio al cliente, con este préstamo hará mejora  a su casa, va a construir las paredes de concreto para una mejor infraestructura como mejor seguridad familiar contra la delincuencia. Agradece AFodenic por dar el financiamiento para seguir con sus objetivos en mejorar cada día su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos L., who is 43 years old, lives in Nicaragua's capital city of Managua. He is married, and his wife has an 8-year old child to whom she primarily attends. Mr. Marcos is the owner of a taxi, where he has worked for twelve years. This vehicle was purchased with money from the sale of his homemade soap business. His goal is to buy another modern car where he can continue to provide customer service. This loan will improve his home too where he will build concrete walls for better infrastructure and better security against crime. He thanks AFODENIC for giving him the loan to pursue his goals of improving his home each day.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build concrete walls

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Mangidkid, Plaridel, Mis. Occ. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is married and has one child. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additonal products to sell

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a 50-year-old single mother of four children between the ages of 5 and 20. All her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with seven people. Teopista takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and gets two meals a day.

Teopista doesn’t incur additional transportation costs to and from shopping, because she buys from people who get what she needs from surrounding villages. She has a small bar where she sells all types of beer and local gin. She sells to all categories of people, at both retail and wholesale prices. Teopista works seven days a week, receiving an average of thirty customers a day. Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season which hinders her customers from coming to her because she works from a muddy place. Teopista‘s monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises and residence, and feeding the family.

She has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her twelfth loan and working with the same group mates. Teopista joined MCDT because it was near her home and also to increase her capital. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and would like to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Ushirika Mazizini Group

texts.en:
Pamela Cheseo, age 25, is married, with one 4-year-old son. She has a clothes, bag, and cosmetics business since 2005. She works daily from 7 am until 4 pm. She is able to make a monthly profit of around $121.

This will be Pamela’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock for her business, and she successfully paid back her loans. She is requesting this loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to further increase her inventory.

Pamela will share this loan with her loan group, Ushirika Mazizini, which has 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable to pay back their loans. In the picture, Pamela is the first person on the left in the front row.

loans.use: Increase inventory for clothes, bag, and cosmetics business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió superior completo y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.
Delfina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y comprar ovejas y chanchos.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar un toro.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Delfina became a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” community bank in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno 2 years ago. She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed high school, and she works in the buying and selling of livestock. Delfina says that with her first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles she was able to increase her capital and buy sheep and pigs. She is now requesting a loan of 800 with which she can buy a bull. Her future dream is to have her own home in Ilave and that her children become professionals. The things she likes best about her community bank are the savings and the meetings for the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse of a bull

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou M. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de LYNDIANE depuis mai 2007 et a eu de performances remarquables avec le crédit. Elle vend des friperies et des rafraîchissements. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Bintou M., aged 34, is married and the mother of six children, who all attend school. She has been a member of the village bank of Lyndiane since May 2007 and has an outstanding credit history. She sells secondhand clothes and cold drinks. Bintou participates in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Chaker

texts.en:
Chaker is a 41-year-old married man with four children of whom three are still going to school.

Chaker works as a builder specialized in making concrete ramps. He has been involved in this occupation for the past twenty years and, over the years, he was been able to meet his family’s needs with his business.

On the business side, he has a growing number of projects. Today, he is requesting $1,000 to buy new molds to make new designs in concrete.

loans.use: To buy new molds to make new designs in concrete

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en casa de sus padres los cuales 
le ayudan a cuidar a su menor hija, Ella inicio el negocio de venta de ropa hace 
algunos años, con un pequeño capital producto del trabajo como obrera de planta. Ella 
ya posee una gran cantidad de clientes a los cuales les brinda además de buenos 
precios una buena atención y garantía en la mercadería que les vende, con los 
excedentes obtenidos en esta labor adquirió a crédito una mototaxi la cual le 
genera mayores ingresos. Soledad sueñan con brindarle a su hija y a sus padres una 
condición de vida adecuada, además con tener su casa propia, Soledad destina todos los 
ingresos para la educación de su hija ya que ella esta en edad escolar y la manutención de sus padres.
texts.en:
Soledad, age 33, is a single mother. She lives in her parents’ house, and they help take care of her young daughter. She started her business of selling clothes some years ago. She started with a small amount of capital that she got as a worker in a plant. She already has a large number of customers. Besides offering them good prices and good service, she guarantees the merchandise that she sells. She used the profits from this business to buy a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) on credit. The mototaxi generates greater income. Soledad dreams of giving her daughter and her parents decent living conditions in addition to having their own house. Soledad puts all of he earnings towards her school-age daughter’s education and towards supporting her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Oscar Moisés

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Moisés A. M., tiene 30 años es casado y su esposa trabaja como comerciante tienen 2 hijos de 4  y 2 añitos de edad, ellos se dedican a la siembra de la piña desde hace 11 años, comenzaron sus trabajos en la agricultura gracias al apoyo financiero que les brindo su padre. Dentro de los planes que tienen como familia está la remodelación de la vivienda y dentro de las mayores dificultades esta el alza de los precios de los productos, dentro de los planes para el negocio está la diversificación de los productos que cosecha en su finca, para esto solicita de un préstamo que invierta en la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes e insumos que le brinden a las tierras un mejor mantenimiento que haga que la producción sea de mejor calidad y de esta manera recuperar a corto plazo el dinero invertido. 

Esto beneficiaría a la familia en gran medida debido a  que es la fuente de ingreso más alta que tienen y el aumento de las ventas les daría una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Oscar Moisés A. M., age 30, is married. His wife works as a merchant, and they have 2 children, ages 4 and 2. They have been engaged in planting pineapples for 11 years. They began their agricultural work thanks to the financial support offered to them by Oscar’s father.

Among the plans they have as a family is the remodeling of their house. Among their greatest difficulties is the increase in the cost of living.

Among the plans for their business is the diversification of crops that they harvest on their farm. For this reason Oscar is applying for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of agricultural materials such as fertilizers and raw materials that will provide the land with better maintenance. This will make for better quality production, and, in this manner, he will recover the investment in a short time. This would benefit the family greatly due to the fact that farming is the biggest source of income that they have, and the increase in sales would give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for maintaining their land

loans.name: Marky

texts.en:
Marky is 55 years old and married with 10 children, ranging in age from four to 20 years old. Only three of her children are currently attending school, as she lacks the necessary school fees to send all of them.  

Marky runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over 20 years. She used to specialize in vegetable sales, but lately has moved more into milk production, which she sells at the local market. Marky has to deal with a few issues in her business, including difficult access to markets that may be very far from her home.

Marky successfully completed her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo and has now requested this loan for Kes. 41,600 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that her first loan took her a step forward in life, and now this loan will help her acquire a new, more productive dairy cow that will increase her income. She hopes this will assist her in meeting her family's needs and help pay the school fees for her children who are currently unable to attend school.

Marky has an optimistic outlook for the future, and already has a number of plans in mind for her business. She wants to own at least six high breed dairy cows and run a poultry farm. She also wants to purchase a motorbike so she is able to transport her produce to market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone charge cards

loans.name: José Gregorio

texts.es:
José Gregorio M. T. nació San Onofre en Sucre, habitado por una diversidad étnico-cultural en la que confluyen elementos de la costa, la sierra y la sabana que determina una particular y muy armónica manera de relación social y productiva entre sus habitantes; José tiene 28 años y  emigró hacia un municipio, a  diez kilómetros al oriente de Cartagena llamado Turbaco, buscando oportunidades de estudios superiores y con el fin de conseguir sus sueños empezó a estudiar Derecho en la Universidad,  pero la muerte de su padre lo obligó a suspender esa carrera y debió trabajar para sostener su familia; así fue como trabajó en  oficios de carpintería y albañilería, pero estas actividades no le generaron los  ingresos suficiente para subsistir.  Con su origen cultural artesano, empezó a elaborar productos de la cultura precolombina como mochilas, gorros, bolsos en tela y con su dedicación, creatividad y por ser muy estudioso de su cultura creó sus propias herramientas de trabajo de tipo artesanal: bastidores, pulpo, caja de revelado de diapositivas,  con los cuales elabora sus productos que son de mucha  aceptación entre turistas nacionales e internacionales, porque combinan las tendencias actuales con el legado de la cultura precolombina. Jose necesita avanzar en la calidad de sus productos, porque eso es lo que mas cuida, por eso su actual crédito por valor de $ 2.100.000  lo usará para adquirir una maquina sesgadora que mejore su calidad  y también para invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos como telas y pinturas. 

José es una persona muy solidaria, por eso muchas veces hace esfuerzos laborales para  ayudar a su familia, él hace pequeñas producciones y  la distribuye mediante el sistema de consignación en tiendas, hoteles de la ciudad turística de Cartagena y logra constantes  pedidos semanales de estas unidades de negocio en la ciudad amurallada. Su meta es culminar su carrera profesional, crear una tienda de artesanías interactiva, donde el turista conozca y sienta el proceso productivo de los artículos que está comprando.

Sueña mas adelante con exportar sus artesanías y tener un lugar propio donde producir lo que mas ama las artesanías de la cultura precolombina.
texts.en:
José Gregorio M. was born in San Onofre in Sucre. Its inhabitants are of diverse ethnic and cultural backgrounds. There are elements of the coast, the mountains, and the plains. This makes for special and harmonious social interactions and productivity among its inhabitants. José is 28 years old, and he emigrated to the Turbaco municipality, which is ten kilometers to the east of Cartagena. He was looking for opportunities for a college education. In order to follow his dreams he started studying law at the university. But, the death of his father obliged him to suspend this career because he had to work to support his family. That is how he started working at carpentry and bricklaying. But, these activities did not generate enough income to survive. Looking back to his heritage, he started making products from the pre-Colombian culture. He makes things like backpacks, hats, and fabric bags. With his dedication, creativity, and by studying his culture a great deal he created his own work tools for handicrafts. He made various types of frames and a slide projector. He uses them to make his products, which are very well received among locals and tourists. This is because he combines the current tendencies with the pre-Colombian legacy. José needs to make headway with the quality of his products because this attracts the most attention. Therefore, he will use his current loan for the amount of 2,100,000 COP to get a serger (overlock machine) that will improve the quality. He will also buy materials and supplies like fabric and paint. José is a very supportive person, and he often does work to help his family. He makes small handicrafts and distributes them to stores and hotels in tourist city of Cartagena through a consignment system. He gets constant weekly orders from businesses in the city of Amurallada. His goal is to finish his professional career and to create an interactive handicrafts store where the tourists know and feel the productive process of the articles they are buying. He dreams of later exporting his handicrafts and having his own place where he produces what he loves the most, handicrafts from the pre-Colombian culture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Get a serger (overlock machine) and buy materials and supplies like fabric and paint

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. is happily married and lives with her three children. She has received no formal education.  Yaa buys onions in bags and sells them in both small and large quantities to her customers at Abura. Her husband is a teacher.  

Yaa uses the income she generates from her sales to help her husband in the general up-keep of the home.  Yaa will use the loan to purchase onions for resale as well as yams and maize which is going to serve as an additional trade to invest in. With the new income that is going to come as a result of the loan received, Yaa plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase onions for resale as well as yams and maize

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa T. is a 65-year-old widow who supports her family through her general store and farming businesses. She lives in Barangay Buenavista, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, with her seven children who are between the ages of 25 and 45 years, with some of them having their own family while the others help her with the family's needs.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $220.

Elsa is now borrowing 17,000 PHP so that she can continue her general store and farming businesses. This will be her 12th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elsa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz C. is 33 years old and married with two school-aged children, living in the city of Tagbilaran. To make a living, Beatriz owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

Beatriz joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 43 years old. She is married and has 5 children who range from 5-20 years of age. She is very hard-working and likes what she does for a living.  She has put all her children through school.

Speciose sells both local and commercial beer, as well as skewered meat. The local beer is made from amakashi, a type of banana, and sorghum, which helps ferment the banana juice. She has been in this business for 20 years and her business is doing well.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more beer and hopes to make enough profits one day to buy a house.

loans.use: Buying alcoholic drinks for her bar and animals for skewered meat.

loans.name: Bronco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Bronco está compuesta por ocho personas, siete mujeres y 1 varón. Este es su primer ciclo, tiene como presidenta a la señora María F..

La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Santiago II.  La señora Maria tiene como negocio la venta de zapatos deportivos, desde hace cuatro años. 

Sus clientes son en general personas que viven en los departamentos de Potosí, Santa Cruz y Tarija.
Para este primer crédito la asociación le aprobó de Bs. 2000.- , monto de dinero que le servirá para incrementar su capital.

Ella comenta que le gusta el Crédito en Pro Mujer por que el ahorro es quincenal.
 
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen diferentes tipos de negocios: venta de pollos a la broster, venta de comida, venta de perfumes, venta de abarrotes y Servicio Eléctrico.
texts.en:
The "Bronco" Communal Bank is made up of eight people, seven women and one man. This is their first loan cycle, and they have María F. as their president. The above-mentioned communal bank belongs to the Santiago II Regional Office. Maria's business is selling athletic shoes, which she has done for four years. Her customers are generally people who live in the departments of Potosí, Santa Cruz and Tarija. For this first loan the association approved her for 2000 bolivianos, an amount of money that will help her increase her capital. She says that she likes the loans from Pro Mujer because the saving is biweekly. The members of the communal bank have different types of businesses: fried chicken sales ("pollos a la broster"), food sales, perfume sales, grocery sales and electrical services.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of athletic shoes

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly V. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is 44 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Merly owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2004, Merly joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Merly is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.en: Mira S. is the leader of the group. She is 41 and married. She has a daughter and a son; the son is at school and the daughter is not yet. Mira owns a shop to sell convenience goods and her husband works in construction. When he is free, he helps Mira with her activity. Mira opened her shop three years ago and she makes 5,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business and purchase a vehicle. Raiymbubu N. is the treasurer of the group. She is 41 and married. She has four children. Her husband works in the factory. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 500 soms, Raiymbubu started to take orders and sew with the national cloth and dressmaking supplies. In this way, she makes 5,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase a new sewing machine. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase fabrics and materials. In the future, she wants to see her sons get wed. Vera C., 46, is married. She has four children. In order to cover family expenses, Vera started to sew with the national cloth and dressmaking supplies. She has been doing it for 13 years. In this way, she earns 6,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to improve her living conditions and purchase a new fridge. Vera applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fabrics and materials. In the future, she wants to expand her business and save some money to contribute to her daughter’s wedding. Kerimkul T., 45, is married. He has four children; a daughter and a son are at school and the other children are working. Kerimkul is a taxi driver and his wife works in the ice cream shop. Kerimkul applied for the loan because he needs money to repair his vehicle. In the future, he wants to purchase a house for his older son. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of convenience goods to increase the turnover of her business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío La Pilca del distrito de Olmos, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a que pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario por los cualen tendrian que dirigirse hacia el pueblo central, que se encuentra muy alejado.

Con el dinero que percibe de este negocio ella ayuda a su esposo a solventar la economía familiar. Diariamente Eugenia se esfuerza por brindar a sus clientes la mejor atención, con esto ella mantiene una clientela estable. Actualmente ella desea adquirir mas mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar su nivel de ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Eugenia es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona de confianza
texts.en:
Eugenia is a 49 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of La Pilca, in the Olmos district, an agricultural district in the Lambayeque province, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She sells staples and groceries from a grocery store located in her own home. The business is well received as it provides clients with a range of basic products that would otherwise require a trip to the main village, which is a long way away. With the money she gets from her business she helps her husband support the family finances. Every day Eugenia strives to provide her customers with the best care, which helps her maintain a stable client base. Now she whould like to buy more merchandise to meet customer demand and increase her sales. To achieve her goal she has requested a loan for 1,500 soles to Edpyme Alternativa. Eugenia is a responsible and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur and give her family a better quality of life. In her neighbourhood those who know her consider her a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to extend grocery store located in owner's home.

loans.name: Nemie

texts.en:
Nemie Cañete is a married woman who lives in Prk. 1, Brgy. San Jose, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a coffee shop, tricycle transport, and buying scrap. Her husband Romeo, who is 51 years old, works as a tricycle driver. They have nine children between eight and 30. 

Nemie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nemie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to buy hollow blocks, cement, and piglets so that she can start something new and continue to save up for the education of her children. Nemie Cañete is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: Arman D.'s main source of income comes from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. He is a 32-year-old single man from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Arman has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Arman joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Arman has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. Arman is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance and improvement of his business. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for the maintenance and improvement of a habal-habal business

loans.name: Maria Clara Da Assuncao

texts.pt:
Maria Clara da Assunção Z. conseguiu comprar todo o material acordado com a Hluvuku e aplicou para o uso planificado no acordo. Conseguiu pagar a sua letra sem nenhuma dificuldade, pois a sua renda ainda tem ajudado bastante no sustento da familia.

A obra de construção da sua casa que esta neste momento na sua fase terminal, com o presente empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt pretende comprar o material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, porta e outros) para concluir a sua casa, oferecendo assim melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.

No futuro pretende solicitar outros empréstimos para o apetrechamento da casa e garantir uma veada melhorada a sua família.
texts.en:
Maria Clara da Assunção Z. bought all of the materials she agreed on with Hluvuku and used them according to plan.  She paid back her debt without any difficulty.  Her income has helped her support her family a lot.

The construction of her home is now in its final phase.  With the current loan of 25,000 meticais, she will buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, a door, etc) to finish it.  This will provide her family with better living conditions.

In the future, she hopes to request other loans to make improvements to her home and to guarantee a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, a door, etc.)

loans.name: Cedrick

texts.es:
CEDRICK D. Z., Trabaja Como Responsable de Ofina en la Universidad Nacional Ingeniería.es padre de familia pero ya no tiene hijos a sucargo ya que estos actualmente no estan con el y son mayores de edad.
el prestamo solicitado es para comprar materiales de construccion para construir una pared de su cuarto
texts.en:
CEDRICK D. Z. works as an office manager at the National Engineering University [Universidad Nacional Ingeniería]. He is a father but no longer has children in his care, since they are grown and no longer live with him. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials to build a wall in his room.

loans.use: Renovating his home by reinforcing and plastering walls in his house, and paying for some family expenses

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 58 años, en compañía de su esposa Isabel, de 56 años; cuidan de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales solo viven con 2 de ellos; Julio, de 17 y Obed, de 14 años. Todos unidos viven en la comunidad de Casacoto. Todas las mañanas Juan organiza las diferentes actividades de casa, mientras que Isabel, tiene que atender a sus pobladores, que va a su pequeño establecimientos y que a primeras horas del día le compran leña. En tanto Juan sale a cuidar de sus animales entre ovinos y vacunos; ya después del almuerzo, se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas, que con tanto esfuerzo pudo adquirir, ahí siembra papa y arveja. Luego de la cosecha de arveja, son comercializados en el mercado central de su localidad y en épocas de campaña de papa, los negociantes le brindan un buen precio de compra. Por ello él, está pensando adquirir más terrenos de cultivo, donde no solo sembrará papa, sino también demás productos que crecen en está zona. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y está  feliz de trabajar con los pobladores de su localidad, donde tomaron la decisión de invertir y progresar juntos. Con el crédito que solicita; podrá adquirir 18 sacos de abono, para su producción de papa de la variedad “canchan”, que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Juan, 58, with his wife, Isabel, 56, watch over their 6 children, just two of whom still live with them: Julio, 17 and Obed, 14.  They all live together in Casacoto.  

Every morning Juan organizes the various household chores while Isabel has to take care of neighbors who come to her small establishment to buy firewood very early in the morning.  Meanwhile, Juan goes out to take care of his cattle and sheep and after lunch goes out to tend to his fields, which he acquired through much effort, where he grows potatoes and peas.  When the peas are harvested they are sold at his community’s central market and during potato season he gets good prices for them from merchants.Because of this he is planning to acquire more fields where he won’t just grow potatoes but also some of the other products that grow in this zone.

This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he is happy to work with residents of his locality who decided to invest and progress together.

He will use the requested loan to buy 18 sacks of manure for his “Canchan” variety of potatoes that he will harvest very soon

loans.use: To buy 18 sacks of manure.

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: Meri tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 12 años vende artículos y químicos de limpieza; su forma de trabajo se basa primero en comprar éstos productos en envases grandes por tonel, al que luego son distribuidos en envases pequeños, logrando así venderlos la unidad pequeña. Siempre esta en búsqueda de clientes, ofreciendo el servicio de limpieza, así como ofreciendo éstos productos de manera ambulante a las amas de casa. Le agrada realizar estas ventas, pues reconoce que tiene mator rentabilidad, además que sus clientes quedan satisfechos por lo eficiente que resulta sus productos. Tiene metas de continuar y crecer en este negocio. Es el crédito número 11 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de éstos productos, de esa manera incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Meri is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. For more than twelve years she has been selling cleaning supplies and chemicals. Her products come in large barrels and she packages them in individual containers so that they can be sold in smaller units. Meri is always looking for customers to offer cleaning products since she sells her goods to housewives as a traveling merchant. She enjoys making sales because she knows this type of work is profitable. Her customers are satisfied since they have discovered that her products have made cleaning house more efficient. Meri has goals to continue and grow her business.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. She is pleased to know that she has financial backing. Meri also appreciates being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are people she knows who are responsible and supportive. She thanks those individuals who approved her loan request since the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of more cleaning products so that she can increase her operating capital.

loans.use: Purchase more cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Emma Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Emma tiene su negocio que es un cafetín, hace más de 40 años que tiene este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo y buena administración ha mantenido. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su actividad esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues se siente muy contenta ya que se acerca una buena temporada. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, pan, gaseosas, juegos, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Emma has had her food stand business for more than 40 years, and she's maintained it with hard work and good administration. She's a tenacious person who enjoys her work. This isn't the first time she's taken out a loan, and she feels very happy because a good season is coming. The loan is for the purchase of merchandise such as candy, sodas, bread, and juice, among other things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Sosthene

texts.en: Sosthene is 29 years old, married and has three children. He and his family live in Muhura, which is near the town of Byumba, where he makes a living selling products such as rice, sorghum and beans. He has been in this line of work for four years, and runs his business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. weekdays. He has two employees working for him, and has applied for this loan from Kiva and Vision Finance Company to expand his business by buying more products to sell. His goal is to increase his profits and begin selling a wider range of products in wholesale markets.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to his customers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel T., 30, is single, a college graduate and lives in Parola, a part of Tondo that is a district of Manila. She is an entrepreneur with a knack for multitasking who is accomplished in establishing businesses. Her training with CCT as a community partner has enabled her to be successful in business.

Being in the direct-sales business, Maribel has developed the skill to choose quality products and deal with people in the neighborhood so as to turn them into regular customers. She sells shirts, pants, bags, shoes, cosmetics, fashion accessories and jewelry that suit the tastes of her friends and business connections. She earns an income by availing herself of discounts from product catalogs and then selling these items at their regular price to her customers. At the end of the month, she is able to earn a minimum net income of around 10,000 PHP.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to purchase items ordered in advance by her customers. She will also purchase items that are usually ordered by her patrons so that she will be ready to offer them to her clients. By doing this, Maribel believes that she will be able to increase her earning capacity as a micro-entrepreneur.

Sure enough, Maribel does have her share of customers who do not pay on time. Nevertheless, she still prays that she will be able to collect their payments. She dreams of having her house renovated soon and that her business will continue to flourish so she can be of help to her family and relatives.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans. As a CCT community partner, Maribel faithfully attends CCT’s weekly fellowship meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

loans.use: To purchase items ordered in advance by her customers

loans.name: Fresia María

texts.es: La Sra. Fresia María S. A. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa  Ministerio de Educación desempeñándose como Docente de Educación  Primaria  tiene veinte y seis  años  de trabajar para esta institución, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para implementar un pequeño negocio en su hogar el cual es el engorde y destace de cerdo, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Fresia María S. A. is an active employee of the Ministry of Education, where she has worked as an elementary school teacher for 26 years. She has one child who is in school. Fresia has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items so that she could improve her home.

This loan she is requesting will be used to start a small business in her home where she can fatten and butcher pigs. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit since they have enabled her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Start a home-based business fattening & butchering pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en: Tumenbayar, 26, is married and lives with his wife and a son in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife is taking care of their son by taking a break from her college studies. He has been operating a photography and printing studio for the last four years. He rents a studio located near a main road, which is an advantage for him to operate a successful business. He has initiative and is a hardworking person who says, "I want to expand my business and buy an apartment where we can have a comfortable life in the future". He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a printing machine for his business.

loans.use: to buy a printer

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 3 Group

texts.en:
Clisiana is a 40-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Desarrollo (Women in Development) 3, and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Clisiana and her fellow borrowers live in a Batey. Bateyes are small, rural communities built by sugar companies for their field workers. They are isolated, have no running water, and have unreliable electricity at best. Clisiana lives with her long-term partner and she has 4 children.

Clisiana runs a successful eatery which serves traditional Dominican foods (rice and beans, plantains, stewed chicken and beef) and also a Colmado (small food-grocery store). Clisiana says that she really enjoys working and loves the loans she has received from Esperanza. This is her 8th loan. After 4 years she decided to join this group.

She has a perfect repayment record so far and hopes to continue using the financial services available to her. Thank you for lending to Clisiana and the Mujeres en Desarrollo group 3!

loans.use: to buy stock such as rice, beans, canned meals, snacks and vegetables

loans.name: Ayda Celeste

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ayda, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo es taxista. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha podido financiar su negocio.

Ella además de atender su hogar y a su esposo también se dedica a la elaboración de productos y manualidades hechos en fomix, nos cuenta que le hacen muchos pedidos  más que todo para fiestas infantiles. A ella le encanta lo que hace ya que con sus obras hace feliz a muchos niños, comenta. Trabaja todos los días por varias horas y cuando tiene muchos pedidos casi todo el dia, lleva 9 años dedicada a esta labor que le ha traído muchos beneficios económicos y espirituales.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales para elaborar sus manualidades (artículos para fiestas), ella necesita fomix, pinturas, cartulina, pegamentos, entre otras cosas que utiliza.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Ayda in this place. She is 54 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Ayda has been with the Communal Bank almost since the beginning. She enjoys being a member because of the loans that have helped to finance her business.

In addition to taking care of her home and her husband, Ayda manufactures products and crafts made of foam. She says that she receives many orders for children’s parties. Ayda enjoys her job because many children have said how happy they are with her work. She works every day for several hours. When she has several orders, Ayda works for almost the entire day. She has been in this business for nine years and it has brought her many financial and spiritual benefits.

This loan will be used to buy materials for making crafts (party favors). She needs craft foam, paints, construction paper, adhesives, and other items. Her wish is that she and her husband have good health.

loans.use: To purchase craft foam, paints, construction paper, adhesives, and other items.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon S., age 51, is pictured with her husband under their roof. To earn a living, Suon S. cultivates a rice crop on her existing farmland. The family typically generates a revenue of US$ 2 each day and have been in their business for years. They have five kids, three of whom are single and the other two are married. Two of their children already work in different jobs to earn income. After heavy rain, this is the good time for growing crops, but Suon S. is still not planting crops yet. She hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik J. lives in Tsovagyugh village, Gegharkunik Marz, with her parents and brother, who is a student at Yerevan.
  
Knarik works at the village school as a German teacher.  At the same time, she is also engaged in farming to earn additional income. On her farm she has cows, calves and chickens, which she raises with help from family members.  They also grow oats.  Thanks to this farming income, Knarik’s family can meet their needs and pay for Knarik’s brother's education. 

Knarik is seeking a loan for 1,000,000 AMD to increase her farming livestock and to buy oat seedlings.

loans.use: To buy more livestock and oat seedlings

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag is 41-year-old widower who lives with his only son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Ganhuyag was married in 2008 and has a boy who is 2 years old now. Unfortunately, his wife died a few years ago because of the deep sickness. 

After his wife's death Ganhuyag began operating a construction materials trading business in order to feed his boy. He started this business in 2010. Previously, he had worked as an accountant for several years. Therefore his accounting skills helped him to expand and develop his business operation. Now he has many regular customers and is planning to continue his business in the future. He is an honest man who says, "I always seek for new opportunities in my business." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es un padre de familia de 53 años  de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia y no cuenta con  servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

Rogelio se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón y mango; una vez que se da la cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona, tambien cría ganadoovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, sus corrales están en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con pastos y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo óptimo los comercializa a sus clientes.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón y para el pago de mano de obra para el deshierbo y poda de sus plantas, con la idea de mejorar la producción .  Rogelio es una persona  responsable y trabajadora que lo único que quiere es darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a 53 year old father who lives with his wife and son in their own house that doesn't have basic services.  They live in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  The residents in this district work in agriculture, ranching and crafts.  

Rogelio has worked in agriculture for some time.  He has his own land where he grows lemons and mangoes.  After harvesting he sells his products in the markets in his area.  He also raises sheep and poultry.  The pens are located in the back part of his house.  He feeds them natural grains and grasses and when they reach the optimal size he sells them to his customers.  

He has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternative to purchase fertilizers to amend the soil and ensure that he will have a good lemon production.  It will also pay for the labor to weed and prune his trees with the intent of improving production.  Rogelio is a responsible and hard-working person and the only thing that he wants is to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer to amend the soil and to pay for labor to weed and prune his trees.

loans.name: Ludio

texts.es:
Ludio tiene 36 años, está casado con la señora Agustina de 29 años de edad. 
El Sr. Ludio comenzó desde muy joven a trabajar en el ámbito comercial, comprando y vendiendo todo tipo de articulos como comestibles, ropas, es decir, todo lo que pueda para ofrecer mas variedad a la clientela y asi atraerlos hacia su negocio y así conseguir una mayor convocatoria de clientes.
El mismo comenta que comenzó con un negocio pequeño pero que al trascurrir el tiempo y gracias a su esfuerzo y la de su familia logró crecer bastante en dicha profesión.
Gracias a su trabajo  y dedicación logra brindar a su familia las comodidades esenciales para que vivan dignamente y no les falte el pan de cada día. 
Solicita el crédito para la obtencion de más mercaderias para seguir ampliando el stock de sus mercaderias.
texts.en:
Ludio is 36 years old.  He is married to 29 year-old Agustina.

Ludio started out working in commerce when he was very young, buying and selling all kinds of goods such as food and clothes.  That is to say, he sold everything he could, so that he could offer a good variety of goods to his customers and attract more customers to his business so that he could build his customer base.

Ludio tells us that he started out with a small business but, over time and thanks to his efforts and those of his family, he has managed to grow quite a lot in his business.

Thanks to his work and commitment, Ludio manages to provide his family with all the essential comforts they need to live decently and not lack any essentials.  He is requesting this loan to obtain more goods, so that he can continue expanding his stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy goods to expand his stock of merchandise (food, drinks, canned goods, etc.)

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 42 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Ahí vive en compañía de Norma, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en una casa alquilada. Su vida es ejemplo de progreso; cuando era muy joven comenzó su camino en la agricultura trabajando como peón en diferentes terrenos de cultivo, ahí juntó el dinero necesario para comenzar a sembrar, ahora trabaja sobre terrenos agrícolas arrendados. Sabe que le falta mucho para poder comprar uno propio, pero eso no lo desanima, pero no deja de sembrar sobre 5 hectáreas de tierra donde esparce semilla de espinaca, zanahoria y demás hortalizas. Ya  tiene 10 años de experiencia en este rubro y lo que más le gusta es ver como sus cultivos crecen día a día. Pero según menciona en tiempos de gran cosecha, contrata peones para que le puedan ayudar a terminar la cosecha y así viajar a la ciudad de Lima, donde vende su producción. Le va muy bien en la agricultura, ya que posee terrenos cerca del río, por lo que puede sembrar en cualquier estación del año. Por eso está planeando comprar un auto para poder trasportar su cosecha. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Rolando de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Rolando is 42 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo. He lives together with Norma, who has been his wife for 20 years. Together they have 5 children, but they live with only 3 of them in a rented house. His life is an example of progress; when he was very young, he started his path in agriculture working as a laborer on various farms. In this way, he saved up the money he needed to begin planting, and now he works on rented agricultural lands. He knows that he still has a long way to go to buy his own farm, but this does not discourage him. He continuously plants 5 hectares of land, where he sows seeds for spinach, carrots and other vegetables. He has 10 years of experience in this field, and what he enjoys most is seeing how his crops grow day by day. He also mentions that in the heaviest harvest times, he contracts laborers so that they can help him finish the harvest, and then he travels to the city of Lima where he sells his produce. Farming is going very well for him, since he has lands near the river, so that he can plant in any season of the year. For this reason, he is planning to buy a car so that he can transport his harvest. He belongs to the “Virgen María” communal bank, and this is his first loan with MFP. He is looking forward to this collaboration so that he can continue working toward his objectives. Upon receiving this support, Rolando will invest the funds he is requesting in buying 3 bags of pea seeds for the next planting.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco comunal Siempre Viva, tiene 53 años y vive con su esposo, el menor de sus 5 hijos obtendrá su título en ingeniería civil a fines de este año. Rosa solicita un préstamo para su negocio de productos naturales. Rosa vende de casa a casa y tiene clientes en varias oficinas. Ella lleva tres años en este negocio. Al comienzo su esposo no quería que trabajara independientemente, pero ahora ya esta conforme con la idea.  Rosa lleva dos años en FINCA Peru y lo que mas le gusta es la responsabilidad y la confianza de la organización.  Desde que esta con FINCA Peru ella es una persona mas extrovertida e independiente. Rosa está ahorrando para poder alquilar una tienda y vender desde una oficina, en vez de cliente a cliente.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Siempre Viva" community bank.  She is 53 years old and lives with her husband.  The youngest of her five children will receive his degree in civil engineering at the end of this year.  Rosa is requesting a loan for her natural products business.  She makes her sales door to door and also has customers in several offices.  She has been in this business for three years.

At first, Rosa's husband didn't want her to work independently but now he is happy with the idea.  Rosa has been with FINCA Peru for two years and what she most likes is the responsibility and the trust of the organization.  Since she has been with FINCA Peru, Rosa has become a more extroverted and independent person.  She is saving up to rent a store so that she can sell from an office instead of having to sell from customer to customer.

loans.use: to buy natural products wholesale

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru:
Уулкан – 46-летняя фермерша, живущая в селе Боз – Караган. Замужем, вырастила семерых детей, младшей их которых 17 лет.  Уулкан традиционно занимается животноводством, так как семья в  фермерстве уже несколько поколений. На данный момент в хозяйстве Уулкан – 2 коровы, 15 баранов и 3 лошади.  В летний период такое хозяйство позволяет Уулкан получать прибыль в сумме  приблизительно 18,000 сом (KGS)от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она намерена закупить 12 телят и отправить скот на летний выпас в горную местность.  В будущем, Уулкан планирует развивать  и расширять свой бизнес. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Uulkan is a 46-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Boz - Karagan. She is married and has raised seven children, the youngest of whom is 17 years old. Uulkan's work in animal husbandry is a tradition, since her family has been farming for several generations. Now on her small farm, Uulkan has two cows, fifteen sheep and three horses. In summer, Uulkan makes about 18,000 Som (KGS) from selling meat and dairy products. 

In order to further expand her business, Uulkan contacted Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS). With the money, she intends to purchase twelve calves and cattle to send to summer grazing in the highlands. In the future, Uulkan plans to develop and expand her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 17 Group

texts.en: Hermawaty is part of the Usaha Jaya 17 group.  She is 30 years old and has two children. In June of 2007, she started to sell clothes by credit to her neighbours. Usually they pay Hermawati two or three times. The business is going well and she can help her husband pay for school fees. This is her second time borrowing from VF Indonesia. She has asked for 1.500.000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for Moslem clothes. Because at the end of this month is a big day, Idul Fitri, she believes she can increase her sales. In the future, she wants to open a kiosk in Pasar Koja.

loans.use: To pay for moslem clothes.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married to Emily and they have two children aged eighteen and fifteen years.

He has been in the green grocery business for nine years. He sells cereals like beans and maize, and local vegetables, making a monthly profit of KES 22,450. This is his third loan, and he has borrowed KES 60,000. He shall use the loan to buy more grocery stock and sell wholesale.

With the anticipated profits, he shall open a general shop. His dreams are to provide for further education for his children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stock to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther operates a provisions shop where she sells soaps, pampers, drinks, milk, toothpaste, and other items as seen in the shop at Krofofordo. She is married, and as part of her responsibilities towards the home she feeds the household. Her loan will be used to buy provisions for retail sales. She hopes to use the new revenue from her business to save towards the education of her unborn children.

loans.use: to buy provisions for retail sales.

loans.name: Sharifajon

texts.ru: Шарифа женщина предприниматель со стажем, она занимается куплей и продажей более 8 лет. Начала бизнес Шарифа с купли продажи бытовой техники. После того, как работа стала прибыльной, она открыла магазин детской одежды. В магазине Шарифа, кроме детской одежды, продает промтовары. Этим бизнесом она занимается вместе с сестрой. Шарифа вдова имеет дочь, которую выдала замуж. Дочь тоже помогает ей. Шарифе нужны средства для покупки детских колясок  и велосипедов.
texts.en: Sharifajon is a seasoned entrepreneur, she has been working in retail for the last eight years. She started her business by selling appliances, then, as the store became profitable, Sharifajon opened a children clothing store. In her store Sharifajon sells not only clothes but also school supplies and toys. She manages her business together with her sister. Sharifajon is a widow and has a married daughter, who also helps out in the store. Sharifajon would like to take out this loan to buy strollers and children's bikes for the store.

loans.use: to purchase strollers and children's bicycles

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Irish has a shop that sells vegetables and spices like onions, garlic and spring onions. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables for resale.

Irish has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Irish hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es chofer; trabaja en un radio taxi de una empresa de radio taxis de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra un tanque de gas y hacer cambiar las llantas de su movilidad, pues esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en  casa de sus padres la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Villa Armonía de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un  hijo. Juan es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006 con un historial de pagos impecable. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a chauffeur. He drives a vehicle for a radio taxi company in the city of La Paz. His wife takes care of the household chores. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a gas tank and to replace the tires on his vehicle. This business activity is the source of income by which he is able to cover his expenses. Juan lives at the home of parents in the District of Villa Armonia in the city of La Paz. He is married and has one child.

Juan has been a client of IMPRO since 2006 and has an impeccable payment history. This is the second time his loan is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires and a gas tank for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mario Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr Mario está casado, es policía de tránsito, tiene 2 hijos es. El es propietario de una despensa la que es atendida por su esposa. Cuenta con 9 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela, lo que a la vez le genera muy buenos ingresos. 
Dice que el no se cansa de trabajar, ya que todo su esfuerzo es por darle lo mejor a su familia. Quiere que el día de mañana sus hijos sean personas de bien, y sean utiles no solo a ellos mismos sino también a la sociedad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de los productos esenciales para su despensa, como ser enlatados, azúcar por bolsas, harina, cárnico y demás. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sr Mario is married and is a traffic policeman. He has 2 children. He owns a store that is run by his wife. He has been in the business for 9 years which means he has a good and loyal client base which generates a very good income. 

He says that he never tires of working as his every effort is to provide his family with the best. In the future he wants his children to be good people as well as useful not only for themselves but also for society.

He is asking for the loan to buy essential products for his store such as canned goods, bags of sugar, flour, meat products and other products. He is thankful to the Fundacion for the opportunity it is giving him.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bags of sugar. flour, and  meat products as well as other products.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a humble agriculturist and hard-working father. He is a widower and lives with his only child. His hopes to improve their living conditions and support his only child's education.

Robert has been planting corn for almost 15 years. According to him, the greatest challenge he faces today is that he doesn't have the financial resources to purchase farm supplies. He is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000. Robert said this would help him maintain and improve the farmland he cultivates. He believes and hopes that he can overcome all his hardships in life and that his child can earn a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for his corn farming business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is from Sagarejo, East Georgia. He is 33 years old, married, and lives with his family: wife Nona, and three children (12-year-old son and 10- and 3-year-old daughters). Alex works in a local factory that produces bricks. His monthly salary depends on the number of bricks produced by the factory. The bigger part of the family’s income comes from a small family dairy farm. They have three milk cows. Nona produces yogurt and cheese, which they sell. Their total average monthly income is 600 GEL. 

Alex requested credit for purchasing three calves. He will grow the calves and will expand the dairy farm. In a year Alex will already have six milk cows. Thus, the family will be able to produce and sell more dairy products. As a result, the income of the family will significantly increase. Alex and Nona will be able to create better living conditions for their three children.

loans.use: to purchase calves for expansion of the dairy farm

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with 8 school going children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Hadija has operated as a farmer for the past 13 years. Her potential clients are café owners. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Hadija she wants to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. She decided to join Yehu because it has fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe DANAYA sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  AOUA au milieu en position debout fait le commerce d’ignames.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 400 Kg  d’ignames qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Médine à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of  Danaya Group are mainly married women, who average 35 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in  HAMDALLAYE, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

The members of the group are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand.

Mrs. AOUA, standing in the center in the photograph, is selling yams. She intends to user her loan to buy 400 kg of yams, that she will retail for cash at the Médine market in Sikasso, as well as at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 12'000 (ca US$ 24), to be used in part to repay the loan and its interests, and in part to be put away.

loans.use: to buy 400 kg of yams

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” el cual pertenece al poblado de Rayanniyoc situado en la provincia de Pisac, departamento Cusco.

La socia Virginia;  tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales esta con el hijo de 18 años de edad; la socia tiene su negocio de compra y venta de cereales la socia vende productos como trawi, quinua, trigo, la socia también se dedica la  crianza de animales menores, la socia tiene cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, ovejas y ganados, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de tarwi, trigo y otros cereale spara venderlos en Cusco. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de cereales como trigo, tarwi.
