La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el tiempo establecido segun el cronograma y agradece a los que hacen posible este prestamo.
texts.en:
This member belongs to “Villa Rayanniyoc” Community Bank in Rayanniyoc town, Pisac province, department of Cusco.

Virginia is a 48 year-old married woman. She has four children and lives with one of them, aged 18. She has a business for selling and buying cereals such as trawi, quinoa and wheat. She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs, sheep and cows. Virginia wants to invest this loan in the purchase of tarwi, wheat and other cereals for selling them in Cusco. 

She promises to make her repayments on time according to schedule and is thankful to her loaners.

loans.use: purchasing cereals such as wheat and tarwi.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de repuestos de máquina, tipo soldaduras y suministros electricos la socia desea ene sta ocasión invertir el prestamo en la compra de soldaduras y de suministros electricos para vender a sus clientes los mecanicos, a personas que venden maquinarias como molineros. La socia desea seguri prosperando para terminar de construir su vivienda y educar a sus hijos y crecer economicamente. La socia desea invertir en la compra de maquinarias como soldadoras, suministros varios para vender.
texts.en:
The member is Mrs. Felicitas who continues with her business selling spare parts for machinery, such as welding tools, and electric supplies.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy welding tools and electric supplies to sell to her mechanical customers, and people who sell food mill machines.  She wants to continue earning a good income to finish building her house, giver her children an education and grow economically.  

She plans to buy welding tood and other supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy welding tools and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра трудолюбивая добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Муж является рабочим. Более 13 лет она занимается купле- продажей скота на скотном рынке. Она откармливает их в течении 3- 4 недель, а затем продает их за выгодную цену. Сайёра запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса и улучшения благосостоянии семьи.
texts.en: Sayora is a hardworking, kind and goal-oriented woman.  She is married and is raising three children.  Her husband is a worker.  Sayora has been involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market for over 13 years.  She fattens up livestock for 3-4 weeks and then sells it at a profitable price.  Sayora is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase livestock in order to expand her business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma, 45 years old, is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 10 to 20 years. He describes himself as a focused man. Juma operates a farm where he sells produce such as cabbages, tomatoes, etc. He has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 3 people. Juma's business is located in a very productive area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road networks, making it difficult to distribute farm produce to his customers. Juma will use this KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for his family members to use for lighting.

This is Juma's fifth loan with SMEP DTM. His business goal is to increase farm production within 5 years. He hopes, in the future, to introduce modern farming techniques to his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business, selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling kitchen wares and ready-to-wear clothes. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF, to buy additional empty three-gallon bottles, which she will refill with purified drinking water to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional empty three-gallon bottles, which she will refill with purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Graciano

texts.es:
El socio Graciano se dedica al negocio de construccion,el socio hace trabajos como pintados de casa y construcciones,el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo quiere sacar adelante a su familia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas como pinturas y brochas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Graciano works in construction. He provides house painting and construction services. He is a hard-working person, who wants to provide for his family through his work. 

He is requesting a loan to buy tools such as paints and paintbrushes.

He is happy for the loan and is committed to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools such as paints and paintbrushes.

loans.name: Ldyia

texts.en: Ldyia is married with two children. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop . She works in her shop seven days a week . Her major business challenges include high transportation costs.  She has applied for a loan  from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, flour, boxes of soap, cooking oil, beans, and rice. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent,food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, flour, boxes of soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shaving equipment.

loans.name: Tuloto

texts.en:
Tuloto is married and lives with her husband and 5 children in the village of Aele-Fou where peanut farming is one of the oldest trades.  She and her husband do not currently earn enough to feed, school and clothe their children.

She set up a small business in a field that she has experience in (peanut farming), in order to improve her family's standard of living.  She loves her children dearly and wants to give them something to live for when they grow older.  All her efforts are for her children's future.

She is applying for a loan of $650 from the SPBDF to purchase peanut seeds and fertilizer to start her own business.

loans.use: Buy bags of peanut seeds and fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Safie

texts.en: Safie lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her children because she is widow whose husband died in sickness. Now she is supporting her family. She is uneducated and she is a carpenter. She works with all the members of her family in her house. She wants to take a group loan to buy new carpentry tools and all the equipment that she needs to expand her business and make a better life for her family. She is very happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new carpentry tools

loans.name: Damla Marie

texts.fr:
Miss Damla Marie L., 24, had to leave school and began to support herself by running a little general store. A hard worker, she manages her little store competently, earning in a small income from it.

She does not have enough money to expand her shelves, so she is asking for a loan of $300 that will allow her to maintain a more consistent inventory and thus satisfy the needs of her customers. This will permit her to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 24 ans, Mlle L. Damla Marie a abandonnée ses études et s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits de premières nécessités afin de subvenir à ses besoins. Très dévouée elle arrive à bien gérer son commerce ce qui lui procure le minimum de revenu.

Ses moyens sont insuffisants pour augmenter la taille de son étalage, elle sollicite un appui financier de $300 pour s’approvisionner et avoir un stock plus consistant afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: increase her inventory for her general store

loans.name: Valasi

texts.en: Ms Valasi is a young lady of twenty four years of age; she has just finished school but has no job. She decided to take frying pancakes as her business, which will be easy to achieve as it was one of her experiences from her home economics class in school. She used all her 1st loan of $300 to buy the ingredients needed for this particular business and she hopes that this will help her to get some money for her personal needs and for paying her weekly repayments. She is very happy with the program and wishes to get another loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the business

loans.name: Justina Eustaquia

texts.es:
Justina is a loving and hard-working mother of three small children and for four years she has been selling Andean products (potato starch, quinoa, potatoes and barley) in a very popular market in Juliaca, the city where she lives. The business generates an acceptable amount of money and allows her to cover the basic needs of her household.

She begins to sell her products every day at 7:00am and finishes at 5:00pm, six days a week, working every day to give her children a higher quality of life and, most importantly, education so that in the future they can grow to be men that are useful in their communities.

In order to achieve these goals she would like to increase the quantity of merchandise and in this way increase her income. For this reason she is asking for a loan that she will invest in her business, which she promises to repay in no more than six months.

“She will keep working hard, but without your help she will not be able to achieve her goals, and for this reason she hopes for your generous support.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Justina es una amorosa y trabajadora madre de tres pequeños niños y hace más de cuatro años se dedica a la comercialización de productos andinos (chuño, quinua, papa y cebada), en un mercado muy popular de la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, negocio que le genera ingresos económicos aceptables y le permite cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Ella empieza diariamente a ofrecer sus productos desde las 7:00 de la mañana y culmina a las 5:00 de la tarde durante 6 días a la semana y se esfuerza día a día con el propósito de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños y sobre todo educación para que en el futuro se desenvuelvan como hombres de bien útiles a su comunidad.

Para lograr sus objetivos desea aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y así obtener mayor beneficio económico, para esto solicita un préstamo que invertirá en su negocio y promete reembolsar el dinero en un lapso no mayor a seis meses.

“Seguirá trabajando arduamente, pero sin tu ayuda no podrá cumplir sus metas, por eso espera tu generoso apoyo”

loans.use: Obtain a greater quantity and quality of products to sell in the different markets of her beautiful city.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Beatriz B., holder of Passport No. AB 226509, 38 years of age and a resident of the Laulane / 3 de fevereiro neighborhood, is married with 1 child and lives in her own home. She will begin the program by borrowing 6,000 MT to be repaid in 6 months. She sells clothing and is a traveling saleswoman. She plans to use the loan to invest in the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz B., portadora do passapot nº AB 226509, de 38 anos de idade residente no bairro Laulane / 3 de fevereiro, casada e tem 1 filho casa propria esta a iniciar no programa, vai tomar 6000 para pagar em 6 meses ,vende Roupas é vendedora ambulante e com o valor que vai tomar pretende Investir no negocio

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde A. sells clothes- all types of clothes, but mainly junior and kids clothes on foot. She is one of the bulk salespeople in the area, buying and selling by the dozen. To date, she totals 6 months of work in this trade, making trips to Oruro, Potosí, and on occasion, all of the interior to buy merchandise to sell. Clotilde is in need of capital in order to increase and improve her sales, with the goal of bettering her income and be able to establish a retail shop which will be an important tool for end of the year sales.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Clotilde A., se dedica a la venta de ropa, todo tipo de ropa, pero principalmente ropa juvenil y ropa para niños de forma ambulante, es una de las mayoristas de la zona, comprando y vendiendo por docena En la actualidad ya suman 6 meses de trabajo en el rubro realizando viajes tanto a Oruro, Potosí, y en ocasiones a todo el interior para poder comprar la mercadería para la venta. Clotilde precisa de capital para poder incrementar y mejorar su mercadería, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y poder instalar su puesto de venta, que será una herramienta importante para la venta de fin de año.

loans.use: Clotilde is in need of capital in order to increase and improve her sales, with the goal of bettering her income and be able to establish a retail shop which will be an important tool for end of the year sales.

loans.name: Kyaliwajala C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane A.. She runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to increase stock. Jane is 42 years old and a single mother of three children ranging in age from 15 to 22. Her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to finish her residential house, which is under construction. Jane has received a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600,000 to invest in the retail store business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Dorothy T., Jane N., Grace N., and Rose N.. Dorothy T. and Jane N. sell clothes and are requesting loans of UGX 800,000 and UGX 400,000 to add to their stock and expend their clothing businesses. Grace N. rears poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more chicks. Rose N. runs a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To increase her store's stock

loans.name: Iraq's Tujitume. Group

texts.en:
Iraq is 27 years old and is a single woman with a four-year-old child. Iraq began selling clothes and ice cream in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales. Iraq now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwajuma, Anna, and Fatuma.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Koffi K. is 34 years old and is the married father of one child. He owns a photocopying and typing services business in Adèta, a medium-sized town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. As most people in his area do not own computers or copy machines or know how to type, his services are often in demand and keep him very busy.

With this loan, Koffi hopes to buy another photocopy machine, as his current one can barely keep up with his workload. He also wishes to buy a few reams of paper. Koffi hopes that with this loan he will be able to satisfy the demands of his customers and to use the revenue from his business to pay for his child’s schooling.

loans.use: To buy paper and a new photocopy machine

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.en:
Porfirio Nunez Carmona is married to Sinforosa Riquelme, and they live in Horqueta. The couple has 13 sons, but only 3 of them are under Porfirio and Sinforosa’s care; the rest are economically independent.

Porfirio works as director in construction. With the income generated by this job, he was able to raise and educate 13 children.

In 2006 Porfirio became a client of Fundacion Paraguaya since he formed a committee of entrepreneuring men. Because of his punctual repayments in previous loans, Porfirio is considered a very trustworthy costumer by Fundacion Paraguaya.

The money provided by the credit will be used in the purchase of raw materials and tools for construction.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials and tools for construction

loans.name: Wellinton

texts.es:
Wellinton is a selfless father and a loving husband who sacrifices himself daily in order to ensure his small daughter and dear wife’s well-being. With the aim of acquiring the medicine necessary for the well-being of Delia – he toils daily in his fields, and even more so when the time for harvesting arrives as the swift gathering of his crops guarantees their immediate sale. He has ambitions to improve his work and produce with better tools, manures and fertilizers.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Wellinton, es un abnegado padre y un amoroso esposo dispuesto a sacrificarse diariamente para procurarle bienestar a su pequeña hija a su querida esposa. Con el deseo de adquirir el medicamento necesario para el bienestar de Delia, se esfuerza a diario en sus campos de cultivo y aún más cuando llega la época de cosecha ya que el recojo oportuno de sus productos le garantizan la venta inmediata. Tiene deseos de mejorar su ocupación y productos con mejores herramientas y abonos y fertilizantes naturales.

loans.use: Purchase of tools, manure, fertilizers etc. to improve his production.

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en: Tauva A., 55, is married with 1 child.  She has 3 years of experience in her general store business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Tauva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She also has a plantation business which helps as a back up to her general store.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella is very hard-working with a wish to improve; she is a mother of 2 children, 10 and 13 years old. Since she was a girl she has raised cattle for a living, obtaining the necessary income; she buys, fattens and sells her cattle at an increased price, this is the routine of her work. She is also an excellent farmer, she grows corn, barley, wheat, and “quinua” and at the harvest season she herself sells her products at the local market. Estrella is a single mother, the only support of her children. On this occasion she requests a loan to be invested in the purchase of a bull.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Estrella es muy trabajadora, con deseos de superación, es madre de 2 niños de 10 y 13 años. Desde niña se dedicó a la crianza de animales, los que le permiten obtener las ganancias que ella necesita, compra, engorda y luego vende su ganado a un mayor precio, esa es su rutina de su trabajo, también es una excelente agricultora, cultiva maíz, cebada, trigo y quinua, cuando sea la época de cosecha ella misma lleva a vender sus productos a la feria local. Estrella es madre soltera, es el único sustento que tiene sus hijos, en esta ocasión solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de un toro.

loans.use: Purchase a bull to increase livestock.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 32 years old, divorced, and lives with her children: Dennis-8 and Rocio-3. She is a strong and hard working woman. She is dedicated to elaborate handcraft knits at home where she has a knitting machine. Since she separated from her husband, work has been tougher for her because she doesn't count with her partner's support anymore. That is why today she is busy all day knitting clothing pieces like: gloves, caps, bags, crochet purses, and sweaters which in turn she sells at the capital city of Lima. The business is good but very sacrificed. To provide her customers, she has to knit all day. She only rests on Sundays, the only day of the week that she can share with her family full time. Norma wants to see her children live with all the comforts and growing with a good education. With the loan money, she will buy more material to make more clothing pieces so in the future, she can export her goods abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Norma tiene 32 años, es divorciada, vive con sus hijos, Dennis de 8 y Rocio de 3. Es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora, se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos artesanales en su casa, donde cuenta con una máquina de tejer.Desde que se separó de su esposo el trabajo se le ha hecho más duro, ya que ya no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja.Es así, que ahora se ocupa durante todo el día en tejer prendas como guantes, gorros, bolsas, carteras a crochet y chompas, las que vende en la ciudad capital Lima.El negocio es bueno, pero sacrificado, para abastecer a sus clientes debe tejer todo el día, solo descansa los días domingos, día en el cual puede compartir a tiempo completo con su familia. Norma quiere ver a sus pequeños viviendo con todas las comodidades y crecer con una buena educación. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor material para confeccionar más prendas de vestir, para que en el futuro pueda exportar al extranjero.

loans.use: Buying material for making clothing pieces.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal was born in 1979. He is married and has one child. He has been in this business for 10 years. He lives in Baku city. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the necessary things for improving his barber shop business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Julia Olimpia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 42 años de edad, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en la calle 9 MZ. 1 Lote 3, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Desde hace 1 año viene trabajando en la venta de abarrotes, negocio que está ubicado en su domicilio. Todas las mañanas abre sus puertas para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Con este préstamo de S/.300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará productos como 1 saco de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 5 bolsas de golosinas y 2 cajas de atún. Esta inversión le permitirá surtir el negocio.
A pesar de ser madre soltera con un hijo sigue hacia adelante con su negocio y sueña con hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Julia is 42 years old and is a member of the Fighting Women of Yungay Community Bank. She lives on 9 MZ Street, Lot 3 in the district and province of Yungay, Ancash. For one year, she has sold groceries. This business is located in her home. Every morning, she opens her doors to offer the best service to her clients. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy products, including 1 sack of rice, 3 sacks of sugar, 5 bags of sweets, and 2 boxes of tuna. This investment will allow her to supply her business. Despite being a single mother with a son, she continues going forward with her business and dreams of making it grow.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, bags of sweets, and tuna

loans.name: Azar

texts.en:
Born in 1973, Azar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in Absheron region. He is married with two children. 

Four years ago, he started a business transporting goods with his car. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 60 years old and she is a widow with 9 children. She sells plantains wholesale and retail to her customers. She started this business in 1992. She needs the loan of N50,000 to purchase more plantains to sell.  She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase plantains to sell

loans.name: Abdurakhmon

texts.ru: Асуев Абдурахмон житель Вахшского района. Живет в одном из самых дальних кишлаков района. Единственная сфера деятельности населения это животноводство. Поэтому и он , имея четверых детей занимается животноводством.Имеет небольшое хозяйство . Планируемый кредит , хочет использовать для того, чтобы закупить материал для ремонта коровника. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdurakhmon A. resides in the Vakhsh region, in one of the region's remotest villages. Animal husbandry is the only way the residents have of making a living. Since Abdurakhmon has four children, he raises livestock and has a small farm. He plans to use the loan he has requested to purchase materials to repair his cowshed. He will repay the loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his cowshed

loans.name: Narcisa Idelsa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa Idelsa M. D. O., pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, del distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
La señora Narcisa tiene una bodega pero se dedica más que todo  a la compra venta D. quesillo  y a la compra D. ganado porcino para venderlo en carne, los animales y el quesillo los consigue en el mismo distrito D. Mache. Embala los quesillos y la carne y los envía para ser  vendidos en los mercados D. Trujillo, debido a que así conseguirá mejores precios.
Otra forma que ella usa para mejorar su negocio es comprando los cerdos pequeños, los cría hasta lograr un tamaño considerable y un peso razonable como para poder ser vendidos en carne. 
Narcisa Idelsa tiene 5 hijos que siempre le ayudaron en su negocio  pero actualmente ya los cinco tienen sus propios compromisos, solamente viven ella y su esposo.
 Con su primer crédito  D. 300 soles que canceló en cuatro cuotas,  implementó su bodega con artículos D. librería.
texts.en:
Narcisa Idelsa M. D. O. belongs to the "Mujeres con Futuro" Communal Bank of the Mache district, province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad, Perú. Narcisa has a small store but she works more than anything in the buying and selling of cheese and the purchase of pigs to sell their meat. She gets the animals and the cheese in the same district of Mache. She packages the cheeses and the meat and she sends them to be sold in the markets of Trujillo due to the fact that she will obtain better prices. Another thing that she uses to improve her business is buying small pigs and raising them until they achieve a considerable size and a reasonable weight to be able to be sold for their meat. Narcisa Idelsa has 5 children who always help her in her business. But currently the five already have their own commitments and only she and her husband live together. With her first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in four installments she added stationary items to her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more animals to fatten and their sale

loans.name: Caciana

texts.es:
La socia Caciana, vive en la comunidad de Tambo real en el distrito de Zurite de la provincia de Anta, está ubicado a 1 y 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; la socia tiene 48 años de edad, ella tiene 5 hijos de, 30, 27, 20, 15, 13, años.

Nuestra socia y sus 02 hijos mayores quieren iniciar su propio negocio en la venta de lácteos, para lo cuál ella solicita el préstamo para comprar 03 vacas y así juntarlas con las de sus hijos, y hacer una empresa familiar, para que de está manera todos juntos puedan seguir  apoyando a los menores que aún están estudiando.

La socia desea ver a toda su familia trabajando con ella y designándose tareas dentro de la empresa familiar; mejorando su calidad de vida y soñando con un futuro digno y de dicha para cada uno de sus hijos.

Nuestra socia reconoce y valora el esfuerzo de los prestamistas y agradece gentilmente el apoyo brindado y promete la devolución del préstamo en el plazo correspondiente.
texts.en:
Caciana lives in the Tambo Real community in the Zurite district of the Anta province, which is located 1 hour and 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 48 years old and has 5 children who are 30, 27, 20, 15 and 13 years of age. She and her 2 older children want to start their own business selling milk products, for which she is requesting the loan so she can buy 3 cows and add them to her children's cows to thus make a family business. In this way, all of them together can continue to support the young ones who are still studying. She wants to see her whole family working with her and designating tasks within the family business, improving their quality of life and dreaming of a worthy future and happiness for each of her children. She recognizes and values the effort of the lenders. She kindly thanks them for their support and promises to repay the loan in the specified time period.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows and begin a business to sell milk products.

loans.name: Sien's Group

texts.en:
P. is a leader of a group of borrowers that consists of four members. She is a widow mother of three children: the first one is married and lives separately and the other two are students. She has owned a small fashion shop in front of Angkor Villa hotel since 1996 and she can earn up to $5 per day. She is famous for her down-to-earth skill in designing modern clothes; also, her shop is located in the middle main street.

Lately, she has taken out a loan to renovate her house. The other group members are: T., 42, who owns a small shop selling groceries, is applying the loan to invest in her selling; S., 31, who is a paddy rice trader, is looking for the loan to buy more corn and rice to stock for a while because today is the harvest season; and S., 38, who sells soft drinks to tours, is applying for a loan to buy more products for her shop. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To renovate a house

loans.name: Bayantsatsral

texts.en:
Bayantsatsral R. lives with his wife and three teenage children in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His children go to local public schools. Bayantsatsral and his wife run a small retail stall for women and men's clothing and shoes at the local market.

Bayantsatsral started the retail business in 2005 by selling clothes and shoes imported from Ereen, China, a border town with Mongolia. While he goes to Ereen to purchase new inventory, his wife manages the stall. Their business capital has increased from 700,000 MNT to 2,000,000 MNT ($1 MNT=1,500 MNT). Bayantsatsral requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen to increase his business inventory. Bayartsatsral and his wife hope to be able to afford university education for all their children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Ms. Evelyn F. is 49-years of age, married and has been an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). Her husband is a laborer and she has a food vending business.  In order to generate more income, she is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP for the expansion of her business. She dreams of having retirement savings and wants to build a concrete house someday.

loans.use: To expand a food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell household and basic need goods

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine O. is a 33-year-old mother of three children, ages 14, 10, and 7. All are in school and she is married to a police officer. Christine sells charcoal and sometimes makes dresses. She lives next to Nyamasaria slum near a Coptic church. She purchases the charcoal from trucks (lorries) that come around – bringing it from forests near Masi Mara.

Christine also owns six houses that she rents out. She hopes to use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more charcoal to sell. Her hopes for the future are for her business to enlarge and to sell out of a kiosk and maybe even a truck.

In this video, you can hear me greet Christine saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Christine responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Charcoal

loans.name: Union Collana Group

texts.es:
Doña Gloria Gregoria I. César tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos. Desde hace dos años y cuatro meses viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en el banco comunal “Unión Collana”, llamado así por el apoyo que tienen entre sí los once integrantes, quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. 
La señora Gloria narra que antes de conocer los beneficios de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ella y su esposo contaban como únicos ingresos los productos que le proporcionaba una vaca que le había sido obsequiada por su padre y una pequeña hectárea de cultivo, vendiendo los productos de la cosecha y el queso a los diferentes mercados de Chosica. Gloria queriendo brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, es que tiene la visión de adquirir crédito con el fin de comprar más ganado; así mismo acude a EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD para realizar una de sus grandes metas. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ella, su esposo y al apoyo de nuestra institución se hizo realidad el sueño de darles educación superior a sus cuatro hijos, además de instalar una pequeña tienda. Gloria es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha logrado sus propósitos, y con éste crédito implementará más su tienda, lo cual obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria Gregoria I. César tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos. Desde hace dos años y cuatro meses viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en el banco comunal “Unión Collana”, llamado así por el apoyo que tienen entre sí los once integrantes, quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. La señora Gloria narra que antes de conocer los beneficios de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ella y su esposo contaban como únicos ingresos los productos que le proporcionaba una vaca que le había sido obsequiada por su padre y una pequeña hectárea de cultivo, vendiendo los productos de la cosecha y el queso a los diferentes mercados de Chosica. Gloria queriendo brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, es que tiene la visión de adquirir crédito con el fin de comprar más ganado; así mismo acude a EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD para realizar una de sus grandes metas. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ella, su esposo y al apoyo de nuestra institución se hizo realidad el sueño de darles educación superior a sus cuatro hijos, además de instalar una pequeña tienda. Gloria es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha logrado sus propósitos, y con éste crédito implementará más su tienda, lo cual obtendrá mayores ingresos.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos

loans.name: Nasreen Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. A.. They have lived in Lahore, Pakistan, for more than 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for Punjabi foods. Nasreen baji is a kind-hearted lady. She tries to give happiness to everyone and her members are very happy with her kind behavior. Her husband is a local master tailor and runs a tailoring center in the community. He has three years of experience in this business. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband so that he is able to sew more clothes and complete orders on time. 

This group loan consists of four additional people:

Rubina baji and Safia baji each want a loan to buy materials (sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits) for their sweetmeats making and selling business.  
Farhat baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs and a mirror) for her barber shop.  
Sarwar baji wants a loan to buy sanitation supplies (pipes, taps) to resell.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Nasreen baji is standing on the right side of the photo showing the utensils Rubina baji uses to prepare the sweetmeat.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Marialita

texts.en: Marialita is a proud member of Paglaum MPC. She lives in Pay-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.She is 42, married and has 4 children.  She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store to make a living.  She has been in this business for several years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP per month.  She joined PMPC in 2009 to access loans and hopefully finance her business.  Now, she is requesting her first loan to purchase additional products to sell.  She desires to live comfortably and wants to be able to pay tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: Buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Fidel Simon

texts.es: Don Fidel O. tiene 48 años de edad, casado tiene tres hijos, dos ya son independiente solo tiene a cargo una hija de 12 años, habita en la comarca la gallina en el municipio de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, en casa propia. Los planes para con su familia es mejorar la vivienda y nivel de vida. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa de Carmen desde hace seis meses, como guardia de seguridad, además tiene un terreno en donde esta cultivando. Requiere de financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, en la parte de la Cocina comprar materiales de construccion como: cemento, bloque, reprisa otros materiales. Agradece a la Institución por brindarle la oportunidad de un Crédito, logrando cambio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Fidel O. is 48 years old, married, and has three children. The two oldest children are financially independent; the one remaining in his care is his 12 year old daughter. His family lives in their own home in the area of La Gallina in the town of Villa del Carmen in the district of Managua. Don Fidel plans to make home improvements in order to improve the living standards for his family.

For the past six months, he has been working as a security guard. He also owns a plot of land that he cultivates. He is requesting a home improvement loan so that he can purchase materials to renovate a kitchen, such as cement, blocks, shelving and other materials. Don Fidel thanks the institution for the opportunity to access a loan so that he can make these changes to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to remodel a kitchen

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Maribojoc, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Helen is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Helen is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia believes that hard work and patience are necessary to attain success in life. She manages a sari-sari store (community based store) in her village. Expanding her business is one goal to meet the needs of her family to improve their living conditions. She is married to Rolly, a construction worker. She and her husband work hard to support their children and grand children. The couple is blessed with two children who are married. They happily live in the simple village of Rizal in Santiago City.

Arsenia is glad that she is able to generate a monthly income of PHP10,000 from her store and food vending business. This has been a great help in meeting their daily needs. Arsenia wanted to develop her business and is hoping for a loan from KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP12,000. She aspires to earn more and save for her future and for emergencies.

loans.use: Increase business.

loans.name: Rich

texts.en:
Mr. Rich C., age 29 (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Vannem Bou, age 26, were married in 2005 and have one son. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Rich has been repairing sewing machines for 3 years. His wife has been a hairdresser for 2 months, but she doesn’t have enough materials for her business. So, Rich is asking for a loan of $1,000 so he wife can purchase materials for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his wife's beauty salon

loans.name: Bakhshali

texts.en:
Bakhshali N. is 47 years old. He is married and has four children. Since he was very young, he has been in the business of raising and selling cattle, which is why he has a lot of experience. He has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by AqroInvest Credit Union. He received a loan that he has used to purchase and raise young bulls in their area.

Today, Bakhshali has once again come to AqroInvest Credit Union for a loan to purchase young bulls to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase four young bulls
